Great place to go with Friends or Date Night. Everything is served tapas style. I would recommended ordering a couple of items and splitting it between your party so that you can try a little of everything. It's is a bit expensive but the food is defiantly worth it!

I really love this place. The food is top notch and something different. The service has always been good as well.

It does get crowded, but it is worth the wait. Maybe the best place in Charlotte.
Read More: http://eatitcharlotte.com/2017/07/10/good-food-on-montford/

When I see 4.5 stars on yelp with over 500 reviews, I pay attention.

We were looking for a nice spot for date night and some time for conversation. So...Good Food on Montford. 

First, the good...
The food was very tasty. We had 2 steamed buns (amazing), the fried chicken (very good), mushrooms (ok). 

The staff was very helpful and friendly. Our waiter could tell it was our first time right away and he helped us enjoy the evening. 

Now, the not as good...
It was very LOUD...perhaps that's just a friday night or maybe that's the decibel level every night, but we were overwhelmed by how loud it was. I think if we were there with a party or a double date we would not have minded, but as a couple, it was hard to think, much less talk. 

It was expensive...I know it's small plates/tapas, but based on my math, it should have been $$$ on yelp rather than $$. I simply didn't feel that the portions justified the price even though they tasted very good. 

I really wanted to like GFonM. And, If you love loud, small plates places where you need to like the food to feel good about how much you spent there, then Good Food on Montford is for you. 

I don't think we'll be back.

I went for the first time a couple of weeks ago (Jan 19th) with a girlfriend for dinner... we split the mussels (seriously, needed a loaf of bread and an extra stomach to sop up that AMAAAAAAAAZING sauce), the steamed bun (I could've eaten twelve, SO good), and a pasta & sausage dish... and then we had dessert (pots de creme for me)... I can't say enough good things about this place... lovely tapas, well made, well presented, served perfectly... excellent service, intimate setting, good wine list, no reservations so first come first served... I think I loved everything about this place! I'll be going back again and again!

I was driving around thinking about what i was going to eat when i stumbled upon this place, and I'm so glad i did. The food is simply amazing and the staff is pretty cool themselves. While there I had the gazpacho with avocado and crab salad and the potatoes gnocchi with bacon, brussels sprouts and chess (I know it may sound strange but you have to try it). I love the food and they laid back atmosphere, in other woods a nice date spot. On the other hand it can be a little pricey if your not paying attention but its worth the price. I will be back with no hesitations, I like this place and strongly recommend it.

What an awesome evening and fun dinner at a Good Food at Montford!!  We had the Charcuterie, Pome Frittes, Paneer, Scallops, Mussels and Apple Cobbler and all were simply delicious!  We can't wait to go back!!!

The service here is stellar! Very attentive staff and super upbeat and friendly environment. This is the biggest part of my reason for the five star rating. They serve tapas style so it's better to bring a few people so you can share and try a little of every dish. The food consists of southern cuisine and a few Asian fusion dishes as well. It takes around 2-3 dishes to fill you up. Their desserts are truly worth saving room for at the end. Every single dish I got was delicious and cook to perfection. The only dish I wasn't fond of was the gnocchi but it just my personal taste bud. I would definitely recommend this place! Also, it's super busy so I recommend trying to get their early or get a reservation down.

I'm very surprised to be writing this review of 2 stars as this was my favorite restaurant. Tonight, a Saturday we came around 5:30 and ordered 5 items. The first course-cheese came and was awesome. The second up was to be soup but pasta came next instead-no problem. But then as we were enjoying excellent pasta the soup came and was quickly followed by a steamed bun. We advised to slow down-we had too much too fast and things were going to get cold. We were told "the kitchen sends things when they are ready". 30 seconds later our fish course came too. Of the 5 items we ordered 4 of them, all the hot ones sitting on our small table at once. NOT HAPPY. We ate quickly to not have to eat cold soup or cold fish but after felt like we were in a hot dog eating contest. We did not get to enjoy 4 out of 5 items we ordered.  That being said, from what I recall actually tasting the food was good but the experience was awful. Past visits here were on weeknights when I was calling this my favorite restaurant, so I caution anyone coming here on a weekend as the focus is obviously on turning tables and NOT guest experience. Sad.

Delicious dinner! Highly recommend if you are ever in Charlotte. They open at 5:30pm. I think you should make reservations because we came on a Monday night and they were packed. We enjoyed the truffle fries, steamed pork bun, Korean BBQ, Buttermilk fried chicken and gnocchi with smashed spring peas. All were excellent. For dessert we had the Coconut Bibingka....out of this world! Will def come back when were in Charlotte again.

Good Food is GREAT food. Two to three small plates per person will more than likely be as filling as an entrée portion. 

I went with a group of 6 on a Friday and we were seated immediately. As long as you arrive within 30 minutes of opening you won't have to wait at all.

I recommend trying the pork belly bao (not too fatty), any fish dish, pomme frites, and parmesan gnocchi with rabbit (see photos). And of course, bring friends so you can try a little bit of everything!

** Minus one star because they made a big fuss about separate checks. The waitress reluctantly allowed US to calculate each person's tab down to the included tip.  What if I don't want to pay for someone else's alcohol? I understand the concept of sharing but it should just be an option without question.

This place is awesome. Yeh you probably have to wait, but that's what the bar is for and there are other places around to check out and grab a drink. The host and bartenders were so nice and very helpful with recommendations and assurance on getting us seated asap. We went pretty late since we were aware of the waits there. The restaurant was very clean, the food was superb, staff was super friendly, and location made the wait bearable. Looking forward to going back. No food recommendations here because everything was impressive. Seriously

Great food....service was lacking. Anniversary dinner came expecting a wait but we were seated right away...sat at the "chef's counter" which may have been the reason our server wasn't around much. We had 6 plates to share between the 2 of us and 2 desserts...surprisingly the pomes frites were the most memorable of the 6....probably the best fries we've ever eaten. The steamed bun was good but not as amazing as everyone says in my opinion, ñoquis were good and the sauce was superb. Desserts were very good both the peach cobbler and the cannoli cheese cake were excellent. Our only complaint was our server was hard to track down and seemed to stretched way to thin to provide adequate service to so many people..
Sitting at the chefs table we had a front row seat to watching the chef get angry that he had "12 plates and no runners"...as he dinged his bell over and over...maybe we just came on the wrong night
Every single plate we ordered was phenomenal. Finished off dinner with a Carmel Apple Cobbler.

This place was awesome!! The atmosphere is intimate and stylish, yet casual. It was perfect for walking in on a relaxing Friday night. As we settled in, our waitress informed us it was perfectly acceptable to order courses two at a time, or however we wanted. Cool.

For our first round, we got the cheese plate and the charcuterie. The cheese plate was great: nice selection of cheeses and interesting accompaniments like fresh honeycomb and truffle chutney. The charcuterie was more okay: it came with speck (kind of like fancy bologna, meh), saucisson (a step up from Pepperidge Farm) and an awesome fois gras and chicken liver mousse. Would love to see some other meats like sopprassata on this in the future.

Next we took a trip to Asia with the steamed bun and cold noodles. The five-spice-rubbed pork bun was packed with flavor and a nicely textured bun on the outside. It may have been a tad heavy on the hoisin, but we enjoyed it nonetheless. The cold noodles were an awesomely unique combination of braised pork, pickled watermelon, cashews and sesame dressing--a nice chefy take on a traditional dish.

By the time we finished this, we were stuffed, even though we wanted to order more. Loved the concept and the execution here. Only criticism: every time we laid our forks down, a waiter appeared and tried to snatch our plates away. It made us feel extremely rushed, but I guess it was Friday night at dinner time.

Can't wait to go back!

I went here a few nights ago and sat at the bar. Although there were open tables, there was no host and after standing for a few minutes decided the bar may be a better option.  It took a few minutes to be acknowledged but after that service was prompt and the drinks were amazing.
The food was really good. We ordered the mussels, gnocchi, fried chicken, and pork carnitas.  The green curry sauce could have been a little thicker and more flavor. The pork carnitas tasted like plain BBQ and this was my least favorite dish. The gnocchi and fried chicken was outstanding; perfectly balanced flavors and 2 of the best dishes that I've had in Charlotte.

Good Food Good Vibe Good NEWS, I LOVE GOOD FOOD ON MONTFORD. I've eaten at Good Food a total of THREE times as I had to wait it out to ensure consistency before providing my review given by a Food Service All Around Experience Snob such as myself.

My husband read about Good Food in one of those Free Charlotte magazines he picked up at HT. He decided to take me on our DateNight one month and to our surprise this place was PACKED, small & didn't take reservations which sorta threw me off but I decided to keep a clear mind and NOT JUDGE from that. We ended up finding seats at the bar and the bartender was extremely nice and explained the concept of shared plates. We jumped right in as we LOVE tapas style and are very familiar coming from BIG CITIES (Chicago and NYC) . We ordered a sleuth of items from mussels to salads to wine to cocktails I mean I lot of stuff and we didn't NOT enjoy any of the many items ordered. Like how often does this happen? So needless to say we enjoyed our Datenight at the bar and got over the chance to dine at a table. 
The 2nd visit was the same and we even got there early in our eyes (6pm ish on Friday), we ended up at the bar again but the food was still good.
My 3rd visit happened earlier this month (last week March 2,2016) as I took my neighbor to celebrate her 8th birthday (she is actually 32 but since her bday is leap year she has only had 8 birthdays so far :-) 
We had a nice spread we started with the tempura broccoli with pickled jalapeño which was OK it lacked flavor such as seasoning in the breading or some additional pickled jalapeño which could've made it a perfect dish. Next we had the falafel which was super GOOD, my friend then went with the meat Ragu and rice stuffed cabbage (I don't eat meat/ land animals as I'm Pescaterian) which she enjoyed and I went with the Fresh CATCH & it was SOOOOOOOOO GOOD just PERFECT. My friend took a Fresh Catch to go after tasting mine and she was Soo full so she got it to go. For dessert we shared the carrot cake Twinkie which was AMAZING the cream cheese ice cream was undoubtably a perfect pair. 
I'm sure to BE BACK

NOT A PLACE FOR THOSE WITH DIETARY CONCERNS!!

First let me say, if I were basing my rating on my opinion alone, it would be 4 stars.  However, I didn't experience this restaurant alone; I was with my gluten/dairy-free (and practically vegetarian) wife.  There was NOTHING on the menu for her to eat.  When we spoke to the wait-staff about our predicament and requested something very simple (e.g., sauteed vegetables or something like that), the persons response was...sorry but, no.  So, I'm giving this restaurant a lower rating solely on the fact that I believe a "gourmet" place like this should be able to accommodate simple requests.  To make matters worse, the wait-person actually said to us, that next time we come, we should call ahead (around 2 or 3pm) and mention our needs to the chef.  Yeah....right.

By the way, I had the pork tenderloin with polenta.  Superb is an understatement.

We had a good experience here, I had the truffle fries and the pork steamed buns which I enjoyed. My husband ordered a few items as well and all were thoroughly enjoyed. It was a Saturday night but the wait was surprisingly short though a majority of the tables had patrons. The only reason not to give this place 5 stars was the service. At times it seemed as if we were being overlooked by our waiter in regards to a long wait for our food, not checking in on us or providing us with refills timely. The hostess that seated us was also not the friendliest, tossing the menus on the table instead of handing them to us. Overall the food was good, atmosphere and parking/location were okay, not sure if we will return or not. What I did like was that we could walk right across the street after dinner and do some bowling.

Got here on a Saturday night and there was no wait at 8 pm!
Before I go on I just wanted to mention that I read a lot of reviews complaining about them not splitting checks.......it's written on their menu that they don't split checks!!! Maybe they added it after a lot of people complained? But yes it's there so don't be offended if they refuse to!
The sauteed mushrooms are delicious, add some lemon and it will take it up a notch!
The shrimp was good, nicely spiced. The naan went well with the lentils but not with the shrimp. The Korean beef was delicious! For dessert we had the brownie with biscoff ice cream which was oh so good!!

Finally checked out Good Food and it was Good! I love the inside of the place...the exposed brick, dark setting and lively with conversation amongst the tables. Menu is set up with apps, small plates and large plates and meant to be shared like tapas. Ordered 2 apps(Mixed Green & Salmon), 3 small plates (Scallops, Steamed Bun, Cavatappi) and 1 large plate (pork tenderloin) for the two of us. All food comes out as soon as it's ready, so if you want it delivered in a specific order, space out your ordering. 

Service is spot on and you'll see multiple friendly faces at your table. My favorites were the Salmon, Scallop & Pork Tenderloin. Least favorite was the Steamed Bun, though this seems to be the most popular dish as I saw about 20 of them leave the kitchen while we were eating. We ended the meal with the bread pudding...so good, and the cheesecake ice cream was a perfect addition. 

Definitely a place I'll return with family and friends! Great date place too! Expect to wait 1 hour + on weekends during peak times as they do not take reservations. Go on a Wed or Thurs and your 7pm arrival will be greeted with a quick table!

Excellent, though potentially pricey.

Looks like the small plates craze is still going strong in Charlotte. This place is packed with ladies on a night out, but its good for anyone for a craving for delicious food.

We waltzed in on a Tuesday night at about 6pm - there was only about one other table of people. My coworkers joked that once again I had brought them to a place where no one else eats, but by the time we left, the place was just about packed.

Ambiance is good - a bit dark but we sat by the windows. Nice warm feeling. 

We tried a bunch of dishes - our favorites were the much acclaimed pork bun, a big bowl of mussels in a green curry, and a fettucine dish. We also tried a charcuterie plate - the chicken liver pate was good but the meats were mediocre. I'm not sure if they make their own meats, if they do, they should look for a different supplier. Not horrible, just not interesting. Scallops over butternut squash risotto was good. I felt the dish was excellent but I guess its hard to make an interesting scallop dish. Pork tenderloin was juicy and had a nice smoky taste. The accompanying fried mac and cheese was tasty - its mac and cheese with a crunchy exterior. Once its on  the plate, its like any other mac and cheese.

No problem on the bread service - our waitress brought several rounds of bread for us to sop up the green curry sauce.

We ended with two deserts, a cobbler and a pear tart with avocado ice cream. The cobbler was traditional and delicious with vanilla ice cream. The tart was so so and the avocado ice cream was very avocadoish, which is I suppose a good thing.

I would have liked to have seen some lower priced wine, but the selection was interesting and we had a delicious bottle of pinot noir. The cocktails were also decently crafted.

TAPAS. I will say it till I'm blue in the face, I believe tapas places should be $$$ due to the fact that you have to order multiple dishes to tastefully feel satisfied. that said, Good Food really lives up to its name. Great Tapas and great drinks. Go only for special occasions. If you don't have a reservation, then it will be hit or miss if you can be seated. We have left several times do to the face that the wait would be over an hour for a seat. The atmosphere is upscale, after work, young professional. If that makes sense lol.

I'll start this review off by saying after two separate experiences at Good Food, I'm going to have to give it 4 Stars.

The fisrt time I went to Good Food I wouldn't have dared to say a bad thing about it. The experience was perfect. Perfect food, perfect, wine, perfect service. Everything was spot on.

Because of that first experience, i was SUPER excited to bring a Charlotte visitor to Good Food so she could experience the awesomeness as well. Unfortunately, this go-round fell a little flat for all of us there.

When we arrived, we put our name down and went next door to grab a drink while we waited. This was a Friday night so we expected a little bit of a wait! After being seated, we saw there were a few menu changes that we were excited about. 

There were a few standout dishes - the Garganelli pasta with sausage, garlic, tomato, the korean beef and crispy rice, and the steamed bun. But there were just as many misses - the scallops with acquerello risotto and the fried oysters to name a couple. They just straight up lacked salt, something I hadn't seen from Good Food in the past. Our server did remove the fried oysters from our plate, which we appreciated.

Other than that, the service was a bit on the meh side. Most of the dishes were brought out by runners who would just drop the plate and leave. Because of the different dishes we were eating, it would have been nice to get a description of the dish as well as clean plates!

I'm hoping that this second experience was just a hiccup and whenever I'm back  I'll be blown away again like the first time.

Easily the best restaurant in Charlotte IMO. I really just can't say enough good things about it. Our order goes
1. Garganelli
2. Steamed Bun (The best)
3. P.E.I. Mussels
4. Brownie and/or Apple Tart

Just go, order these things in any order you choose and thank me later

Great time..Got there at 5:20 pm , already a small crowd waiting to get in, about 15-20 people when they opened the doors..Seated quickly, waitress  on point... Shared around 10 plates including 2 desserts between 3 people..Highlights were all the pastas, pork belly bun, cheese plate and the desserts. Crispy Oysters were nothing special, fries average..Alcohol always good with dinner,  but 3 drinks and 1 beer added almost $ 50 to the bill, will probably just drink water next visit. Highly recommend Good Food on Montford !!!

The food here is phenomenal! I was in town for business and stopped here because of the amazing reviews I read. I ordered the chicken lettuce wraps, frisée salad and delicious banana bread- all delicious! The only reason I gave 4 stars and not 5 was because I was sitting at the bar and the bartender wasn't super attentive. All in all, I loved this place!

Great menu and "good food"! Service is always great and every time I went there I promised myself to write them five stars! Finally doing this! Great place to meeting and lunch service is fast and fresh! Hit that place you won't get disappointed.

Sat at the bar with my wife for an early meal. Food was great and bartenders were happy to share their favorite plates. Very popular- there was a line to get in before they opened! Will definitely be back.

Great food! Every bite is awesome. But, OMG, the noise level! It's all concrete and hard surfaces, so it's about impossible to hear your dinner companions. We loved the food, but don't go again because it's so noisy.

5 stars! I visited Good Food after a client suggested I go there for my birthday. It really was THAT GOOD.
Pros - Delicious! They are "small" plates but really we were all WAY stuffed with one per person and maybe one to share. The staff was kind.
Cons - The wait is always incredibly long so make a reservation. It's pricey but worth it and also quite loud. 
I definitely feel the need to try it again soon!

It's been over 6 years and it's about time I update my review. I am happy to revise my review for Good Food to declare the food became Gooder. :) I have been a couple times in the last year and the food has been very delicious and the service has been good. The mushrooms side are delicious and I've enjoyed catch of the day and gnocchi tremendously. My friend Rachel loves the falafel too. 

I only dock a star because I wish that they took reservations since it's always packed because of the excellent Yelp reviews. You really have to get there AT 5:15 before they open at 5:30 if you don't want a 1-2 hour wait. I've only had one time when we were able to walk in at 6 because it was really rainy on a Friday. If they had Open Table or another reservation system we would actually go a lot more often.

We love this restaurant! It is a bit tricky to find but a GPS got there with no trouble. The exterior of the building  is unimpressive but what awaits inside is perfect. I loved the ambiance. We were with a party of eight and reservations are not excepted. So we went early and waited until they opened. Our table was set nicely and we had a great time. Everyone seemed to love all the dishes that they ordered. This is a small plate type of restaurant and after three plates my husband and I were both satiated.  The restaurant doesn't accept individual checks so only one is presented and you have to decide how it must be split up. That is the only negative about Good Food on Montford. I will be bringing out of town guests here often.

Excellent feel and great bar. Attack the menu as a tasting menu as the portions are that size. Share with the person you are with and experience a lot of what they have to offer. The bar staff was excellent. The scallops and tenderloin were my favorite.

The name fits.  Its ridiculous I've never written a review of this place.  Probably my favorite restaurant in Charlotte city limits.  Its been a little while since I've been so I'm not really going to review the food.  I just saw that they don't hold the #1 spot as per best place in Charlotte and I thoroughly disagree, hope this bump helps.

An evolving menu and locally sourced ingredients all while being served in a non pretentious atmosphere.  If executed right, that's all I want in life.  Unless its an important date out I don't need the quiet candle lit vibe.

That is it, I'm cutting this one short.  I'll update soon hopefully.  Maybe you should read some other current reviews to get an idea of whats on the menu right now.  Heads up though, no reservations.  You have to go put your name on the list and it can take some time as this place is pretty small.  I'd recommend putting your name up and if its more the 45 mins or so grab a beer close by.  They'll call you.  But do buy a cocktail when you are seated.  Bat staff is spot on.

If you like tappas then this is the place for you. I recommend literally trying everything on the menu. The quality and flavors of the food are unreal. The atmosphere is super hip and relaxing and the service is great.
Decent food, had a hard time trying to order as the menu is very selective. Wouldn't day the food was great buy decent.
Never disappoints. Must eats- steamed buns and the mussels. The overall menu does change with the seasons, so there is always something new to try.

Fun atmosphere, great tasting small plates, nice selection of wine, friendly staff. The food is beautiful and delicious. We shared about 7 dishes between the three of us and were able to try a lot of yummy things plus have room for dessert.

i really love this fun and hip foodie place in charlotte. it is always busy and lively; it's a bit loud   but only due to all the conversations. 

pommes frites: truffle oil, parmesan cheese 
   a must try for the kids and big hit

sauteed mushrooms: fresh herbs, sliced garlic
   a must try for my daughter and another big hit

garganelli: house-made italian sausage, toasted garlic and tomato
   very, very good

pork carnitas: sweet potato arepas, goat cheese, jalapeno, bbq sauce
   i get this every time and i will keep getting this each time in the future

steamed bun: pork belly, hoisin, pickled vegetables
   i reason i went in the first place, did not disappoint

korean beef: crispy rice, scallion kimchi, gochujang
   a personal favorite for me

p.e.i. mussels: green curry, coconut milk, cilantro
   family really enjoyed

grilled shrimp: beet tahini, belugal lentils, creme fraiche, naan
   big hit with everyone at the table

pan seared scallops: l.i cheese stuffed peppers, green chili foam
   the family favorite 

chocolate creme de pot
   so good... definitely try... from not a big dessert guy.

this maybe isn't a best kid friendly place but my children really like good eats...

I found Good Food through the high recommendations on Yelp, and I'm so glad I did! We usually go to Montford for the nightlife, but I was so glad to find this restaurant tucked onto one of our favorite streets.

The restaurant is chic and inviting, we were greeted almost instantly and only had to wait about 5 minutes while they set a table for us. 

While the beer and wine-by-the-glass lists were not huge, they were definitely very good for what we wanted. 

We decided to do tapas instead of ordering plates for ourselves, and even then, we had a hard time choosing between all of the small plates. We went with the cheese platter, the mussels in the coconut curry and the Morrocan Spiced Chicken Confit. The cheeses were each paired with a sauce; honeycomb, truffle or chutney to spread on a piece of toast to really bring out the flavor. As many other people have said, the mussels and chicken were both amazing. The chef clearly has a way of playing with flavors, and each of the dishes tasted like nothing I've ever had before. 

I had a great evening here and will be sure to go back again! I high recommend Good Food.
Love this place. Make sure you get the steamed bun. Parking and seating are both limited. I recommend going during the week.

Known for dinner, but Perfect for sharing a couple of small plates and wine with an old friend after work. Server was so patient, allowing us to sit and chat long after we finished our second glance of wine! He also suggested wines and let me taste one I wasn't sure of. Reservations recommended, even if plan to use only a high top table. Despite a full house, conversation was easy.

First off, this is a tapas place. When I decided to come here, I wasn't aware of it and thought it was an American place as it labels itself. So my friends and I came on a Friday night for a send off dinner. The wait was short since we got here before 7. The dishes tasted fine - the fried chicken and mussel were great, but the pasta, lettuce wrap, Korean beef and octopus were poorly seasoned; some were too salty and some lacked flavor. The dishes were $10-13 each; we thought the pricing was reasonable until we saw the octopus, which we waited for over 30 minutes but ended up disappointing - the dish wasn't even half full on the plate and was cooked way too salty and even a little burned. 

I know a two stars from one review won't make a great impact but I just want to make my case.

I can't believe I've been in Charlotte for 12 years and JUST went to Good Food for the first time last night!  It was beyond my expectations.  My friend and I enjoyed Gnochhi, Steamed Bun, Mussels and Halibut.  Everything was delicious.  Excellent service, they didn't rush us through the meal.  I wanted to lick the plates clean.  We arrived at 5:30 on a Monday, right when it opened.  No wait.  I understand it's very hard to get in on the weekend, so I will try to go again early weekday.  Thanks for an awesome meal!
Oooo this place is so tasty. come with a group that you don't mind sharing with. You'll want to taste every plate.

Such a fun night! And my 500th review!!! 

Oh snap!!! Let me do my happy dance....

Okay...back to the review! 

I met girlfriends here for dinner. We ordered a little bit of everything and sampled not one but three desserts. Everything was delicious!! 

We started with the beef carpaccio snd pomme frites. I loved the fried pickles on the carpaccio and the pomme frites were better than expected. Like several other reviews have mentioned...make sure you get an order! 

For our meal, we decided on the Parmesan gnocchi, Garganeili and Pork carnitas. Each one was excellent but my favorites of the night were the Garganeili with the house made Italian sausage which was packed with so much flavor...and the pork carnitas with the pickled cabbage and queso fresco!!! Yummy!!!

For dessert we ordered the pot de creme (chocolate and expresso custard), the apple cobbler and the chocolate brownie with biscoff ice cream....all were so darn good!!! But my goodness that biscoff ice cream was heavenly. 

Such a cool place, with excellent food. I look forward to my next visit.

This place has absolutely GREAT food. I've almost tried each single small dish they have and I haven't found one I didn't like. Ingredients felt really fresh, size was decent for a higher end tapas-style plate. I usually have 3-4 and a glass of wine. My average check runs a little over $50 which is not bad considering the quality and the taste of their food. Any plate is a safe bet and if you are disappointed from one (which I never did) you'll end up having 2-3 more that will make up for it. Nice ambiance too. 
For its category - one of the best I've ever been.

My favorite restaurant BY FAR in Charlotte and maybe the best restaurant anywhere in the SE.  I know those are strong words, but believe me the food quality is out of this world good.  I can keep listing adjectives to describe the place, but they will simply not do it justice.  There are so many great dishes here, let me try to recap some of my favorites:

Gnocchi - I am a huge gnocchi fan in general and this may be the best I've ever had.  It comes with a great cream sauce, the pasta itself is perfectly soft, just enough cheese and chunks of bacon.  Simply incredible.  Just getting this dish alone is worth coming here.

Lamb Belly - Wow.  The flavors in this dish are amazing.  So many things happening here and the lamb is crunchy yet soft, awesome, awesome dish.

Pork Tenderloin - I have NEVER had pork this tender.  EVER.  Perfectly seasoned and perfectly prepared.  The chorizo hash that accompanies is really good as well.  This is a must order.

Pork Bun - You may not think this is the thing to get, but you would be wrong.  You have to order this dish.  The bun is puffy and soft and the meat inside is so flavorful.  Love this dish.

Pomme Frites - Excellent french fries.  Just thick enough, great crunch, great seasoning.  I LOVE their fries.

Are you starting to get the point.  This is a never ending list.  EVERY dish here is at the very least really really good and at most heavenly perfection.

Cool atmosphere, it's normally pretty busy, good service though as everyone is very friendly.  Good drinks as well, I actually really like their Pom Margarita...  I would literally go there once a week if I lived in Charlotte.

I will come back here EVERY chance I have.  Unbelievable restaurant.

Pappardelle with Braised Lamb Cheeks. Go back and read that first sentence again. Now I need you to read it out loud and one more time for good measure. Do you have it memorized? Ok now grab your keys and head straight over to Good Food on Montford and order it!!!!! Go now and go quickly. I promise you will not regret it. This dish was by far one of the best pasta dishes I have ever tasted. The pasta was fresh, cooked al dente, the lamb cheeks melted in my mouth and the sauce was thick, rich and decadent. The dish was so good I ordered it twice. In fact I almost ordered it a third time until my husband quickly reminded me that we had 5 other dishes coming. Damn I hate when he interferes with my Epicurean encounters.  

The other dishes were great but honestly the pasta dish was an out of body experience.  Next time I will forgo the salads and Falafel. The Salad was nothing special and unfortunately after being in the Middle East, I have become a Falafel snob. 

The Korean Beef was great, the Steamed Bun with Pork Belly was good and the Scallops and Polenta was to die for. The scallops themselves were cooked to perfection. 

My only gripe is the place is always crowded and rather loud but the good food usually drowns out the chatter.

I have a favorite tapas place back home,
But good food might actually beat that place. Everything we had was delicious and the service was great. You can't make reservations and it fills up fast, but the food is worth the wait.

Went on a Monday because I heard weekends are like an hour wait and they don't do reservations. Good atmosphere and awesome food. Steamed buns are ridiculously good. Order the house smoked bourbon with mint julep. Refreshing and reminds me of a mojito. Tie for dessert between the banana bread and cannoli cheesecake.

The food was definitely good, but the serving size vs the cost of the food was disproportionate. For an adult male, I'd suggest planning on eating at least 3-4 tapas in order to prevent yourself from leaving hungry.

Came here on Monday night at 930 with parents after a long weekend. This was the best place we ate all weekend and really enjoyed not only the food but the service.  Make sure to try the mushrooms sweet and sour soup and basically everything.  You should try this place.  Great tapas idea

Not sure what I can add to the other ravings, other than I agree. The Steamed Bun is awesome, as are the scallops. I'm not really a tapas kind of guy in general, but the food is so great tasting that I am now a convert. They have a great waiting area outside in addition to the nice bar. It's easy to grab a beer from the bar and take it outside. Great service every time we visit as well. Just go, you'll be glad you did. And remember to order the Steamed Bun.
Good selection of beer on tap and the taps plates were amazing. Great playing service and a vibe.

We were quoted a wait time of 1-1.5 hours and ended up waiting close to two hours, because we didn't know we could check in to the waitlist through Yelp (that's our fault). We gave in to the sunken cost of time and super glad we did. Food was amazing! This is a tapas type place where dishes are served appetizer-sized, and diners are encouraged to share. We started off with the usual warm bread and oil/vinegar dip. Ordered the pork belly buns, shrimp and lentils, curry mussels, gnocchi, and mushrooms. I highly recommend the buns and mussels. I could eat them all day. I love mushrooms, and the mushroom dish surprised me with the assortment. So yummy. I happen to love potatoes too, and gnocchi tasted like a loaded baked potato... but in gnocchi form, hahah. My least favorite was the shrimp dish. While cooked well, the lentils didn't seem to match the shrimp. Unfortunately, didn't have room for dessert, but there's always next time! Service was top notch.

Truly one of my favorite restaurants of all time! Good Food is an upscale tapas restaurant with a variety of delicious options for any type of eater. They don't take reservations so I definitely recommend getting there right when they open at 5:30pm if you don't want to have to wait. Tonight I went with four people and we ordered the following:  the pommes frites (truffle fries), garganelli (x2), pork carnitas, steamed bun (x2), Korean beef, mussels, and scallops. My favorites were definitely the truffle fries, the garganelli and the mussels (the curry broth is amazing). For dessert we had the chocolate brownie and peach cobbler. It was plenty of food for 4 people and the bill was around $130 which I thought was very reasonable. They also had a great wine list- we ordered the Amarone which I don't normally see on many menus. Definitely worth visiting next time you're in Charlotte!

More like Great Food on Montford!

Since I have been on yelp, I believe that Good Food on Montford has been ranked #1 in Charlotte on yelp.  I finally figured out why, now I need to figure out why it took me so long to eat here.  So they don't take reservations, and we are told by the greeter at the door, who looks like a kinder, gentler version of Ted Nugent, that there is an hour wait.  We give our name and head to the bar trying to find a place to stand and order drinks.  Great service at the bar and not a half hour goes by before "Ted" comes over to get us to our table.

Rachel is our server and she explains the whole tapas style of the restaurant and makes suggestions as well as discusses specials.  She says that most people order 3 or 4 items typically.  Well by the time that we are done, we have ordered 8 items and while everything had great flavors and was expertly prepared, my favorites are the confit of lamb belly and the arctic char appetizer.  Also, the cheese plate was the perfect amount for desert, as we bypassed the typical desert fare to finish off the meal.  The wife really enjoyed the steamed bun and the scallop, but we both felt that everything was really well prepared.

This place is really a gem for Charlotte, and clearly they are humble as well.

Seriously, Great Food on Montford!

We've been here twice: First time, had great food. Second time, we never even got seated. We waited 30+ minutes (after being told 15), and saw multiple different groups walk in after us (we were a group of 2, they were 4), ask for a table, and they were seated before us. We were visibly waiting the entire time... not sure what their host was thinking, but I have no intention of returning. There are plenty of other great restaurants in Charlotte that cater to paying customers.

Our waiter wasn't the best. I also wasnt a fan of the bill. They do not split the bill between the parties. They instead put everything together and you have to tell them how much to put on each card. The desert was awesome!! Food was good and drinks were awesome! Just the other two things threw me off...

I have been wanting to get over to GFOM for quite a while to check it out.  So finally, I was in the neighborhood around  6 pm and decided to stop in for a beverage and an appetizer.  

I perused the menu and decided to try the Green Curry Mussels. I absolutely loved the green curry broth and the mussels that were perfectly cooked. This was served with a side of toast, which was quickly gone as I used it to sop up that delicious curry. Thankfully, one of the servers noticed that my bread was gone and brought me some more so that I could enjoy more of the yummy curry broth after all my mussels were gone. 

I love the décor of the place and on a quiet night, this would be a great date place.  However, since I was by myself on this visit, I chose to sit at the bar. On the night of my visit Jonathan the bartender was very attentive and made sure I had everything I needed to enjoy my visit.  

I didn't try any of the cocktails this time, but I definitely saw some delicious looking concoctions on the menu.  If you have not yet been over to GFOM, you should stop in sometime to give them a try. If you want to avoid the crowds that were mentioned by the other reviewers, do like I did and head over there early.

I have visited GFOM four times.  I love the food, I think it is a little expensive.  Our check average was $66 without tip.  So, be prepared if you are one of those people that love to graze and order everything your heart desires!  Tonight I tried the pork bun and it was delicious.  I sometimes get hooked on an item in a restaurant and this is one of those times.  The pork bun was dripping with natural juices from the pork and hoisin sauce and then you would get a crisp bite from pickled veggies.  It was served on a cute little square cutting board, I would lift the cutting board to my mouth so it wouldn't drip down my chin.  YUMMY!
One complaint is they do not do separate checks, which in this day and time with computers, it's so much easier.  If you haven't been to GFOM, strap your wallet on and go have a great meal!
Everything was amazing!   From the Carpaccio to the Falafel to the Pork Carnitas. Highly recommend - it's worth the wait!

Good Food stands true to their name.  All through my meal with four others, all we kept saying was, "MMM!  This is so good!"  I've been recommended by other Charlotteans to check this place out and decided it would be a great opportunity to go for dinner with some out-of-town guests.

The decor is super cute and welcoming and the host was just plain awesome.  He was funny and accommodating in a great, friendly way.  We were seated in no time, despite it being a busy Saturday night and proceeded to order 1-2 dishes per person and some yummy cocktails.  To some it up, their portions to me are just right (although probably small by other Southern standards), their cocktails are strong and their sauces are just plain delicious.  All of their pasta dishes were really tasty and would recommend if you're looking to just order 1 plate.

No doubt, I will be back there very soon.  Cheers to good, affordable food in Charlotte!

We tried going here last weekend. When we arrived we were told there was a 30 minute wait. After nearly an hour and a half we were still waiting and no information as to why the wait was taking so long. We left and had a fabulous dinner somewhere else without the line. Maybe someday we'll try again but having that much time wasted is super annoying.

Go early! We waited an hour and a half for a table for 2 but it was worth the wait. Order a Good Karma at the bar and relax while waiting for a table. 

I had the cheese plate and charcuterie plate - the fois gras chicken liver mousse was to die for! I also had the confit lamb belly with freekeh which was heaven in my mouth. I wanted to try everything on the menu - my friends also recommend the falafel, risotto, and steamed pork bun - I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in Charlotte!

I can't get Good Food out of my mind so yes you guessed it just like the name says this is "Good Food".  I really love the whole experience from the moment I walked in.  The hostess was friendly,  the atmosphere was great dimmed lighting gave a romantic feel but overall this place is just hip.  It's classy but comfortable and all of the staff will make you feel at home.  They do not take reservations so be prepared to wait especially on a weekend night.  I visited on a Thurs. night had to wait about ten minutes which was nothing plus I always enjoy checking out the bar in a new place.  The bartender was very friendly and did not go wrong when she asked my how dirty I wanted my martini on a scale from 1 to 5 umm 5 please and thank you for asking. Just when I didn't think my dirty martini could get any better yup you guessed it blue cheese stuffed olives I was already in heaven.  

Now for the food.  What is great about the food is it's served tapas style so you have the opportunity to try all kinds of dishes.  A few of the dishes that I thought were yelp worthy quail lettuce wraps, the gnocchi with brussel sprouts and cream sauce this dish was addicting I think I could have eaten the whole order all by myself.  I also enjoyed the steamed bun with pork belly.  Save room for dessert because the strawberry cheesecake is so worth it (unfortunately I think it was a special so hopefully they bring it back real soon!)

Finally made it out for an early dinner at Good Food. Can't believe it has taken me this long to check it out so I can write this review. Seeing as how this is one of Crown Town's more popular spots, the time was nigh to get in and sample the fare. A small, and plain building. Not too much going on inside. Just tables, booths, high-tops, and bar seating. Such close quarters that the aromas from the kitchen fill the dining area and inhabit your clothes. Not a bad characteristic. 

First off, I have to express my love for these guys having Northcoast's Scrimshaw Pilsner on draught. Not a common tale for most places in town. This alone sets the bar apart from the rest. I can recognize that tap handle from anywhere....5/5 for this. 

Ordered a smattering from the menu. 

Cheese plate: 4/5. Camembert, bleu, honeycomb, fig spread and two others I can't recall. Served with grilled bread. No combination that was undesirable. 

Falafel: 3/5. Rather plain, and the greek yogurt on top seemed to add to the plainness. 5/5 for presentation, though. 

Pork Bun: Unreal. 5/5. Perfect texture, flavor and presentation. I was absolutely thrilled. 

Corn Rissotto: 4/5 Sweet, and wholesome. Nothing over the top, but just right. A rather large portion, too. 

Gnocchi: 5/5. Just perfect. Amazing flavor and all of the mushrooms were wonderful. I didn't want it end. The addition of the chicken was fine, but could have gone without. 

Dessert: Apple cobbler with seasonal ice cream 3/5. Just nothing groundbreaking here. Presentation was fine, flavors were fine, but just didn't seem to have that special element. 

We made it in at 5:40, right after they opened. I would emulate this again. Nice having an early dinner and missing most of the crowd. Service was incredible and so fast. Very knowledgeable about the menu. 

Very much looking forward to returning!
Came here for lunch with my brother the other day. Service is fast and friendly, food is reasonably priced with good portions.

I've lived just down the road from Good Food for a couple years, yet had been deterred from dining there out of concern for the long wait times and inability to make reservation.  Well, after dining there this week, I'm regretting that I waited so long.  We arrived at 6:30pm on a Tuesday and were seated immediately.  The interior is cozy and well decorated with open views of the kitchen.  

Roasted garlic cloves and balsamic vinegar were in small dishes on the table, and warm fresh bread was soon delivered.   The two of us shared five different tapas, which proved to be a good amount without leaving us uncomfortably full.

1. Arugula Salad: the combination of pears, goat cheese, pistachios, and balsamic maple dressing was an excellent start.

2. Mussels:  You get a large portion for the price and the thai curry seasoning is unique.  You'll want to ask for extra bread to soak up the indulgent sauce.

3. Lamb Cheek Pasta:  Oh my gosh!  The best dish of the night!  I read multiple reviews that stressed the incredibleness of the pasta, and they were spot on.  Rich, well seasoned, and the best bowl of pasta I've had in quite some time.

4. Crispy Quail Lettuce Wraps:  This was the only dish we ordered that I was not especially impressed with.  It wasn't bad, it just wasn't all that special.  The quail was grilled, not crispy like I had imagined.

5. Sea Bass Special:  The crispy vegetable cake and fruit chutney were my favorite components on the plate.  The fish was just slightly dry.  $14 for a very small plate seemed a bit steep.

The menu is full over unique and delicious sounding small plates, and I'll definitely be back.   Given the size of the portions, I think it's best to share each plate between two people.  Trying to split things 3 ways would be tough.

We have been here 3 times and we love it!  The food is unique small plates-atmosphere is trending and fresh. The staff is knowledgeable making suggestions if needed. The old fashions are GREAT!  It can get crowed but very worth the wait!

Great food with amazing variety of small plates. Knowledgable and efficient staff. Food cooked to order but with very little wait time. We were visiting from out of town and would definitely recommend. Order the mushrooms and the gnocchi!

We used the app to save our spot in line and didn't have to wait. Cocktails were alright but not worth the price. The food was great. Steamed bun was phenomenal. Pomme frites were super crispy. Gnocchi was the best I have ever had.

GREAT date night atmosphere!  They always have great suggestions for wine and change up the menu with the seasons.  Sitting at the bar and having one tapas at a time is my favorite way to go!  Share with a friend and sample array of great food.

The name of this place sure does live up to the food, as in yes, this place  offers up some really good food on Montford here in CLT. The menu offers a wide array of options, a little bit of everything. Personal favorites include the Steamed Bun and Falafel, they're must haves! Good Food on Montford is a great date night spot too, I really enjoyed the esthetic inside with all the wood work and lighting, its a warm and fun place for sure!

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. Ironically it's called 'Good Food', but that's exactly what it is. The flavors are on point and the service has always been great every time I've been there. Honestly, I could make recommendations on which dishes to try, but they're all pretty good. You can't go wrong.

This is a hot spot right now - so waits are long on key nights - Thurs, Fri and Sat after 6pm you will likely have up to a 2 hour wait and the bar is not very big.  The parking lots are also pretty small too, so finding a spot can take a minute.

I loved the Fig Smash cocktail - really yummy! but then I am a fig fanatic. 

The dining room is loud but cozy. The plates are all small and share-able - really delish. I would have to call out the Steamed Bun, the truffle pommes frites, braised duck with fettuccine and the farfalle.

They don't take reservations, so you have to basically show up and put your name in. 

I would definitely come back , but I think I will plan for less popular nights of the week. My last visit was on Friday and the place was crazy. I showed up early to meet a friend and put in our name for a group of 6- I sat at the bar and enjoyed some drinks while we waited for the table to be ready. 

Special kudos to the server who gave us some of his "secret sauce"!

The food is as good as everyone says it is and service is friendly and efficient. The room is a bit lively but unless you are a senior and wear a hearing aid you can hear your dinner companions without a problem. The crowd was 35 - 45 years old the evening I was there. The prices were moderate for the level of quality; and it is a lot cheaper than Barrington's and almost as good.
12/2016 Still one of my favorites for drinks and a causal meal with my wife. Food is as good as it always was and the service never causes a problem. A well run restaurant with top notch food and a casual atmosphere.
Amazing! You really can't go wrong with anything here! Order the Mussels and the Pomme Frites together and dip your frites in the delicious curry sauce the mussels are served in. You won't regret it!

There's almost always a wait, but it's almost always worth it. The mushroom soup is more like a sauce, and very very thick. Great Korean Beef, but not the best in Charlotte. Highlights are their seafood, the scallops are always perfect.

Maybe I ordered the wrong items.  Bao was skimpy on ingredients and light on taste.   Fried oysters were OK.  I was on business and ate at the bar.  Service was very good.  $60 and I was hungry when I left.  Nice crowd but probably wouldn't try it again.

Yum! I was very excited to try one of the highest rated places in Charlotte. 

1. The food is delicious and they have very original recipes. My favorite dish here was the pork carnitas. You wont find anything else like it anywhere. Very original recipe, highly recommend this one! Keep in mind, all the food here is tapas style so it will be smaller. Drinks were good too. I think Soul Gastrolounge has better drinks but this place comes close. The food alone merits 5 stars. 

2. Our server was knowledgeable and friendly. She didn't check on us too much or make sure we needed anything else, so I wasn't BLOWN AWAY by the service. The service alone merits 4 stars. 

3. Plan ahead. This place usually has long wait times,  your best bet is to put yourself on the waiting list using Yelp (this was such a big help to my group of 4)... if you just show up be prepared to wait AT LEAST 1 hour. 

4. Environment and ambiance: It isn't super upscale and dressy.... but ladies? I'd recommend some heels and jeans and a nice shirt. Dresses are always valid too. And men? I will say a collared shirt and some shoes will work.... this isn't a place I would come to dressed super urban or casual. The crowd is grown and classy. Match the vibes people. DEFINITELY appropriate for date night.

This is the absolute classiest tapa style restaurant I have been to. Each dish comes out with a beautiful presentation and the taste of each dish is also on the same level as the presentation. We ordered a variety if items such as the Korean Beef, Creamy French Onion Soup, Gnocchi, Pommes Frites, Grilled Squid, Fried Oysters, and Ube Cheescake. There was not a single dish I did not like. 

One of my favorites was the Korean Beef. Being really biased and picky with Asian food, I applaud the chef on this dish. The beef was cooked to perfection and was succulent and rich in flavor, melting on your tongue. The rice was not dry with the perfect crisp on top. The best part about this dish was the sesame sauce on the side. It paired amazingly well with the beef and was absolutely amazing. 

In general, every single dish came out perfect. The seasoning was on point, things that were supposed to be crispy were crispy, and flavors paired well together. The Ube Cheescake was nothing like I have ever had, it is extremely hard to find a place that serves anything with Ube in the city. The flavor was slight but perfect and it was not too sweet. The service was impeccable, and our waiter, Craig, was beyond attentive and seems to be an all around friendly guy. I will definitely be back, no doubt!

Awesome!  Don't really have anything bad to say about this place. Thoroughly enjoyed all aspects of food and service. More charcuterie options would be a good addition. 

The steamed buns were great and the carpaccio was the star of the evening. I could eats pounds of that stuff with the fried pickle and pimento cheese

This could be the best restaurant in Charlotte. I have been three times now and each experience is unbelievable. The pasta dishes are all perfect and each should be ordered to share. The falafel is some of the best I have ever had. The steam bun is such a pleasant surprise. Each dish is so well thought out and the service is always great. Though I can't eat shellfish I've always been told that the scallops are to die for.

Very good varietal tapas. All nationalities covered in delectable little dishes. Service was very attentive. We were served by an "original" server who has been there since the beginning. She was wonderful and still showed enthusiasm.

YUM! I love the tapas style - It allows you to try different dishes without getting extremely full. I had the falafel - which was cripsy and warm and chewy on the inside, and well seasoned. The steamed bun was delicious. The pork belly was cooked well, there wasn' too much sauce or too much bun. It all complimented each other. Shrimp & Andouille was also very good. I'm a huge fan of garlic, so the hints of garlic with the creamy risotto really went well with the shrimp.

Quick service, super clean, and delicious!!! You must get get the Prince Edward Island mussels!!! Even if you don't like mussels get them anyway!!! They're not the big mussels with that big poop bag they are small bite size deliciousness Thai coconut curry flavored. O M G!!! So good!
One of the best date night spots in Charlotte. Or go in a group and try everything on the menu. Don't miss out on the mussels or the steamed buns.

Best Tapas in Charlotte, nice restaurant and interior decor sets a good ambience. A little more space and less romantic than the sister restaurant Barringtons but still the same quality ingredients and excellent value for money dining. Highly recommended 

Don't judge a book by it's cover, this is fine dining and excellent value for money even if it doesn't look fancy from the outside.
Awesome food !  We had 3 dishes and each one was outstanding.  The place was packed on a Tuesday night.

The name of this place definitely holds true! Overall, an excellent meal. Most of it was highlights, but there were a few minor lowlights.

First, the positives. Service was outstanding. I like a place that will seat me for my party of five when I am the only one there. The waiter did not make me feel unwelcome at any point, and when one of our party did not show up, it was no problem. He was also very attentive!

This place is tapas style, you need to order approximately two items to equal a regular entree.  That showstealer for me was Korean style pork on a steamed bun with pickled vegetables. It was served like a taco, and it was scrumptious!  The sauce had many layers of flavor, and the steamed bum absorbed it perfectly.  While I enjoyed the plate of mushrooms, the oil was a little heavy handed.  For others at the table, the winner was the spring onion cream soup. One friend got it, and as soon as the other friend tried it, she ordered it for herself!

The dessert showstealer was a rich coconut cake with a meringue topping and a coconut cream. We all agreed at the table that was the best of the two desserts. The other one, a lemon marscapone basil cake, was a bit bland.  

I would definitely eat here again.  Though I frequent the Starbucks around the corner, I have never been on this street before. It seems like there are lots of interesting restaurants and bars to try!
Food and service were excellent!! It's small plates but easy to fill up on. Next time we will be trying the desserts which looked incredible.Will definitely be back!!
This small plates restaurant is amazing! The best thing, aside from the excellent food, is the fact that the plates are not that small. The mussels in coconut milk are to die for.

If you can make it here... You should stop looking and just come. 

The server literally told me that if I didn't like anything on the menu he would pull out his own credit card and pay for it...that's how confident he was at everything on the menu was excellent. 

Bout to put that to the test:

Smoked bourbon and mint julep. 'Nuff Said!
Now I'm in the South!

My first bite was the venison carpaccio. 

What a beautiful balance of texture and flavor. This was like eating in one bite the season "Fall". 

Next up is the Korean beef with crispy rice and scallion kimchee.

OMG! 

This is perfectly seared beef, on a square of crispy rice. Don't miss this when ordering. I'm not kidding. There were more layers of flavored in the sauce than I could even start to count back. The Server said there were over 25 ingredients in the one sauce. 

Next Seared sea Scallops:

The best was saved for last. 
Two Scallops served over Grilled Cantaloupe, with Jalapeño and cilantro. 

Seasoned PERFECT! Seared like a boss! This was so delicious. Though, If I had my way the garnish of sliced red Jalapeño could be less on the platting. It could easily overwhelm the other favors going on. 

Service: Outstanding, VERY knowledgable. 
Presentation: Top Notch.  Fresh local ingredients. 

If I lived here I'd be a regular.

I feel like I might be exiled from the city with this review, but I'm just gonna be honest...this place is called "Good Food" because it's not great. At least they realize it. 

Small plate and tapas restaurants offer a really unique and interesting business model. I appreciate the speed of service, turnover rate, and quality of food. Given the margins with the costs of operating, it's a highly under-noted form of genius. 

With that said, the prices are pretty damn high. Portion-wise you're getting shafted, albeit not by a whole lot, but I'm not one that just loves paying $22 for 3 slices of rare beef that's the thickness of paper. The food and drinks are tasty though. We tried about 6 different things and all were notably well done.

Nothing bad to say about the service, but do not attempt to get a table any time after 6pm on Friday or Saturday unless you're cool with waiting for at least an hour.

This is a cool spot in an area with an identity problem. Worth checking out one time if you can stand to wait or eat dinner super early. The true score here is 3.5/5, but I'll give it a 4 because the food is...good.

After reading everyone's reviews I was very excited to go.. We got there on a Friday around 7:30pm. I guess lucky for us. There's a Panthers vs Patriots game here at home. So it wasn't quite as busy. We opted to sit at the bar! I ordered a black punch and my friend ordered a bourbon mule. Both drinks were watered down. I wasn't sure if it was me or the ice on the drinks. My friend only had one. I opted for another to make sure. Yes by the time I had the 2nd one. It tasted water down.. The two plates I ordered was ok.. Fairly expensive. And I love tapas/small plates. I had the shrimp boil and the Korean beef. The shrimp boil have no flavors. Very bland. Korean beef was very good. Not excellent for the amount you paid for.. That night we met a couple of crazies.. Not sure if they believe in our personal space., and the ambiance was very loud and busy.. Hard time hearing.. If I want good food and a good place to chat with my girls. I wouldn't pick this place..

While the food is good, the service easily knocked this joint down from four stars to two. Let's recap shall we? 

We get there before they open. Me and my homie are chillin on the deck, enjoying the weather...  waiting for our other homie to come (who we find out is chillin in the car, listening to The Read).

They open, we're seated and immediately greeted by our waitress (who we find out later is a manager). She gave us the specials and popular dishes, explained they're a tapas place, etc, etc. We're given our water and some bread and balsamic/oil dip. She leaves us to look over the menu. 

She returns after a few minutes. I ask, "what are your more bulkier or bigger dishes" she flatly says "all the dishes are small because they're tapas" 

You're kidding me right? I know that. Chick what are the bigger dishes out of the whole menu cause I'm hangry. (I didn't say this)

But she does say that the pasta dishes are heartier. That's all she should have said in the first place. 

My homie says it could be a culture thing, referring to her off-putting attitude. Shit in my culture, i give attitude and dont spare feelings, but there are times and places where that's acceptable. She agreed. 

We order...

The falafel had good flavor and texture and could have used a bit more mint and sauce for freshness. I didn't ask (and I'm glad I didn't. I'll tell you why later) 

The pommes frites were okay. They were a bit salty and I like ranch with my fries. They didn't have any so ketchup made it a bit better. 

The carnitas was the best of the three dishes I had. While I'm not a big pomegranate seed fan, I still thoroughly enjoyed the dish. 

Back to the ranch. Another lady who was chipper and friendly comes to the table. We ask if they have ranch. She says no but they have another sauce that goes with another dish, and it's like an herb ranch. Okay cool, we'll try that. We get it. It's small. My other homie wanted one. The manager comes back and we ask for another one. She said there's going to be a charge. For one? For both? I'm confused. She leaves. The friendly lady comes back. I ask if there's a charge for the sauce. She says no. I said the other lady said there was. They're both at the table now. Confusion ensues. In the end the Manager says she'll have the chef take the sauce off the bill. Manager seemed dead set at charging until friendly lady cleared everything up. 

Fast forward to the bill. We get one check:

Homie E: "Can we have three separate checks?"
Manager: "we don't separate checks"
Me: "soooo"
Manager: "you can write out what you had and I'll take the payments".... walks away 
Homie E: "how do we do this? Do we add tax?l
Me: "iono man"
Homie M: proceeds to neatly write on the card with who had what and puts the card/cash accurately on top of each section 
Manager returns...
Homie M: "so I just put what we had and the amount..."
Manager: rolls eyes, looks confused. Leaves 
Me: blood boiling, thinking as a manger her customer service skills SUCK! "She sucks!"
Manager: "blah blah blah, next time you'll need to write the amount not the dishes. Blah blah blah, I'll do it this time for you. Next time you need to do it. Blah"
Me: Looks across at another table with a big ace bowl of mussels and bread. What in the ever-loving.... "look at that big bowl of food. That's what I meant by bigger dishes" I'm never coming back to this bi... place"

The End.

I've been here a few times and always have a great experience. They don't take reservations, so it can be hard to get into if you're not willing to wait more than an hour. The bar is usually pretty crowded so sometimes it's hard to find a place to stand and wait. I highly recommend waiting though. It will be worth it. I love that this place is all small plates which means you can order a lot, share and try different things. Not the best place to go on a first date if you want to have a meaningful conversation since it's usually pretty loud. Great place though for people watching. I'm not usually a meat eater, and would never order pulled pork on my own but after the lovely steamed bun lured me in, I was hooked on the taste of the sweet, bbq pork inside. There is a hint of caramlization and crispiness that makes it all melt in your mouth. I also had the scallops the other night with warm peaches and grits. I'm not a fan of grits usually but these were really tasty. Makes me want to make them at home although I probably don't want to know how many calories it took to get them to taste that good! I love coming here and trying new items. I will be back, over and over again!! GOOD FOOD!

We visited GFoM, based solely on the yelp rating, while visiting Charlotte between Christmas and New Year's weekends.  All I can say is, wow.  It's not the best-looking restaurant I've ever been to, it was kind of loud (on a VERY busy Thursday night), and parking was a challenge.  

But - the food was spectacular, the service was impeccable, and the wines were divine.  The concept of simple fusion foods served on small plates works to perfection here, and I can honestly say that this was the best restaurant experience my wife and I have had in the past 5 years.  The dishes themselves were obviously well thought-out, and the fact that they were as good as they were, on a very busy night, speaks volumes about the skills of the kitchen team.  The dishes are pared down to the necessary elements, which tells me that a lot of thought went into the menu shoices and recipes.  Nothing excessive or unnecessary was added - just the food.  Perfection on a small plate!

We were sufficiently impressed that we swung by on our way out of town on New Years Eve, around 6 pm.  Even better, if that's possible!  Tammy, the bartender, was fabulous, and her recommendations were spot-on.

As a sidenote to Jason S's review - I've read this review several times, and I just don't think it's a fair assessment.  If you know that your wife has multiple special needs when it comes to food, would it not be part of normal planning and preparation to verify in advance that a restaurant can accomodate her needs?  To expect that they can just 'whip up' something special (off-menu) on a moment's notice is naive, at best.  It's a restaurant, not your mom and dad's kitchen...

I live in New York City, and a client of mine took me here for dinner one night. I have to say, this is one of the best restaurants that I have been to-- ANYWHERE. 

The drinks (I got some sort of Gin drink with egg white in it?) and wine list area great. But the food is the star. I can't remember EVERYTHING we got, but I cannot think of one thing that we got where I wasn't saying, "Oh my GOSHHHH!" every time I tried it. 

Here are the things I can remember: 
Cheese plate-- delicious
Pomme Frites-- OH. MY. GAWD.
Steamed Bun-- Delicious... very very good.
However, the stand out dish for me was the mussels dish  (Green Curry, Coconut Milk & Cilantro). This is last meal of your life good. Like "you are thinking about it when you leave contemplating how fat you'd appear to be if you went back after your work function and got 7 orders of it to go to your hotel room" good.

The dessert, cappuccino, service, everything was top top notch and I've been to some of the best restaurants in NYC. To top it all off, the place is not even remotely pretentious. Friendly bar tenders, servers, even the manager/owner who knew the client I brought was talking us up the whole time. It's both laid back and upscale at the same time so you can put your elbows on the table and enjoy a good conversation while getting a great, upscale meal. That is, if you can fit anything else on the table along with all of the plates filled with delicious food.

I cannot WAIT to go back.

For our anniversary, we came as a group of six and it was an amazing experience! Great service, we tried over a dozen dishes collectively, and everything was so good! My favorite dish surprisingly was the Falafel - it was light, flavorful, layered with many textures. My least favorite (even though it was still very tasty), was the Saucisson Slider. It came with two sliders, but the bread was not as fresh. My second favorite dish was the Steamed Bun. It was ridiculously good & is a must try for first timers. For anyone that has not been here before, my recommendation would be to arrive early or be prepared to wait. I cannot wait to visit here again!

Easily my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. Everything is Amazing. Always an incredible experience. Great patio to sit outside and have a drink while you wait for your table to be ready - or- you can go bowing across the street. Great date night or group outing.
great place!! the food was so different but it was worth every bite. the only complaint I have is it isn't very cozy and the tables are too close together. other than that everything was amazing

I've been to Good Food a few times and really like it.  But my most recent visit was not up to par.
The good part of the visit was the food.  Tasty. Always good.
 
The not-so-good part was everything else.  There was a mix up about who was waiting on us.   OK, it was busy, I get it. We weren't in a hurry. 

We ordered 4 dishes to start- we got one dish every 15 minutes! We put in our order at 6:45 and our last dish came out at 7:40! Now, I understand their concept, BUT, the 2 guys next to us ( who came in after us) got all their dishes delivered within about 20 minutes.  We were still waiting on our last dish and they were finished.  
I love your food, but the service we experienced was poor- really poor. 

With all the restaurant options around now, I won't be back anytime soon.

Wow it feels good to give a 5 star review after a pretty bad streak.  As close to perfect that any restaurant has come in Charlotte.  The only downfall is that most likely you will be waiting for a while.  Luckily it was just dinner for 2 this night, and we immediately found a pair of seats at the bar.  The service was amazing and I think I would sit there again even if there was space in the dining room.  The star of the night was the steamed bun.  The pork was crisp, juicy, soft, and sweet all at the same time.  The green curry mussels came in a close second for me.  Two of the other dishes we ordered I would classify as "just good" - the falafels and the cavatappi.  I think the steamed bun and mussels set the bar too high.  We had a chicken dish that we didn't care for the flavor of, can't recall the name or how it was described.  I (solely, wife refused to participate) had the pot de creme for dessert.  Outstanding.  Not overly sweet so the true flavors shine.  Perfect dinner.
Excellent! flavors are amazing, great place with a small group and the service is exceptional. Would definitely come back

Literally, one of the best meals I've had in Charlotte.  We went on a Friday night at 8pm, and since no reservations were accepted, there was quite a wait, FYI.  Given the quality of the food, it was well worth it.  I'll discuss the dishes we had, in descending order of "Best" to "Still Very Good." 

The star of the evening was the pork bun.  WOW!  The pork was seasoned impeccably, the bun was soft and fluffy and the garnishments were spot-on.  We ate it in silence, so that we could savor every bite without distraction.  Really, it was the best thing I have eaten in months.  

The next best dish were the mussels. I couldn't get enough of the green curry sauce, and I agree with other reviewers who have complained about the lack of bread: with broth that good, two slices of pita won't cut it.  Baguettes for the broth, please!

Next, the Moroccan lamb dish.  Again, the seasoning was just spot-on.  The dish had wonderful spices (anise?) and fruit that all worked perfectly together.  If the other dishes hadn't been so good, I would have left the restaurant raving about this one.  

Last place (but by no means bad) was the gnocchini.  Very good, just too rich for me.  If you like carbonara dishes, then this is for you.  My two cents, however, is that heavy cream-based dishes all kind of taste the same (i.e. quite delicious) everywhere, so it is worth your dollar and while to enjoy the other, more refined, dishes at a restaurant of this caliber.

So, GFOM gets my highest endorsement and will likely be my #1 recommendation for anyone visiting Charlotte.  I just wish there were more places like it.  Continue on.

Love this place!!!!!! Great food should be their new name..... Better than just good. We ordered 6 different items from the menu and they were all fresh and delicious. My new favorite restaurant in Charlotte. #Delicious #JustSayin

I found this place on yelp while in Charlotte on business, dining alone. The reviews were great so I gave it a shot! Got there just after opening, good thing because soon it was filled up. I overheard the host tell other patrons that on sat nights they usually have a line out the door but Friday's aren't too bad. I sat at the bar that faces the cold prep area - the chef and waiters are super friendly and help you make decisions :). I hadn't eaten all day- had no trouble eating 3 plates - dessert after left me totally stuffed though! The food was wonderful, started with the citrus pear salad - lovely and not for sharing in my book! I had the Korean beef next because it was so raved about. Not totally my taste but I can see why people like it. So if you love Korean food you will love it and that plate is good for sharing. Next I ordered the gnocchi with roast duck, OMG loved it. Sublime. Definitely good for sharing as it is a rich dish, unless you have a big appetite that night like I did ha! Couldn't pass up dessert and coffee to wind down the meal. Had the cinnamon roll with homemade ice cream but almost ordered the brownie with brown butter vanilla. The chef must have heard me debating and gave me a scoop of the vanilla. Loved it more and would have that next time!  So yeah I ate for two and enjoyed the whole meal. Will definitely go back - a great date night or meet up with friends kind of place. Didn't feel awkward eating there alone though!

Great food, family style. Encouraged to share plates and have actual conversations with your company. They use the NoWaiit App which is amazing bc they are pretty busy on the weekends. 

Only complaint is that the drinks we ordered weren't very strong. For the price of cocktails I was hoping for a little more liquor.
Amazing! The food was excellent and our server Johnathan was knowledgable and attentive. I have Celiac and they did a great job with gluten free options for me. I can't wait to return.

Good Food on Montford is a little pricey, as tapas places usually are, but my wife and I shared the steamed bun, Parmesan gnocchi, Korean beef, and a dessert. Our first reaction was the the food was a little underflavored: the Korean beef wasn't as "vibrant" as it typically is when it's the sole entree. Overall, though, the slightly toned down flavor allowed the diverse dishes to work together, and our meal was satisfying and delicious. Highly recommended.

If you've read my reviews, I give a lot of 4 and 5 stars.  I tend to only write about the best.  This place is in my top 5 of all time.  The staff is SUPER and the food is INCREDIBLE. That's all I'm going to say.  The name of the place speaks for itself.

Why was I so stubborn?  When i first saw this place it looked a little shabby from the outside and its name, well was not so imaginative. I saw the yelp reviews and couldn't believe this place was that good. I was completely wrong.
The inside of the place is so much more appealing than the outside.  Tapas style american cuisine is how I would describe this place. My friend and I asked the waitress what we should start with.  She told us the mussels were the best in Charlotte.  She wasn't far off.  Drenched in a nice smooth curry sauce the combination was unbeatable.  From there, I moved onto the scallops.  The scallops were pretty good, but the cous cous underneath was some of the best I had. Since the food was good and I'm fat I decided to order the pork tenderloin as well.  This portion was considerabley bigger and was just amazing.  The pork was cooked to perfection and the chorizo hash & chili demi really set this dish off.  
I will be back and my friend has been telling me that he will be taking his girl here when she comes down.  Bottom line, looks are decieving and this place is a diamond in the rough.

I swear I reviewed this place before... I'm having that feeling a lot lately. However since I apparently haven't here we go. I loved this place!! A group of us came here to celebrate me getting a new job and it was the perfect place to go. That night we were seated quickly (it was a weeknight though).
