If you are like me and have a hard time deciding between different options this is a great place to go. Smallish plates made for sharing. I love any restaurant that perpetuates sharing of food!! On top of that the food is amazing. The decor is nice albeit simple, and the restaurant is pretty cozy without being too crowded, at least that night. The drinks were tasty and our waitress/waiter were full of awesome recommendations and swift service. I can't believe it took me so long to come and I can't believe that I haven't been back recently. I will definitely need to put that on the list ASAP.

The food is always stellar. They always find a way to offer new, deliciously decadent food while keeping the favorites around. The wait can be long, but that's because they knock the food out of the park. Nothing but positive experiences here. Has become a "go to" for my wife and me. Keep up the excellent work.

I'd give Good Food five stars, but there was a hair in our falafel and that feeling of uncleanliness + how the waitstaff handled it just  "left a bad taste in my mouth".. yes, I know that's a bad pun.

The food was decent, especially the butternut squash soup, and we were thrilled to get one of the last tables available without a wait on a Wednesday night. The food came out quickly and was surprisingly hearty for tapas style menu items. 

Despite the food being good, I'm not sure I'll be back after this experience.

I would eat here every weekend, if possible. I love Good Food on Montford. Love.

Looks are deceiving, but I think that is what they were going for when they picked this location. From the outside, it's nothing flashy but a solid frame with floor to ceiling glass front windows. The interior is modern, contemporary and very tasteful. They nailed the minimalist and cozy ambiance. They have each table set and ready for your arrival.

I really like the small tapas plate concept. You can pick and choose various dishes to share with your partner. Awww, romantic. Tip: Get 2 steamed buns so you won't end up fighting over it; it is that delicious you each want your own. I'm going to make it my mission to try each item...the quail wraps and Korean beef were very flavorful. They focus on seasonal dishes using local and/or organic options. Fab. The wine selection was very good and the servers make great recommendations. Last, but not least was the dessert. They had the most fantastic blackberry ice cream (yes, it was a few seasons ago) paired with a cake or cobbler dish. Mmmm.

The service was fantastic! Just the perfect amount of attention balanced with privacy. The most perfect dining experiences are when you lose track of time, deep in conversation, eating fantastically prepared food, and dishes are each a work of art. You will get all of that at Good Food. 

My favorite. Just wish they would accept reservations.
Good service, great atmostphere, & fantastic small plates - what else can be said that hasn't been already?  I live down the street & will be back on a regular basis.

I love this place! Lively fun atmosphere, great for groups. We came here for a work related celebration. All small plates, very upscale and world-cuisine eclectic. And a good drinks/beer menu too. Favorites were beer battered broccoli, steamed pork buns, and gnocchi.

It's small and they don't take reservations, so plan accordingly.

Excellent!  What a pleasant surprise this place is.

The food here is so good.  They also have some nice, interesting wines by the glass (as well as bottles, of course).

I had the garnachi and the butternut squash soup. Each of these was really good. The garnachi was AMAZING - fresh tomatoes, Italian sausage, cheese, and pasta.  I am not exaggerating when I say the flavor exploded in my mouth.  My colleague said the mussels were great, too.

Our waitress was professional and personable and funny, all at the same time.

I will be back.

Let me start by saying I have been to Good Food a number of times and up until this time it has remained my favorite date night restaurant in Charlotte.  Generally, the wait staff has always been very friendly and attentive.  At this visit, it seemed like they were understaffed and just did not care about the restaurant patrons.  Also, some of the runners looked as if they just crawled out of bed.  Good Food is generally recognized as a good spot for an intimate dinner; as such, I would think their staff would care more about appearances and at least tuck their t-shirt in.  

Onto the good (the food). We had the sangria, pommes frites, falafel, gnocchi, steamed bun, and the korean beef.  The sangria was excellent, I could drink those all night.  The pommes frites and the falafel are great apps.  The pommes frites were excellent as always.  The falafel was very tasty and the tzatziki sauce was wonderful, I wish they would put more of the sauce on the plate.  The gnocchi is very reminiscent of chicken and dumplings, it is delicious! I haven't ever had a bad pasta at Good Food. The steamed bun was really great, it's a Good Food staple and a must-try! The only bad part about our actual food was the Korean Beef.  It was fatty and we couldn't even finish the beef.  Such a disappointment as it has previously always been my favorite dish at Good Food.

Overall, not the best experience as we were looking to have a romantic intimate dinner.  I certainly won't go back when I want attentive service for the rare date-night.

Tapas style restaurant so the plates are by no means huge, however if you're looking for some amazing food this place is great! Brought my girlfriend here and I started with the  garganelli while she started with the muscles. Each bite of the garganelli exploded with flavor and the addition of the Italian sausage exploded with flavor. The muscles were so great they're still on my mind the next day. Not normally a fan of coconut milk but it really did elevate the muscles to a whole new level. But in my opinion the fried chicken was the highlight of my meal, a true gift from the gods. Each bite so juicy and flavorful I literally went home and smacked my mother for ever feeding me something that didn't compare. Im still in the hospital from the ass-whooping she gave my afterwards but I am truly glad to have experienced such a great meal. Thank you good food at Montford.

Truthfully I give this restaurant and experience a 4.5 stars! I've been dying to visit good food on montford for years and I'm ashamed to say it took me so long to go! When we arrived the place was buzzing and every table in the place was full. It's a very small restaurant with about 20 tables in it, most of them are 2 tops. My fiancé and I grabbed a glass of wine at the bar and quickly got sat at the "back bar" which is bar sitting right in front of a cook, Chris. I am so glad we were sat here because Chris made our experience amazing. You could tell this man has a passion for culinary and it was fun to watch him work. 

We were explained that everything on the menu is tapas style. Most people order 2-3 items per person. We started off with the steam bun and carpaccio. I was very prepared for small portions but the one thing I am taking off half a star for is the steam bun. It's literally one bun. I think this should be 3 smaller buns which would make it more share friendly, since that's what you are going for with the tapas style. Now don't get me wrong the flavors of the steam bun were amazing! The carpaccio was so lovely because it had a southern twist to it with the pimento cheese and fried pickles. Again I'll note that we got a smaller portion on this then many photos I saw online. I get they are going small but don't skimp! 

Next we ordered Chris' favorite the poached egg and our waitress' favorite the Italian sausage pasta. The egg was beautiful, larger than expected and very deep, rich flavor. The pasta was also larger in size and my fiancé even commented that it would have been enough for an entree if he ate it solo. The pasta sauce was so bright and the sausage was filled with sage! 

Our server was able to suggest great wines to pair throughout the evening! The wine list does not match what is ok the website. I think that should be updated because I had selected my choice before going and that no longer carried it. 

After dinner Chris heard me speak of my nut allergy and he order us a chocolate dessert that was nut free! 

Overall this place is amazing!! I would suggest to go during the week and not on weekends because the wait can be awfully long due to the size of the restaurant and people tend to take longer when eating tapas. They also update their menu according to what they can locally source and what's in season so each time you go you can received a completely different experience! 

My vote is this is one of my favorite in Charlotte, right along with Roosters! This is a MUST VISIT!!!

Yet ANOTHER place that I can't believe I haven't written a Yelp Review for! Whiskey Tango Foxtrot!

OK, so me and my friends are doing a Montford Ave Pub Crawl....right, and well, we stop like at every friggin place on Montford! Thank GOD I live in this area! Woo Hoo! Anyway, we start at Duckworths (Duh) and work our way down to Good Food for dessert. Most of us have eaten at other establishments, and decided to get some of their awesome desserts!

So.....we order 3 things: 1) A Brownie with a homemade Biscoff (Belgian) Ice Cream (HELLO!), 2) A Red Velvet Cupcake with homemade crazy good frosting (Hello 2!) and 3) A "hot" (meaning SPICY not temperature) Chocolate Martini (HELLO 3!).

Well suffice it to say everything was FANTASTIC! Gotta love the Moffit brothers as they implement their vision of GREAT food in Charlotte! 

I've eaten here before and absolutely loved it! So my 5 star rating includes those aweseome meals from before......

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
Great reputation that is well deserved.... fabulous food... gotta try the fries and anything else the server says.... "Oh yeah.... it's killer"

On a recent visit to Charlotte to visit family I visited Good Food on Monford with my mother and grandmother.  We went based on my Mom's insistence since she had been on her last visit to this area and loved it.  After our dinner there, I definitely agree with her!

The restaurant looks odd and small from the outside, but is adorable on the inside with a beautiful bar.  Since they do not take reservations, we arrived around 6:30pm on a Friday and were seated immediately.  Our waitress was happy to explain the menu to us since this is a small plates restaurant and gave us some recommendations.  

The wine servings are generous - they bring you a small carafe which is really two glasses of wine in one.  

The food is definitely the stand out here.  They bring you fresh bread and there is roasted garlic and oil & balsamic on the table waiting for you - yum.  I ordered the mixed green salad and the Korean beef.  Both dishes were delicious.  My mother and grandmother really enjoyed their dishes as well.  I tried a bite of my mom's shrimp arepas and instantly got a case of food envy - delicious!

I justified only getting two small dishes as the reasoning behind ordering dessert.  My mom and I shared the malted cheesecake which was absolutely amazing.  

My only complaint would really be the noise level in here.  I may have been more cognizant of the noise since we were with my grandmother, but it was hard to hear each other.  As more and more people started waiting for seats, they started to crowd our table since we were seated by the door.

I would definitely go back next time I'm in the area since I love small dish restaurants, and this one definitely delivered!

This place is a 10.  A perfect date night if you are comfortable enough to share a few small plates after seeing a movie at the Park Road Movie Theater.

This place really over-delivers.  The service is impeccable, and the food is divine.

Understated, Charming, Warm.  This place is really a rare find in Charlotte.

All of this raving, but I must warn you -- this place is not cheap.  But you definitely get what you pay for.

I recommend sitting at the bar!
Food was good! Steamed bun and Korean beef were great, Mussels were juicy. Would definitely come by again for a drink and a few tapas.

Been here twice now and it is a must stop everytime i come back to the queen city. Took an LA Foodie coworker last night and he was blown away by the food and the service. Every dish is a winner -- particular favourites were the gnocchi, poached egg and mountain fried chicken

Delicious!  Our best meal in 3 days in the Charlotte area. We shared sweet corn risotto, pork buns, pork schnitzel, red snapper and grilled shrimp arepas.  OMG, one was better than the next. For dessert we shared chocolate pot de creme and banana pudding cheesecake. Scrumptious.

This is a very busy restaurant with very close seating. It is also very loud. Our table tried about 7 dishes and we enjoyed all of them. I would like to try this restaurant again when it is not so crowded. The wait staff was very nice.

The food here is amazing! They have some very unique dishes. The only problem is, the place is small and very popular so you either have to get there super early or very late to not have a long wait. But it is DEFINITELY worth the wait. The truffle fries and prom belly sliders are amazing, not like anything I have every had. Also the mussels are sooooooo delicious!! Love this quaint little restaurant

Food was divine, I had the pasta with sausage which was incredible.  We ate at the bar due to the 45-minute wait for a table, but it was a good choice for us as it was faster and much quieter.  The bartender was very attentive and helpful in explaining the menu.  The only downside I would mention is that the restaurant is very loud.  But that is a minor criticism -- the food and service here are awesome.

This restaurant is awesome and very interesting.  It was a very long wait when we went out there on a Saturday evening so plan for it.  The food is served tapas style (small portions). 4-5 dishes would be good to share amongst 2 people. My favorites are the Korean steak.  It was delicious.the octopus dish was spectacular.  Everything is pretty good,   my only complaint is the size of the good for the price you pay for it.  Staff is friendly.

Good Food on Montford... More like Awesome Food! The BF chose this spot for our date night. We arrived around 6:15 on a Saturday. We were informed the wait would be about 20 minutes. The host took our phone number and said that he would call us when a table was available. I prefer this to one of those buzzers that requires you stick around the place. It was a nice night and the wait wasn't bad so we sat down outside. He gave us a buzz and we walked inside. He informed us that there was seating at the Chef's table if we would like or we could wait for a table. I was starving at this point, so the Chef's table it was! We were taken to a roomy bar that overlooked the dessert/cold plate section of the kitchen. It's an awesome spot to chat with the chefs. Our server was attentive and the food rolled out at a good pace. 

As for the food...

The bread was nothing to write home about but I loved the roasted garlic that came with it. 

Pork Bun: The pork bun was phenomenal. Not a traditional steam bun set up but more like a little sandwich. The bun itself was made in house and a nice soft texture. The pork belly was perfectly tender and delectable. The sweetness of the hoisin sauce added a nice balance to the dish. 

Scallops: The scallops were perfectly seasoned and seared. Two decent sized scallops sat atop a bed of Israeli couscous. The dish was very good but not life changing. 

Quail Lettuce Wraps: Our favorite dish of the night! The quail was succulent. Just rich enough and the flavors were well developed. This was a nice light plate. So, so good. 

Chocolate Brownie w/ Biscoff Ice Cream: Stellar... I mean it's a brownie but it was a damn good brownie. Warmed up and served on a plate with peanut butter, a scoop of homemade biscoff ice cream and a dollop of fresh whip cream. Amazing. Such a great way to end the meal.

I'm already looking forward to our next visit!
AWESOME! Best small plates I've ever had. We loved the Korean beef. The garganelli is out of this world and the pot de creme is a must!!

This place has such an amazing menu that you can just close your eyes and place your finger anywhere on it.  Three visits, three super happy experiences.  This is what Tapas should be like and this is what food should taste like.  If I had more money I would go here twice a month!  There is no point in picking out one item because it would be a disservice to the overall quality of the menu.  That said, the Hot and Sour soup is absurdly delicious.
Well, this place runs forever so I guess they know what they doing lol I've been there so many time I can't remember.. great food and service always friendly!! Great place for a drink!

Awesome menu for sharing plates. Our table of four ordered like 10 plates plus two desserts. Very unique and flavorful items. Wish we would've gotten there sooner so we wouldn't of had to wait for a table but it was totally worth it when you have that completely satisfied feeling after a meal. We will be back again!

It was good food and it was on Montford... but was it great food? No.

Don't get me wrong, this serving style and cuisine is what I look for in a restaurant. The atmosphere was intimate yet not awkward, the food was unique, and the server was personable. However, nothing about the food made me scream "THIS is why I'm here!" 

My two favorite dishes of the night were the Morocco chicken sausage and the pork belly arepa. Both had great flavor, and had they been the only things I ordered, I probably would've given this restaurant five stars. The pommes frites, garganelli, triggerfish, and peach cobbler I could have done without. Their presentations were all great, I just needed an extra it factor in the flavors. Ordered the cheese plate and was given no explanation on types of cheeses...thanks!

In all, the menu and two of the dishes enticed me enough to warrant my return. Hopefully next time to some great food on Montford.

Best dining experience I've had in a very very long time. Phenomenal food. Great prices. Wonderful wine list. I can't say enough great things. We had the falafel, pomme frites, mushrooms, steamed bun, Korean beef, shrimp and gnocchi with oxtail all of it was superb. If I lived here they would take all my money. Go here with confidence. Be sure to make reservations!

I have to say Good Food takes the crown for me on best tapas in Charlotte. The green curry mussels are amazing and a must when coming here! I'm a sucker for anything coconut and the mussels are served in a Thai coconut green curry sauce with some bread for dipping.  I think I raved about the mussels for a week straight after last time I came here. They are always on the menu too, although their menu is seasonal.  I could go into detail about the other menu items, but the mussels must be given their credit! 5 stars themselves. 

ps. One time we came here we got the 'Chefs counter' at the bar and had a great time. The Chef was very personable and gave us a few freebies for tasting- can you say biscotti ice cream and pork belly boa buns?! Maybe not together, but they were both awesome! I think I was spoiled so much that next time I come back I'll need to sit at the Chefs counter again!

Ah Good Food, you should rename yourself to Awesome Food on Montford. Seriously your stuff is yummy. I tried only a couple of things on the menu before leaving due to not being very hungry but they were all so delicious! From your warm and woody decor to your very accommodating wait staff I liked it all.

Since everyone was raving about the mussels in curry and cilantro I went head and started myself off with that. The mussels were really small, overcooked maybe. and kind of disappointed me. The green curry sauce was phenomenal though and delicious soaked up with the grilled naan! Corn risotto, perfect and sweet and eaten after the curry cleansed my palate and left a refreshing taste. My favorite of the evening. The dessert was some sort of macadamia nut pie with banana ice cream. I didn't like it very much, tasted too much like a mashed up frozen banana to me, but my dining partners liked it a lot.

Yum yum, total bill was around $15 excellent price and I was quite full after three courses. I can't believe I waited so long to come here!

A tapas or small dish restaurant with a nice low key atmosphere. Service was very good with an  attentive server that was never intrusive or disruptive.
The food was average on whole with the fried oysters as a lone standout. Decent wine list by the glass

First bite. 

This place is very busy. There may be a good reason. But let's talk about the restaurant. It is a cool old storefront low roof brick building. I would say 50s 60s vintage. The staff are going crazy, the guests are chatting up a storm. Lucky me, I'm at the bar next to three beautiful blonds. ;)

Garganelli got me at first bite. The mushrooms are amazing.

Wow! Even after the good reviews here, I was still surprised at how great food was. I had the edamame soup, pommes frites, and steamed pork bun with a glass of '06 Nebbiolo, and it was complete bliss. I'll be coming back when I'm in town!!

Sorry to do this but I have to down grade my earlier review.  The food here is still outstanding,  but there was very questionable behavior by the seating host. Since this amazing restaurant only takes walk ins it really matters when you don't honor the wait list and we watched it happen.  We were waiting for a table by the host station when someone he knew came in. The couple 2 minutes before her got told  there would be a 30-45 minutes wait. He put her name on the list. We were just getting dessert and asked to be seated at the bar and waited 30 minutes too, which was fine. His friend sat down next to us with the restaurant still packed and a few minutes later was seated. There where several other parties still on the seating list. To me that's a big no no. I like this restaurant a lot, but there are so many great places that do take reservations in town and the clientele seems to be dressed to the nines lately.  So will I get seated faster if I dress better or no someone? It's very hard to get in and out of the parking and no I have to wear a dress and my husband has to wear a bow tie to get the hosts attention?  I might as well go to Barringtons. I miss the old Good Food. :(

Hands down the best restaurant in Charlotte, to my knowledge. I've been here a million times and it stays good. For such a crowded restaurant the service is remarkably good. The menu is divided in 5 parts which are pretty much cold , warm (veggies mostly), pasture, fish, pasta. I have never been disappointed by anything.
My favorite things are the fries (you need to order the fries), the mussels and the gnocci. My husband and I spend about $85 including tip and tax for a generous meal for two with dessert, but no wine.
The only thing that IMO disappoint are the desserts. Not bad, but I've never had something and went WOW and I think I've had most items on the menu.

One of my top 5 favorite restaurants of all time. I really enjoy everything. The bar, Moscow mules (on tap, I might add) the food is great and service too. 
I do best with variety, and GF nails it every time.

My favorite restaurant in Charlotte. It should be called "Great Food."  I've ordered practically everything on the menu and haven't had a dish yet that I wouldn't order again.  My only criticism is that they won't take reservations for tables under 5 people.  I've been turned away several times on a weekend because of this.

In town for work and wanted real food.  I found this close by with great ratings.  When I first saw the $$$ rating here I was confused... the menu items range anywhere from 7-15... a price I would consider reasonable.  I ordered a beer, of which they have a respectable selection at common prices. I also ordered the parmesan gnocchi.  And then it happened....   my baby bowl of gnocchi arrived.  I am not letting the serving size alter my rating as it was PERFECT.  Yes there was less than 8 oz of gnocchi.... yes there was less than 1/3 of a chicken breast... but it was heavenly.  Still being hungry i was compelled to order a second plate, the steamed bun with pork belly and a Glenlivet 12 year neat for desert.    The steamed bun was also fantastic and of similar portion size to the first dish.  My one surprise at the end was the price of the scotch.  I was suspecting that a place with such a profit margin on their food would not feel the need to mark up their booze so much, but alas...  All in all, i would definitely come back.

I know I've updated this review already, but it deserves to be updated again after my last experience at GF!  They changed the menu a few weeks ago and the new additions were delicious.  The standouts was the sweet pea risotto, it was so moist and flavorful I could have licked the bowl clean.  They also changed the entire dessert menu and the biscoff ice cream cone situation is on another level, we had a little fight at our table over sharing it.  So my advice, get two of them!!

I used to have to come out to Charlotte for work frequently, and one of the things I did enjoy about my visits was trying out all the great food options available. Good Food on Montford was by far my favorite places to have dinner. The ambiance is quite relaxing after a long day at work in a place you aren't used to. Our servers were always exceptional and obliging when asked to split the bill for expense report purposes. My favorite dishes were the pork belly bun (seriously, great pork buns in CLT) and the gnocchi. I suggest coming here with a group (maybe a table of 4) so you can try a little bit of everything. Save room for dessert - they have several options that are very thoughtfully executed.

Excellent.  I've been to this restaurant on multiple occasions and have left each time very full and very pleased.  The restaurant is smallish and tables are close to each other which can lead to a somewhat loud environment.

Wait staff has generally been good, friendly and knowledgeable. 

Food has been great!  The dishes are well balanced and tasty every time.  Given that it's a tapas place you might expect some dishes to fall short.  And sometimes they have extraordinary touches that are entirely unexpected.  Like a drizzle of lemon oil on a delicious bowl of pea soup.

Desserts are also really great.  The Pot de Creme is my absolute favorite, however it is incredibly rich, so plan on sharing.

Good beer and wine selection.  I've not yet tried the cocktails.

where to begin... i went in solo and they were able to accommodate me very quickly. I got the beef carpaccio (unbelievable), pork bun (very good), scallops (out of this world), and the pomes frittes. Will definitely return given the opportunity.

We recently tried Good Food for the first time, and it was wonderful. The steamed bun with pork belly was my favorite, and you must try the mussels. We had great drinks, great service, and a wonderful time. Make sure you get there early, or get in line using their online app. There are not many large tables, so go in a small group or be prepared to wait a bit.

THIS IS MY 200th REVIEW! I went here after work for an early dinner and was blown away by the quality of the food. This place should be called GREAT Food on Montford! It is an unassuming brick building with a cool, cozy decor on the inside, almost like a Colorado or California tavern - can't figure it out, but it works well! The people watching (ok, the hot ladies) were very nice to look at while eating. The staff was spot on about the food and drinks. I will be back!! Loved this place! Great place for a date too!
Will seat people randomly, even when you are on the waiting list. Can't recommend this establishment.

The food was great however I do wish there were a few more vegetarian options! The falafel was good and their truffle fries were to die for!! They had a very nice drink selection as well! I love the decor, the feel of the establishment, how fresh the food was, and how attentive the staff was. Parking was a little hard to find however it was a Saturday night so not a surprise! I would definitely come here again!
Delicious, great flavor. I had the Arepa on a sweet potato with goat cheese and pomegranates.  It was the best I have ever had! The Colbert was also very yummy.

Hands down...THE best food experience in CHARLOTTE!! LOVED everything! Our service was great too! A little crowded on a Saturday night but kind of expected. Only a 20 minute wait around 10 pm but still packed. 
I would HIGHLY recommend the scallops. They were cooked to perfection. Also a must is the pork belly steam bun of course! Pomme frites were some of the best I've had. Honestly everything was excellent and we tried almost everything! Being that we did try everything we had no room for dessert. I am looking forward to returning to try those beautiful creations. 
Treat yourself! It's a little pricey but the quality, preparation, service and even plating are so worth it!! Do yourself a favor and GO!

After an exhausting day, we needed some good food. And lucky for us, Good Food on Montford lived up to its name! We arrived around 7:15PM and were told it would be about an hour to an hour and a half wait, which we were fine with since we read so many great reviews about this place. And the wait really was completely worth it!  

The one thing that I ordered that I was not crazy about was my drink. I ordered the strawberry lavender margarita, because it sounded unique with the addition of lavender. While it tasted good, it was not worth $13, in my opinion. I much rather have spent the $13 on another dish and had more food. Because the food was THAT good.

So now, the amazing food: We ordered 5 dishes for 2 people. All of the dishes are tapas size, so they recommended 2-3 dishes per person. We ordered all of the food at once, but they staggered the dishes really nicely so that we never had too much food on our table. The first dishes to come out were the Pommes Frites and the Steamed Buns. After looking at the pictures on yelp, I knew I wasn't going to want to share the Steamed Bun, so we ordered 2 of that dish to curb any puppy eye begging from me to my husband. But my favorite dish ended up being the Pommes Frites. These are the best French fries I've ever had IN MY LIFE. I didn't even want to dip them in any ketchup because they were so good on their own. The truffle oil & parmesan cheese combination on them is incredibly delicious and addictive. Big big winner here. And the steamed buns were my second favorite. It is a must order as well. The other 2 dishes we ordered were the Gnocchi and Korean Beef. Both were excellent and flavorful! I can't wait to try more of the food here!

And since all of these dishes were so wonderful, we knew we couldn't leave without trying their desserts too. So we ordered the peach cobbler with homemade blueberry ice cream and cannoli cheesecake. Every bite of each dessert was heavenly!

You better believe you are missing out on some good food if you haven't been here yet. You may have to wait awhile for your table, but your taste buds will thank you!
This place deserves the name.  Had the fish special, pork bun and mushrooms and all were fantastic.  Service was great.

Love this place.  The cocktails are always awesome and no matter what we order, it's always good.  My favorite is the gemelli.. Their desserts are also very good and I'm not a huge dessert person.   Great for special occasions, but I also like to eat at the bar with Friendster just a night out.  The only thing to keep in mind is that it gets crowded and they don't take reservations, so get there early.

Good Food certainly lived up to the expectations of one of Charlotte's finest. We went for my birthday and my fiancé described it as "the perfect place to
go when you can't decide what type of food [cuisine] you want." We enjoyed a nice variety of flavors and styles of dishes. The green curry mussels and the gnocchi were the two stand outs. I would have drank the curry sauce if that were appropriate, it's that good. We ordered the pommes frites to dip in the sauce as well as some extra bread. The gnocchi were light and airy and the sauce was rich without being heavy, highly recommended. 

The pork bun was good but just not our favorite. My fiancé loved the quail lettuce wraps and being quite knowledgeable of the bird, thought it was perfectly cooked. However, neither of us loved the sauce that was on the place beneath the lettuce wraps. 

The blackberry bramble was also delicious and not overly sweet.

Really a 3.5. Which is A OKAY. The service was fantastic, and the inside of the restaurant is just beautiful. I was ready to spend money on small plate tapas, and we sure as heck did. These tapas are tiny. Think $10- $11 for pork carnitas (tacos)...and the plate is two tiny corn tortillas with some pork. Eeeesh. The best part of the meal was the cheese plate and the carnitas (flavor wise). Also got trout which was good but nothing special, and the fried chicken which was so overwhelmed by an incredibly salty topping (sweet potato maybe?) that it was nearly inedible. I was so excited to try this place and I'm glad I did, but I wish we had spent the $100 elsewhere.

One of our favorites in Charlotte. A must! My fiancé and I recently went here for his birthday and had the mussels, pomes frittes, pork bun, And Korean beef. All were delicious, but the mussels and pork bun were our favorite!

Husband and I came in for a birthday dinner. We picked the wrong place for the occasion and accept responsibility for it.

Our waiter advised us that most people order 4-6 plates for dinner. We ordered 1 cocktail, the falafel and fried chicken. Falafel consisted of 4 TINY falafel with 4 pickles. They were around the size of a quarter. Fried chicken was 2 chunks of chicken. The food was decent but way too small of a portion, especially to share and I'm a small eater. Waiter was nice and the food came out in a reasonable amount of time.  Overall, if we just wanted cocktails ($12 /glass) we might stop back in. If you're hungry, you'll pay from $6-15 for each tiny plate. 
The atmosphere is nice, it's a small place with limited parking.
Should be called Mouthgasm on Montford.  Thats all I got.

I had an absolutely amazing birthday dinner here.  I had never visited before but I will be sure to be back!  Here is my breakdown...

The service was great.  We were immediately greeted when we walked in and brought to a table.  Our server was attentive and the food orders all came out correctly.  We also had some great champagne and wine.  

Honestly, what really makes this restaurant have the "wow factor" is the food.  It was so delicious.  The scallops we ordered were tender and flavorful.  The mussels had a unique but awesome taste - definitely keep extra bread on hand for dipping in the leftover sauce.  Even my birthday cake slice was fantastic!

I wish the restaurant was a tad bigger but it has a cozy feel.  However, on the weekends when it gets busy, there isn't much room to wait for a table.   Even so, I would highly recommend this restaurant.  I'm impressed with Good Food on Montford!

This was probably one of the nicer draws for Charlotte; we truly enjoyed the food mixtures. The staff was very attentive, provided amazing directives regarding food choices.  All meals were prepared to perfection and the wine list was exceptional.  By the way the deserts were equally exquisite and delightfully indulging.  Perfection

A foodie's dream kinda place.  Carefully planned and executed small plates.  Nice variety, good quality foods.  

This was a fun meal, where four of us took turns ordering items, with a few choices made at each course.  We passed our plates around and had a lot of great conversation.

We enjoyed our beer, wine and cocktails, and had great service, too!

We often pass on desserts, but could not resist, on that evening.

Great food + great company = Awesome evening

My parents and I visited Good Food on Montfort last night based on previous Yelp reviews. I must say, GFOM did not disappoint. The atmosphere was nice, This suited the open restaurant just fine and added energy to the whole experience. 

The server was quite helpful from the beginning, providing assistance for our wine selection. We were all chomping at the bit to order each item that caught our attention (and trust me there were plenty). Their eclectic selection of tapas style dishes made for a pleasurable tasting experience. All of their flavors blended well together with none of them overpowered the other. It was a true show of their chef's vision. After all was said and done, the three of us were fully content. 

Top Items: Arugula Salad, Sautéed Mushrooms, Pork Tenderloin, Steam Bun, and Macadamia Nut Pie with Banana Ice-cream

Good food is an appropriate name. The food is good and the ambience is nice.  Definitely different from most places and in a good way.  It's a refreshing change from the other Montford restaurants in my opinion.  I have been several times and usually enjoy it overall. This is a fun place to try but probably not a place to keep in a more regular rotation.  For what you get it's just a bit overpriced (I know it's small plates but portions are really small even for small plates at those prices). It's also usually hard to get a spot without a wait and the bar area can get a bit packed with people waiting for tables and therefore fight for space.  The waitstaff and bartenders are seem to have a rather nonchalant demeanor versus a customer friendly attitude which I find a bit frustrating at times. It's worth giving it a try for sure though...

I have 3 allergies and was not able to eat anything on the menu - it was a big surprise and disappointment. The waitress did not know what was in the food she was serving, but the chef was kind enough to come talk to me about ingredients and make me something I could have. I ended up with mushrooms and salmon. While it was decent, it was not worth it for me to dine out. The person I dined with did not have allergies and enjoyed their meal a lot. Overall, it would be a great place, but it is really not allergy friendly.

Ate here the other night! It was so good, we took the advice of some friends and came right when they opened because the wait can be really long.  The food was excellent though and all the servers were very friendly and knowledgeable!
Always great service and always great food. Haven't had anything I haven't enjoyed. Buns are always a go to favorite!

Awesome food and great drinks.  We came here and waited an hour, but got a space at the bar.  We tried the farmhouse cheese plate (delicious, but small), gnocchi, steamed bun, pork carnitas, and cinnamon bun cobbler for dessert.  We were truly impressed by the gnocchi and pork carnitas, the flavor was outstanding.  The steamed bun was good, but we both felt that it could use a more even coating of sauce for every bite.  Cinnamon bun cobbler was beautiful and quite tasty.

I would definitely come back.  However, be prepared to wait for a table on a weekend and spend a good amount of money on small-portion tapas.

OM-delicious! This is a small restaurant with limited seating, so be prepared to wait but it is SO worth the wait. My husband and I went on a Friday evening and the wait was just over an hour, but they were great about taking our phone number and suggesting we walk around or stop in somewhere for a drink while we waited. We popped next door to Braswells (tasty Georgia Peach mule) and waited for our call. We went back to Good Food on Montford when our table was ready and had an amazing meal with excellent service. I would highly recommend the Canvasback Cabernet - it's smooth and a perfect pair for the tastiness of the food. The plates are small..made to be shared. We shared (and loved) the arugula salad, squash soup, grilled shrimp, red snapper and Gnocchi. It was MORE than enough food, but it was all so delicious we had samples of each and eagerly waited for the next plate of deliciousness to arrive. Jessica, from the bar, was our server and she was awesome. She knew how to course our meals so we didn't have more than one plate at the table at a time. The atmosphere, the food and wine and the service were on point. I wouldn't say it would be great place for a group larger than 4. I would say 100% go to Good Food on Montford!

I've been here 6 times now, and I feel like I can Pass Judgement on this place.

Good Food on Montford really is the best restaurant I've been to in:

Charlotte
North Carolina
North & South Carolina combined

I might wax poetic later, but if you live anywhere near GFoM and consider yourself a food lover - you need to try this place.  The service is quite competent and friendly - show up in a suit jacket or jeans; you'll get treated right either way.  Expect to spend $25 / per if you're not drinking booze.  I find the food an incredible value, personally.

I'll go on record right now saying the pork belly steamed bun is the best thing you can legally ingest in the Charlotte city limits.  Go gitchusome!

Good Food never disappoints.  Go here if you don't mind a wait, and you won't be disappointed.  The scallops, fries, pork belly steamed bun are my go to menu favorites.  If you are in a hurry or impatient this is not the restaurant for you.  If you have time to relax and have a few cocktails, Good Food is an amazing dining experience.  Make sure you order two orders of the fries, because they are the best, and you won't want to share them.

A friend had given me a gift card for this place. Since the amount was so high...I decided to make it a fun night for all of us. We got there...it was quite busy and the wait was about 30 minutes. There was not much room for a group of four of us to be at the bar...we decided to go next door and grab a drink while we waited..and were encouraged to do so. 
The atmosphere in the restaurant...dimly lit, lots of people...and really good food!  The waiter helped us make a selection for our bottle of wine, which at the end of the meal we decided to re-cork the rest...and bring home!!  Food was excellent and fast; great for sharing so you can try a little bit of everything with a group of people. I will be back.

I'm a little biased since I married the steamed bun then ate it.

First off its just a cute place. I sat a little closer to strangers than I usually like but it didn't matter because of the food. Our waiter was friendly and attentive.

It's a tapas place and they recommend 3 dishes per person. Not everything we ordered was on the menu that they have online so be easy on me as I try to recall what we ate.

We started off with fried broccoli  (which was by total accident, the waiter put in the order wrong so we got it for free). It was pretty good. The sauce is on the bottom which we didn't realize at first.

Next came our tiny little falafels. Tiny yet tasty.

Korean Beef with crispy rice.... yummmmmm!!!

I want to say we then had Quail lettuce wraps. They aren't on the online menu but they were amazing.

Followed by the Steamed bun- a piece of heaven landed in my mouth.

I know we had something else before dessert but for the life of me I cannot remember.

For dessert I had the chocolate martini and he got the brownie. The icecream served with the brownie tasted just like a teddy gram!!!


I am so pleased with Good Food and cannot wait to go back there!

I swore I wrote a review for GFonM already, but apparently I didn't!

When my GF graduated college I wanted to take her to the best restaurant in the QC and saw how highly rated this place was on Yelp.

Well they didn't disappoint.  The place is kind of neat because it is fancy and white tablecloth-y, but you wouldn't stick out that bad if you were dressed casual but nice.  The waitstaff didn't seem pretentious at all either.  They are totally down to earth and made good recommendations.

It is pricey, but actually the price per dish isn't that bad at all, although the portion size is quite small of course.  If you are starving and want to fill up it is going to cost you.

We got like half of the dishes on their menu and they were all very good.  They accidentally gave us someone else's Korean Beef, which was a good bonus since it was delish.  I thought it was one of our orders!

Good wine selection and fantastic decor.  The "mood lighting" is definitely dark, which makes it a little tough to see your food, but it's acceptable.  

Parking can be pretty rough and if you want to take a walk around after your meal, your options are somewhat limited.  I tried to take a lap around the block and had to scale parking garages and jump puddles to take a loop, but hey that's Charlotte for ya.

I travel through Charlotte and layover once in awhile and had the good fortune of finding Good Food through Yelp. Not gonna go too detailed on this review but i'll leave it at this: the place should be called Good Food, Good Drinks, Good Service on Montford. That is all.
Definitely delicious! I love their small plates, they are so good. The waitress is so helpful with our order. I would recommend this place!

While in Charlotte, NC my girlfriend and I ate at Good Food for dinner.  We went here due to the popularity and rating on Yelp and figured we wouldn't be disappointed with the food.  When we arrived, there wasn't too long of a wait but enough time to grab a cocktail at the bar.  For the chilled options, I tried the Charcuterie and the Beef Carpaccio Giardiniera.  I enjoyed both of these dishes.  I had the Confit Lamb Belly which was very good but when they say small plates they really mean small plates.  My girlfriend ordered a pasta she enjoyed also.  Overall, we both enjoyed this place and would recommend to anyone looking for a quality dinner in Charlotte.

I had a great dinner with a coworker last night.  We shared multiple dishes.  My favorite was the Steamed Bun.  The Korean Beef was a close 2nd.   The restaurant was slammed so the food was a little slow coming out.  Worth the wait!

Enjoyed Good Food last night around 745. Miraculously we got a table for 2 in less than 10 minutes. Had 3 small plates: pork schnitzel, risotto with peas, and the pasta with crumbled sausage. All were delicious. Great dessert-fresh peach with a raspberry ice cream, gelato or sorbet. Cocktails were good, spicy and not wimpy. Only thing is hate is parking on Montford. Good Food gets it right.

I thought the food here was the best I've had in Charlotte.  First of all I I will address the fact that all of their plates are Tapas and are small portions.  This can be a problem for some considering you don't get a ton of food for the price that you pay.  This being said, the quality of the food you get is incredible and you can easily get full from 2-3 tapas.  It's an amazing experience with plenty of unique and creative dishes full of taste.  Try the Korean Beef, the carpaccio, and the steamed pork belly bun to be sure (they were my favorites).  I would return in a heartbeat.

If I could marry this restaurant, I would!! Had the Falafel, Poached Farm Egg, finishing with the Pot de Creme. Everything is perfectly balanced and well executed. Met a nice couple who attend here frequently and said this is their favorite restaurant in Charlotte. I lucked out!!!

It's great tasty food, I usually complain about American restaurants portions being too humongous but this place I've a the opposite problem, their portions are really small and the price is on the steep side, but I still give this place five stars because of the amazing work that the chef does. No matter what you order you can't go wrong. Food is excellent, the restaurant it self is not that big so depending on the time you come there may a bit of a wait but it's worthy. 
 I'll add some pictures next time.

I'm so glad I found this place on the outskirts of Charlotte. I went in on a Tuesday night right around opening time-5:30pm and grabbed a seat at the bar. The place filled up pretty fast.

The space has a hipster feel, nice bar area with a chefs table area. The menu is all small plates with a nice variety. 

Here is the food rundown on what I ordered:

Asian salad - this was a nice green salad with a clean fresh taste...a bit of soy and sesame as well as a nice thick sauce on the side. 

Poached egg with root vegetables - this was outstanding. It's true that a poached egg makes anything better! There is something about the combination of the crunchy veggies, the poached egg and the beet sauce. Delicious.

Steamed Bun - very tasty, nice soft bun with savory pork and nice pickles veggies.

Total bill with two martinis AND tip was $61.00, which was very reasonable for the quality of food.
I will definitely be back next time I am in Charlotte.

After hearing so many word of mouth raves about this place we decided to check it out during a beautiful summer evening. 

The restaurant is located on Montford and has a distinct retro-modern natural vibe inside (think exposed brick and wood). There is a simple patio outside and a parallel bar area with high tables (which is where we sat). There is a lot of energy inside so don't expect a quiet meal.

As many have stated, the menu is tapa's style, with a number of small plates, along with entree's should you desire. The menu is seasonal so what we ate may not be available later in the year. 

Everything from the arugula salad to the falafel to the seared scallops with corn was wonderful. The service is just right, attentive without being overly pushy and the wine list is lively.

Overall a great experience and fine night - both this place and Barrington's top my list of Charlotte's best.
Don't miss this Charlotte gem!   best foodie restaurant in town

Since 2009 this is my favorite spot in Charlotte. The atmosphere is comfortable and lively, the service is attentive, friendly and stable (John and some of the servers have been there for years and are great at remembering regulars), great cocktails, reasonably priced and excellent wine selection, and fantastic food. They rotate the small plates preparations and selections regularly. Don't miss the Korean Beef, fried oysters, falafel balls, and whatever the fish special is.

Best date spot in Charlotte.   Good cocktails.  Good wine list.   HAVE to try the Gnocchi!!!!

No reservations, so come ready to have a few cocktails at the bar while waiting.

Wow. What can I even say??? "Good" is the wrong name for this place!! The food is beyond fantastic! I have been here several times (on date nights, dinner with my sister, as well as bringing out of town friends here), and it has never disappointed yet! The wine selection is ok, but they pair nicely with the food options (which is perfect).
This will always be a go to spot to bring people when you want to impress them with dinner, or even just to have a nice dinner!

Wow, what a fabulous surprise this place was for me last night. Great ambiance, cocktails, and service! The food was outstanding, especially the salmon and lobster dish. The small plates were perfect and allowed us to try several very tasty dishes. Our server, Jeffrey, nailed it as far as professional service goes. Highly recommend this place. I'll be back for sure.

So my mom and I are visiting charlotte from Miami, FL. We found this place on yelp and decided to check it out because of the high rating. 

This place is so cute. It's very small so expect to wait awhile on a weekend night. Our wait for 2 was 30 minutes but didn't get sat for almost 45. Luckily we went to the bar and got some drinks. I got a ginger mule and my mom got the Madison park punch. Both AMAZING but a tad pricey. We closed our tab prior to dining and the drinks with tip and tax was $35. 

The food was spectacular. It is a tapas menu and they separate the dishes out in 5 different styles. "Warm, chilled, pasta, sea and one more I can't remember the name. We got the pomme frites AMAZING, beef carpaccio was very very good, fried chicken and the steamed bun was superb. We had to wait quite a bit for the garginelli pasta but it was my least favorite of the whole dinner. We looked at the dessert menu but chose not to get anything. 

Overall it was a great cute little place with really good food. Drinks were a tad pricey but they were amazing. Would definitely go again.

So to wrap up a year long project in Charlotte, the team decided to hit up Good Food for our final team meal. I had been a few times and have enjoyed myself here and figured it was a good spot to celebrate everything the team had accomplished. We were able to score a table relatively easy on a Monday night and showed up with our group of 6. We were greeted promptly at the door with smiles and immediately brought over to a table with menus in hand. The servers were very attentive throughout the meal and I appreciate the "joking around" she was doing with the table as it certainly lightened up the mood.

We looked at the menu and we decided to order a whole array of dishes given the plates here are relatively small. That is something to note for people thinking of showing up in groups more than 4, is that sharing can be difficult so you will want to plan out how to share everything evenly. After perusing the menu, we went with the charcuterie board, the cheese board, carpaccio, falafel, pommes frites, the sautéed mushrooms, the garganelli, the gnocchi, pork carnitas, the steamed buns, the Moroccan spiced chicken sausage, fried chicken, Korean beef, and the scallops. We essentially ordered almost everything minus the seafood given the dietary restrictions at the table. The server was able to balance all the food as well as kept the drinks flowing with ease. As mentioned we ordered a few things twice because of lack of availability to share and focused on those that were extra good. The charcuterie board and cheese boards were nice dish to share with the table and was standard cuts across the board making it easy to eat. The carpaccio was DELICIOUS and had good flavor with the pimento cheese and we ended up ordering two of these for the table. The Falafel was good and the greek yogurt sauce was good but we ended with one helping as it didn't have a special kick or lacked that extra "umph". The pommes frites were good as well and standard fries with truffle oil which you obviously cant go wrong with. The sautéed mushrooms are absolutely delicious and I probably inhaled an entire plate by myself. Its just a simple clean dish with fresh herbs and sliced garlic but boy is it addictive. The garganelli was delicious with the home made Italian sausage being on point with the simplicity of the red sauce to it. We HAD to order two of this and it went fast. The Gnocchi is always a show stopper here and is really well made. It was another crowd pleaser and candidate for two. The Steamed buns are probably another top item and is better than some Asian restaurants I had been to. It's essentially a big pork bun and again a perfect candidate for ordering more than one order given the size. The pork carnitas was good but not something that warranted extra stomatch space so we moved on to the Moroccan spiced chicken sausage. It paired well with the tahini and we got a few orders of these as the meat was spiced and cooked really well. The fried chicken was good with the collard greens on the side and again another crowd pleaser. The  Koren beef was a good attempt at a fusion dish but ultimately fell short and the scallops were the same deal where it was good but not worth another pass.

All in all, this is a great restaurant with great service and certainly one of the better establishments in Charlotte. Some of the dishes are just really strong dishes with others being good. Definitely worth the visit so make sure to drop by

We thought this restaurant lived up to its name, good food and decent cocktails.  We knew there was going to be a wait, so we got there right as it opened and still had to sit at the bar! After it was all said and done, we thought this place was good, but overhyped.

With experience at Barrington's under his belt, award winning chef Bruce Moffett set off to create a tapas style restaurant -- this place does not disappoint. It gets  ist fast, so you have to come at a good time, but the service is always good and the food is always spectacular! Chef Schreiber's small plate menu is constantly changing with the season using only local and organic ingredients -- and you can definitely tell, as the food tastes incredibly fresh. Good food is a good place to go out with friends in Montford or just have a nice date night.

I recommend the star of the menu: the steamed bun, which is a five spice rubbed pork belly dressed with hoisin and pickled vegetables. This pillowy bun is going to be a hit at the table so I suggest ordering more than one. The Poached Farm Egg is also really good, which is made with root vegetables, maitake mushrooms, and root juice. The flavor pairings in this dish are really nice and a good start to the evening. Lastly, I am obsessed with the braised duck gnocchi, which comes with greens, toasted pecans and is covered in a warm acorn squash puree. The gnocchi is nice and fluffy, and tastes very savory with the squash and duck.

Had an amazing meal with my husband and some friends at Good Food last night.  We tried 9 different plates, including the gnocchi, the steam buns, the poached egg, the mussels, the garganelli pasta, the Korean beef and the pork carnitas.  There were a few others, but the dishes I mentioned above really stand out! I would highly recommend this restaurant if you're looking for a fun sharing dinner experience!

Great place. Small place with great bar and outside lounge area as well. Little on the pricey side of $48 for one person but I ordered the chartruderie plate, Korean beef, glass of champagne and red velvet Twinkie. The chartruderie was average and didn't excite too much although it was delicious especially the foie gras with chutney but it lacked presentation. The Korean beef was out of this world!  Cooked to perfection, presented well and ate every last drop of it. The red velvet Twinkie was also different and well worth trying. Delicious and perfect for finishing the night with champagne

Everything about Good Food was amazing. We had quite a wait on a Saturday night since they don't take reservations, but it was so worth it. The buns are unreal, the tega greens were inspirational...basically everything here is delicious. We will definitely be back soon!

It is really good food.
I love the place. It is a first come first serve.
Their wine collection is good, the only problem they don't have wine cellar, and their wine is always warm, specially in Summer.
Never a disappointment. Creative, flavorful, and excellent service. If you are a small party and the seating is full, ask to sit at the Chef's table.

THEIR NAME DO NOT LIE. This is my first time eating at a Tapas style dinner, and I loved it! Our server was very informative, the food came out in a timely manner and we never had to wait too long for the next dish. We ordered 6 dishes to share between 3 people, oh lord they really do fill you up! We ordered the pomme frities, gnocchi, grilled squid, Korean beef on crispy rice, bao, French onion soup, fried oyster, and UBE cheesecake. First can we just take a minute to take in the fact that they have UBE!! I've have yet to find a place in CLT that sells ube, thank you thank you thank you!. Everything was all so good, I have no complaints and I really appreciate their fancaay presentation of the dishes! I really like their gnocchi, squid and since I don't eat red meat I had a piece of the crispy rice & the sauce that it came with, it . was . Bomb. I'm so glad we decided to come here because I kid you not, this food bless my tastebuds.

I've been wanting to try this place for quite some time, finally had the opportunity when a friend from Boston was in town and wanted to grab dinner...we both are big fans of Tapas which is kinda a rare find in the QC (part of reason I havnt been here, most of my friends don't want a bunch of small plates). Needless to say I think Boston is an excellent food city so had to find a good place to hold its own, lemme tell ya Good Food did not disappoint!
We started with the cheese plate which was excellently paired with jams.  Other highlights were the gnocchi and the steamed bun.  OH MY GAWD that pork belly steamed bun! Must have if you go!  Drinks were excellent! A few good local drafts and excellent service.  It was crazy busy, even for a Tuesday night (hey don't do reservations) so we sat at the bar.  Service was excellent and bartender was very knowledgeable.  For dessert we had the pot de cremé which was a chocolate/espresso dessert and it was amazing as well!

Can't wait to go back to this place and will definitely be a go to for impressing out of downers!

This place was amazing!  It is a tapas style restaurant so do not go here and expect to by one dish and be full (the average person could probably be satisfied with 2-3), but i love that as well!  this way you can try all sorts of different dishes.  
Food: 5 stars- incredibly creative fresh and delicious (get their banana bread if they have it during your visit)
Service: 5 stars- waitress was friendly and helpful, my glass was never empty and the table was never dirty
Drink: definite 5 stars- try thier fig smash you will love it
I will definitely be becoming a regular here.  Oh!  i love that they are a farm to table restaurant as well and try to use ingredients that are as fresh and as local as possible!
Very good. A bit noisy. For two of us we ordered a couple of salad type dishes and three entree type dishes. All were very good.

It was the last day of our Charlotte trip and after days of eating BBQ and fried food, I was hankering for some pasta or SOMETHING else lol. The lovely hostess for our Charlotte trip suggested going to Good Food as she and her husband had never been there before either. The menu sounded okay and the prices looked good.

The area was definitely a bumpin' night life scene with a pretty nice looking bowling alley across the street which was filled with people drinking and playing cornhole outside. Anyway, so, here's my breakdown of Good Food:

- Tapas style, but larger portions (2 dishes should MORE than suffice your appetite!)
- Not too expensive (around $10 a dish depending on what you get)
- I tried the gnocchi, salmon & pomme frites - all delicious!
- THE SAUCES ARE ON POINT HERE. All of our different dishes had an excellent sauce that could be engulfed all by itself.
- My drink was the Blackberry Bourbon Smash - super strong, borderline tasted like cough syrup, but I didn't hate it! I actually quite enjoyed it.
- Soothing ambiance, nice decor, good & attentive service

Thoroughly enjoyed my experience here with superb company!

Yes. This place is awesome. I only wish it was a little bigger and had more tables. It's usually pretty packed, but that's because it is so good. The steamed bun is ridiculously good. The shrimp arepas (not really an arepa, but their "take" on it) are incredible too. The staff is great and I like the atmosphere. There is seating out front to hang out and have a drink while you wait too. It's not cheap, but it's worth it. Portions are not very big either, but this is a quality over quantity experience. Try it.

Get here before they open, the line grows quickly, the place fills up by 5:35pm and rightfully so. The service is impeccable, fast and professional. This is a tapas restaurant so plan selections accordingly and to maximize sharing.  We had several of the valentines weekend specials, the Raw WellFeet Oysters with caviar, the Golden Tile Fish and chocolate desert which were all superb. We also had many of the regular menu items, all very very good with the exception of the Gnocchi, but being Italian its hard for me to find a place that serves this dish as well as i can make it at home, but it was still good. Try their cocktails, they are great, especially the rosemary infused gin. The waiter knew his way around the drinks and made several great suggestions. Too much to chose from and you will get filled up quickly. The tapas allows for variety and sharing which is always fun.

They do not accommodate vegetarians. We have attempted multiple times to dine here and they are always uncooperative with accommodating a vegetarian dish. This is extremely disappointing. I understand the tapas and seasonal aspect, but to be unable to provide a dish or two for a simple request for vegetarian dishes is unacceptable. Not to mention that they have been EXTREMELY rude and dismissive even when we called to ask.

i love coming here. the food is outstanding! i also love that they do not take reservations......i sometimes go here and there on a whim and reservations do not work for me. we just sit at the bar.....btw it is very comfortable and spacious so your not all up in someone's business elbowing while you eat. this place is definately one of the top 10 in charlotte,nc.
swanky ,loud ,kinda pricey....it was worth a try but won't go back to often.great menu but like I said small portions with a heavy price tag.

Stopped by Good Food on Montford after reading some reviews and hearing that the cast and crew from Homeland went there. Lucked into a primo parking spot - which can be a problem on Montford.

Went on a Wednesday night around 7:00 and was told there would be a 30 minute wait for a table, but the bar was open; so we sat at the bar.

Limited but OK beer selection on tap.

Looked at the menu and noticed that all menu items looked like small plates. After confirming with the waitress/bartender we decided on three: the Gnocchi, Steamed Bun and the mussels. All three were very good. My wife loved the mussels and I loved the steamed bun.

Ordered one more pasta dish and it was good, although not as good as the other three. 

Service was fine, not great, not bad and prices were OK.

We're definitely going back.
Awesome restaurant! I am a huge fan of tapas and this is by far one of, if not my absolute favorites! Delicious food and an awesome atmosphere.

We were entertaining a very influential guest on a Friday evening and decided to take her to Good Food. We were told the wait would be 1.5 hours. Fine. No problem. 

After 1 hour and 20 minutes, we decide to check on how much longer. The host could not have been more rude or less gracious. All he had to do was be a gentleman and tell us it would be just a few more minutes in a kind tone of voice. We totally understand everyone has a bad day every now and then, but this was the second time we have encountered this host. I am not sure why he works in the restaurant industry because he clearly does not enjoy his job. 

Needless to say, we will not be back to Good Food. This is incredibly unfortunate because the food truly is great; however, with so many awesome restaurants in Charlotte, there are many other places to go and enjoy a great dinner on a Friday night out.

Fantastic! Service was very attentive- everything we ordered was delicious and beyond our expectations. The quail lettuce wrap was a pleasant surprise, pork tenderloin was very tender and the gnocci was fabulous!! Cant wait to go back :)
Delicious and fun. Service was great, will miss being able to eat here since my time in Charlotte for work is over.

This restaurant is very good. It's a cozy gem located on an otherwise crazy street. I would consider having dinner here a "true culinary experience". The restaurant is always buzzing and usually has a wait. Everytime I've been here, the menu has been different which I think is kind of fun! The plates are small and somewhat expensive so I would consider this place for a date night or a celebratory dinner. I would recommend Good Food on Montford to others.
Deserves the hype. Coconut curry mussels and steamed buns were On point. Like everyone else says it's a long wait at times but technology (no wait and yelp apps) should ease the pain.
Great place for small plates. Good service, reasonable prices, and good service. Get there early- no reservations = wait for a table.

This is one of my favorite places to eat in charlotte. They have a seasonal menu, but keep some constants throughout the year. Sometimes they are lacking in the vegetarian options, but everything I have ever eaten here has been awesome (even when it sounds kind of boring!) There is often a line when they first open the doors and they do not usually take reservations, so plan accordingly! It is a tapas style restaurant so plan on ordering at least 2 dishes per person. It is not cheap, but the cost-quality ratio is spot on! It's full service at the bar if you don't want to wait! Usually the bar fills up so you might have to wait for a spot to open up. The seating is tight, but the food is so worth it!

Have eaten here twice in the past 2 months - and both times sat at he chef's bar area. Food is always spot on and I love watching the action in the kitchen. Chris, the chef behind the bar patiently answered my questions about the food he was making. We always get the same things when we eat here but this time tried the soft poached egg on his recommendation and it was amazing. We always order: 
- charcuterie (the chicken liver mousse is possibly my favorite thing to eat. Ever.)
- steamed bun
- green curry mussels
- garganelli 

Also - if you need ranch dressing with your fries- there's an Applebee's down the street you should try!

The pot de creme was amazing!  The espresso really gave the chocolate a nice boost of flavor.  This place has a very nice and casual atmosphere.  My boyfriend and I plan on coming back here for date night.
The server was great thank you! Everything was so very good! Loved the place and the food!

What an amazing food concept!!!! When you first walk in, it reminds me of eating in a museum. Art and woodwork really come together. Great place for a first date or celebration of any kind, or if you're wanting to impress anyone from out of town. GET THERE EARLY!!! Doors open @5pm but the line starts at 4:13... lol

Everything is served as an appetizer, or super small portion but it's so filling. I also love that food comes out as soon as it's done, in no order whatsoever. You Must Eat: southern farmhouse cheese, pomme frites ( I licked the plate!), Gnocchi, Springer mtn fried chicken, crispy fried oysters, and all their desserts..... Larry and Brad (Exec Chef & Manager) have made foodies everywhere proud!!! #JustMelApproved #EatHereNow

This is one of the best places I've ever eaten at. The food is absolutely amazing. I ate here with a number of colleagues and pretty much ordered everything that could be ordered, since we had a group. The wait staff were also knowledgeable and friendly. Would highly recommend this place.

This is my go to spot to bring out-of-town visitors. Great variety of tapas, excellent service, and fun drinks make this a fun and delicious restaurant.
There is almost always a wait, but they will take your phone number and text you when there is a table ready. Montford has some great bars in the area that are walking distance, so I would recommend checking out Moosehead or Barreled at the Lift if you want to get a couple drinks while you wait.
I really enjoy the variety of the tapas. Whether you like seafood, meat, or are a vegetarian, there are plenty of great options. I would recommend about 1-2 per person depending on how hungry you are during your dining adventure.

Some of my favorites include:
The mussels-not a big curry fan but the cilantro curry sauce is worth drinking or at least asking for some extra naan bread to dip.
Steamed Bun-the bun is soft and melts in your mouth, and the pork belly is delicious. Great dressing and veggies on the pork bun as well. I would go here just for the steamed pun.
Pommes Frites-great truffle oil taste with a touch of parmesan. 
Garganelli- similar to a penne pasta with Italian sausage. Some of the best tomato sauce I've ever had, and I'm Italian!
Very tasting drinks as well!

Parking is tough, but I typically will Uber or Lyft here so it makes it much easier.
I would definitely recommend for anyone who loves tapas or great food.
One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte!  Fantastic food - favorite is the mussels.  Great wine menu!  Love the atmosphere - cozy and always crowded but not too loud.  LOVE this place!!!

Excellent and innovative tapas. A bit noisy and "did you see me" clientele, but that shouldn't stop you to enjoy one of the best restaurant (for food/taste) in Charlotte if you like something new.

The decor is simple, the service is pretty good given the number of patrons. The space is optimized, ie a bit crammed but you don't feel it when you eat, though noise level is a bit high (but we've Haden's worse experiences)

The food and the service here is awesome. Expect a wait... Even for bar seating.

I had the pork belly in a steamed bun and the broccoli with fried cheese curd. Both were incredible. I have eaten pork belly quite a few times at other restaurants, and I can easily say that this is the best I've ever had.

The first time I went here I did not like it.  I have been 7-8 times since then and have loved it everytime.  The menu changes often to reflect the season.  Great vibe, great food, great drinks.. what else do you need.

I only give five stars when five stars are due, and this place gets it in Charlotte. 

They don't take reservations, so go early or be prepared to wait. This is one of the busiest restaurant in the city. The service here is good, the staff is knowledgeable. The ambiance is upscale casual. 

The cocktails (change seasonally) are ok the wine list is fair, nothing really to write home but good enough to try a couple. 

The cheese plate had some very good stuff, though the portions were a bit small. The poached farm egg with root vegetables plate was well made, it was new on the menu as well. The fried chicken (new dish) was also very good - chicken coop good (Charlotte natives you know what I'm talking about). The dish you come for though, is the Asian style pork belly steamed bun. I would eat ten of those if it wouldn't give me a heart attack. 

Now I'm not a dessert guy, but the desserts were ok. The best one is the cobbler - if you weren't full before you order it, you will be after. 

If I was a millionaire I would eat here everyday, but again, I would have a heart attack after ten days due to all the pork belly I would have consumed.

Go here now.

I'd been hesitant to visit GFoM because of the prices, but seriously, it is worth it. OMG the steamed pork bun...wow. Great wine, great service, LONG wait (and no reservations), but...amazing.
Great tapas style food. I love this place for a girls night gab and drink wine. Service is kind of a slow but a fun atmosphere nonetheless.
One of my favorite places in Charlotte.  Small dishes reasonable price. Only a few items on the menu but all of them are carefully prepared and delicious
LOVE the food. Hate that they do not take reservations. Host/hostess are always rude but the service once you are seated are great.

A place where you go to savor each bite.  Delicious small plates, seriously small-2-4 bites per dish.  The dishes are each very different, and exquisitely prepared.  It feels like a special occasion every time we go! If you like really good food and tapas, this is your spot.  If you are starving, go a few doors down to the roasting company.

We tried it the weekend before Christmas.

Odd experience, I enjoyed the food but a large branch on the tree out front tried to fall on us before we were seated. The employees did everything correctly after the tree fell but it was just very surprising as my wife and my friends pregnant wife attempted to run and I attempted to catch the falling branch.

Beef Carpaccio: Very good, great balance with the acid.
Pomme Frites: Excellent fries
Braised Duck Fettucini: A  tad rich but quite tasty
Crispy Quail Lettuce Wraps: The meat was a bit under(I prefer it this way but pregnant lady at the table)
Steamed Bun: Great, can be a bit spicy in case you don't like that
Confit Lamb Belly: Best bite of the evening the lentils were incredible.
Korean Beef: The scallion Kim Chi is awesome

Fresh Catch: Monkfish over Oyster Stew The monkfish was great but the oyster stew only worked as a sauce.

The deserts were meager and I would recommend going elsewhere.

Tapas style eating. Need 2-3 dishes per person, we had 5 between myself and my boyfriend. That along with the bread and a beer each, we were full. Everyone comments on the steamed bun so I don't think I need to really mention how good that is, but the mussels, they are AMAZING! The curry sauce is sooo good. I could eat that everyday. A little pricey for the meal but so worth it.
I like this place. I just wish they had more vegan/vegetarian options. They do try to accomodate but the portions are perfect. Order a few things and share.

Blindfold me, put me on a plane, drive me around until I have no idea where I am... then take me to Good Food on Montford and I would guess that I'm in a real foodie city, like NYC, San Fran or maybe Portland.  That's right, this place stands out among the crowded streets of CLT filled with corporate restaurant groups and chains.  

What I like most is they are not afraid to be original with both the menu and the wine list... this is an independent restaurant at its best.  Been here 3 times and will be going back at least once a month or so.  I'd go back more often but I do like to torture myself by trying other sub-par places around town in the hopes that I'll come across a gem like this one.

First time I went, loved everything on the menu.  Each dish was just enough to give me a good taste, and each truly delivered.  Second time I brought a group of 6... I had to tell my friends "trust me" after one friend went to the website and was like "dude where's my meat+2 entree" and while I can't claim to have transformed them all into foodies (yet), everyone loved it.  Third time was a charm - yep, consistency was there, food quality - check, wine list - check, service - check, 5 stars - check.

I have a few more restaurants that I have not been to until my CLT tour is complete, but I imagine there will be no more than 5 or 6 places that get 5 stars.  I have high expectations because I don't think we should pay so much to dine out just to be underwhelmed.  Good Food will over deliver on all aspects.  Go there, now!

Its not named Good Food on Montford for just the warm bread at a table. This place knows how to BRING IT! The small plates are fun and packed with a good food punch. The duck fettucini was AMAZING! The service was fantastic and very friendly. No reservations are taken, first come first serve so either go early or don't go when your on full B mode because you are so hungry. The place is small and fills up quickly but so worth every wait if you do. Enjoy~

We completely trusted the waitress on what to order and she didn't let us down. Everything we ate was amazing and I highly recommend. Between 2 of us we shared 4 dishes and we're content. Our favorites were the pasta garganelli and the steamed bun. Highlights also included the mussels and pork carnitas.
Some of the best tapas you'll find in the city.  It is pricey but worth it!  Inventive menus and great staff!
