Best food in CLT I've had over last year. Pork Belly steamed bun is out of this world. Thai curry mussels, Yum. While food is made for sharing, it's really hard to. Order your own steamed bun!
This was very good- we got there about 6:30 and got seated right away- nice Verdejo wine and then the tapas- the most memorable were the pork bun and the grouper. Enjoyed it and will be back.

Nothing about the food here is good. My husband and I ordered takeout from here and the lamb was cold and extremely undercooked. I have also eaten here for a friends BDay and tried a number of dishes that did not do it for me at all. On food alone, the name does not meet expectations.

I totally understand why they are named Good Food because their food really is good! I thought the waitress was just lovely and very knowledgeable. The only thing I would say is a little bit of a turn-off is that it is a little crammed inside. Other than that I love this place
One of the best restaurants in Charlotte, if not the best. Every dish is amazing. Be prepared to wait on a Friday or Saturday night, but it's worth it.

It's kind of annoying when you live in Charlotte for years and never hear about places like this one! I went there for the first time last night and I am in love with everything about it. The service was the best I had in a long time. Our server Jonathan went above and beyond with excellent recommendations and professionalism. We will make sure to ask for him when we come back (hopefully soon). The food is delicious. We tried just about everything + dessert. I recommend the gnocchi and the carpaccio the most. I also need to add that I love the decoration as well. If feels cozy and perfect for date night

Hands down favorite restaurant in Charlotte. Food is amazing and service is always great. Recently tried their seasonal draft cocktail, the limeade and it was fantastic. All time menu favorties include the mussels and falafel!

I seriously can't think of a thing wrong here....so yeah....5 stars! Ok, so maybe I wish it was closer to uptown so it could provide better views? Doesn't matter, the food, the service and the interior of this place more than make up for it.  I went here with my girlfriend for a late night dinner and was immediately impressed with the decor when I first walked in.  It wasn't overly crowded but we were also there late on a Monday night.  I love the unique lighting fixtures that utilize spoons and forks as decoration.  The bar is a stainless steel top which gives the place a bit of an industrial feel too.  Then to offset the cold industrial feel, you have the right amount of lighting to warm it up along with the wood ceilings with accent reveals to give it even more contrast.  Architecturally I am in love.  

The service was fantastic, very polite, very attentive, knew the menu very well and made us feel like we were the only ones there.

We finished the night out on the patio with a glass of wine and although the view isn't one that will ooh and ahh, so to speak, the furniture is very comfortable and somewhere I could see myself spending a few hours easily.

Do yourself a favor, if you like tapas style food, pay this place a visit.  They don't call it Good Food on Montford for nothing!
Long wait but worth it! Great little dive spot with a lot of small plates to share and try. Definitely get the pork bun! you won't regret it.

A restaurant that truly lives up to its name:  Good Food, and one of the best dining experiences you can have in Crown Town at this time.

The space is a simple building that was converted from an old dentist's office, with the kitchen closed off in the back and a small, but very intimate feeling space inside that doesn't leave the host with more than a coffee table to take names upon.  Still, there is a mix of seating at both a bar, high top tables, and a long bench row of seats with regular tables to match.  You'll feel closer to your fellow dinners, but it adds to the ambiance.  The lighting is just a bit dark and there are nice accents, like the fork and spoon light fixtures that hang above the bar.

Speaking of which, any meal here should begin with a look over the small, yet thoughtful cocktail menu.  There is an obvious emphasis on using seasonal ingredients (which extends to the food menu) and creating unique flavors not found else where.  The wine list is also noteworthy here, not for its length, but for the depth of flavor profiles covered by the selections.  The wine by the glass selections are numerous, but don't miss the bottle section for even broader choices.

The menu itself is a single page broken down into different courses, though everything is served as tapas style portions.  This encourages you to sample around the menu to craft a full meal and you'll be well-served to do so.  There are some mainstays on the menu, but other selections will rotate with the seasonal produce available.  Pick and choose as your taste buds tempt, as this kitchen has obvious skill across multiple different cuisines.

Couple regular options you should give a serious look towards:

1) Steamed Bun: five-spice pork belly and pickled vegetables in hoisin sauce between the softest steamed bun I've ever had.  The flavors all work well here and the texture of the pork and bun literally create a melt in you mouth experience contrasted by the light and bright crunch of julienned carrots and celery.  This is no more than 4 bites big, but the overall package is quite satisfying.  This may not be one to share.

2)  The Cheese Plate:  Too many restaurants don't put enough thought into this, but GFOM shows 'em how it's done.  3 words to prove it: Truffled Plum Chutney.  Yes my gastronomic friends, it is as good as it sounds and pairs well with a buttery soft cheese such as the Camembert it's current paired with.  The plate also includes two other cheese selections, each paired with another flavor-enhancing side, such as local honey and a port-fig reduction sauce.  The cheese portions are comparatively small, but the overall plate is enough to have you going for every last flavorful crumb.

And for my single best insider tip:

3) The Green Curry Mussels with Truffled Pomme Frites (aka Truffle fries).  These are actually two separate menu items, but regulars and servers will almost insist you order them together.  The mussels are steamed to perfection in the most-heavenly green curry broth made rich with coconut milk and then packed with slivers of fresh green herbs.  Eat the mussels quickly and then move on to sop up the sauce with your plate of truffled pomme frites.  Flavorful with the earthiness of truffle in their own right, the fries are just substantial and moist enough to act like a sponge with the green curry sauce.  The taste combination is crazy complex but hearty and satisfying.  This is culinary excellence at work and makes for a most satisfying meal.

Once that's done, the house-made dessert menu will stop by and it's always tempting with fresh, seasonal selections that are right-sized for two to share just a bite, without being some gigantic mess.  Current highlights there include banana pudding cheesecake (perfectly flavored without being too sweet) and a brownie with Biscoff ice cream.  Saving room will pay off here.

So when you want to impress a date with a somewhat hidden gem, this should be a go-to for you in Crown Town.  Consistently great, with the right atmosphere for a classy yet casual evening.  A true must-try!

Expensive, but cheaper than expected (especially for this type/caliber of food). Tapas style restaurant, each person should order 2-3 items and then share across the table so everyone can try everything. Best dish (and largest portion) is the mussels with curry. Holy moly---- it was SO delicious. That sauce is killer. I don't give 5 stars very often and this was such a fun surprise! The location is unassuming which adds to a fun environment. Even with some new employees who were training, the service was excellent, our waiter made fantastic recommendations! The fresh bread is so yummy and the menu changes frequently (though some of the originals stay the same) so we are excited to come back and see what else we can try! 

They do get busy quickly and don't take reservations (you can use the nowait app to hold your place in line though), but I would definitely add this to your food stops in Charlotte.

Wanting to try this for awhile, when our friends from Raleigh came in town they wanted us to take them out.  What better thing than to try a new place? We (party of six) put our name on the list at 6 and by 7, we had a table.  TAKE NOTE- if you don't want to wait at least an hour here--- be there when they open! It's a gem on Montford and people know Good Food has Good Food!!! We had a phenomenal server and the food experience was to-die-for.  Honestly, we ordered almost everything on the menu, including all three seasonal desserts and everything was perfection on a plate.  My top favorites were the steamed mussels, the steamed bun (never had anything quite like this!), and the desserts.  I loved, loved, loved the small plates experience with a large group because we each tried everything that came out..... The food comes out as it's prepared so it's hot and fresh and it's like a new surprise for your palate! I can't wait to go back!!!!

Hooray for yelp!  I would never have never found this restaurant without the awesome recommendations of my fellow yelpers.

The decor is chic/elegant and sports a very nice full service bar.  

The mussels were nothing short of spectacular with a delicious curry/coconut sauce that was reminiscent of a delicious Tom Kha Kai Soup. You will want to drink it when the mussels are gone... trust me.

The Moroccan Spiced Chicken Confit was also amazing.  The dish is served in a miniature Tagine and the tender and delicious chicken with a wonderfully crispy skin is served on top of a delicious bed of chick peas, apricots, and candied lemon zest. 

I can't wait to get back to Charlotte to try some of the other dishes here!

We had a great experience! Just an FYI, they don't take reservations, but you can use the no wait app so the wait isn't as long. We sat at the bar. Our bartender was great, very knowledgeable about the food and wine, and provided great service. The food was good. We had the beef carpaccio, steamed bun, and Korean noodles (which I probably wouldn't order again). But spring for dessert at this spot. The brownie tasted amazing and everything looked fabulous! It is a tapas style joint so prepare to share. I recommend ordering as you go, rather than ordering all at once so you can relax, enjoy yourself, and judge how hungry you are. Definitely check this place out!

I had an absolutely amazing dining experience at Good Food on Monfort.  I was on a trip without a rental car, and this was worth every penny I spent on an Uber to get here from my hotel.

First off the staff are first rate all the way through.  I was well taken care of in a friendly and welcoming waitress who made great recommendations and explained any menu item I had a question about.  The manager was involved in running the floor and made sure that everything was going well throughout the restaurant.

Now let's talk about the most important thing, the food.  The meal was simply amazing.  I ate way more than I should have and had three very unique and delicious dishes.  I started with the steamed pork bun which was first class.  The flavors were very traditional and the bun was steamed perfectly.  It was much bigger than a regular steamed pork bun so it would be good for sharing.

I then moved to the Prince Edwards Island Mussels.  This was served in a green curry coconut sauce that was amazingly flavorful without being too hot or spicy.  The flavors of the sauce were amazing and made the perfect backdrop for the steamed mussels that were meaty and out of this world.

Now, this is where I should have stopped but the dinner next to me was from Italy and he could not stop raving about the Garganelli.  Now when an Italian is raving about a pasta dish, you really should try it so I did.  I understand why he was such a fan.  The flavors in the Garganelli were fresh and bursting with complexity.  The sausage and the pasta were paired beautifully with the slightly sweet tomato sauce.  Mmmmm, it really was great.

I have been contemplating a trip back to Charlotte just to do a food tour because of this restaurant.  I was lucky to be eating on a Tuesday night and was able to get a table.
My favorite place to go eat in Charlotte some of the best tapas in town a little pricy but definitely worth it.

After a long day, nothing beats going to Good Food on Montford.  The food is always on point and the drinks are amazing.  The staff is always happy to make recommendations of a good wine or beer that would pair nicely with your meals. The quality of the food is a steal to the prices and rivals any of the fancy-smancy pretentious places that are in Charlotte and can make a person feel out of place quickly.  Hands down one of my favorite places to go.

I was so pleased with my visit to Good Food. Clearly everyone else has been, too -- at the time of this posting, there were 442 reviews!

I went with a date on a Friday night and anticipated a healthy wait time, but we were seated quickly at a high-top table that provided a great view of the bar and the rest of the restaurant. I asked for an allergen-friendly menu and was pleasantly surprised that the layout had been reworked since my last visit; the new design is much easier to decipher and clearly determine which items adhere to your particular dietary restriction.

We ordered a handful of small plates that were all marked as gluten-free, including the charcuterie, mussels, poached egg, and risotto. Everything was wonderful; the presentation was perfect and the flavors were top-notch. Our server brought me a plate of GF crackers for me to enjoy the chicken liver mousse from our charcuterie board, too, without me asking. It was a very thoughtful gesture.

Even though the place was packed, everything we ordered came out in a reasonable amount of time and we ended up with a few minutes to spare before heading over to Park Terrace for a movie.

The only negative I could come up with for Good Food is that the tables are a little small. If you're ordering tapas, the real estate of the table gets filled up quickly and diners are often left to perform some strange sort of Tetris to make everything accessible to everyone eating.

Good Food is absolutely worth visiting. The dishes are delightful and the service is marvelous.

Not my favorite restaurant in Charlotte, but it certainly is one of the best. It's "good food" for sure. The menu is reasonable, diverse and created around a tapas format. I experienced both the Smoked Lamb Belly confit and the Pork Bun. I'll have to admit that my southern tastebuds preferred the latter experience to the lamb, but both were served in a nice presentation and cooked to perfection. I prefer roasted or grilled lamb to this more roast-like lamb, but the combination with the lentils was quite satisfying. The wine menu was limited but selective in its choices.
This place is amazing! Always busy but for obvious reason. Wish it was bigger but if you go with a party of 2 or 4 you'll be seated fairly fast! Def try this place out
Along with Soul, this places has the best tapas in the QC. Their menu is exciting and changing. The only issue is that the place is always packed because the food is so good!

Again, I am so pleased with Good Food on Montford. The service at the bar is great. 

Tonight I enjoyed the lettuce wraps - fresh, zippy, good. Next I had a portion of the pea soup - this soup would have been superior had it not been excessively salty. Last on my list: lamb belly. The small roulades look a little skimpy at first but, oh my goodness, they are so rich, I could not have eaten any more! It was a perfect portion of such a wonderfully flavored dish - very good, highly recommended.

Food - 5
Service - 5
Value - 5

For a tapas-style place, I felt the value here was a good bang for the buck and the portions were generous.  I ordered the steamed bun (similar to a Chinese guo bao) and at my waitresses recommendation the garganelli.  I also love the simplicity of the name of the restaurant -- it takes balls to have "Good Food" in your restaurant name.

The steamed bun came first (within 5 minutes of ordering) and what really set this apart was the crust on the pork belly.  On part of the pork, it was slightly tougher to chew than I thought it would be but overall I really enjoyed the crust and the tenderness.

The garganelli was also excellent and it's also fun to say and I kept silently doing a Gargamel laugh (a villain from the Smurfs cartoon) as I was eating it because it was so good.  The ingredients here just worked together and the house-made italian sausage was so flavorful.  

My only regret was that I wish my wife could have been here to enjoy these dishes with me, but alas I was here in Charlotte on a business trip.

Awesome experience all the way around. Atmosphere was cool, service was courteous, food was delicious. My wife and I eat a vegan diet and went here because Yelp tagged it as a vegan spot. Once we reviewed the menu and talked with the waitress, we realized that it was not set up for vegan options. The waitress took it upon herself to learn what we were looking for and go back and consult with the chef to see what they could do. To our pleasant surprise, the chef himself came out and talked with us to get an understanding of what could work for both of us. He whipped up some amazing impromptu dishes and said he would be happy to prepare something next time we come in, just give him a heads up. First class experience, and we will definitely be going back.
Visiting area for business. Great selection of wines and craft beers. Entree tapas to die for, but please make sure you leave room for dessert. Will definitely repeat.

One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte.  ALWAYS CROWDED, and they don't take reservations.  Grab a cocktail, and linger on the patio while you wait.  It's worth it.  I love small plates, and sharing a bunch of dishes is the best dining experience.  Good Food has an awesome ambiance, it's dark with candle-lit tables, and great energy.  Green curry coconut curry mussels = AMAZING.  Korean beef with scallion kimchi is delightful.

I finally get the hype!

Went with a girlfriend late one Friday night and shared some appetizers that made me go MMM and them OHHH and then OHMAHGAH.

Seriously, this place is FANCY and DELISH.

We shared a cheese plate that came with 3 kinds of cheese as well as honeycomb with honey, fig, a kind of pepper jam and seasoned bread. I can't tell you much about the cheese because I'm not an expert but every bite was illuminating.

Also tried their Korean BBQ wrap with some kind of tangy slaw - muy bueno! Warm, flavorful and well spiced, the only negative was that I ordered just one.

The only negative I can see here is that it's so expensive, I wouldn't be able to go much, and the serving sizes focus more on taste than quantity, so for those wanting a lot of food, prepare to order many items.

Absolutely delicious!  The small plates are fabulous & allows you to really experience the menu.  Dessert is not to be missed.  Hands down the best meal out we have had since moving from the New York area.
You have to eat here! No reservations, but the bar service is top notch. This is by far the best restaurant in Charlotte!

Wow! Best meal I've had in Charlotte, hands down. The tapas plates were perfectly portioned, and each item, from the risotto to the crispy quail lettuce wraps, were out of this world. Top it off with a fantastic slice of chocolate cheesecake, and this is a meal I'll be coming back for again and again.

Read so many great reviews about this place and I'm glad to say it did not disappoint! Service was amazing and food was superb! The coconut green curry mussels were to die for. Hands down best mussels I have ever had in my life (I've had a lot) But the star of the night was dessert. When our server suggested the COCONUT BABINGKA, I was like 'the what?!' I had never heard of it but we decided to get it (and a Pot de Crème, just in case lol) WOW this thing was amazing, truly amazing! I don't even know how to describe it, it's just so light and fluffy. It really hit the spot. This has become one of my favorite desserts

I've been searching for a favorite restaurant, and Good Food on Montfort may have just won that for me.
Pros: delicious food. Attentive service. My faves were The gnocchi with braised oxtail and the crispy fried oysters.
Cons: I don't have any. We got here before the crowd so beat the normal wait.

On a Saturday got there at 6:45pm and was told, 1 hour to 1.5 hours..2 hours and 15 minutes later still waiting. Seating host says that we don't rush anyone who is finished with their dinner. Not even a table of 6 and 2 of the people left and the other 4 were sitting and talking, with their to go bags on the table.  Meanwhile 2 other groups of 4 left because it took so long..host did pick up our bar tab (2 drinks) but we left because management doesn't have control over their restaurant and obviously were not concerned about us who had been waiting over 2 hours. ..now will not go back and will be sure to let everyone know about our  experience. ..yes we did go to Braswells to have drinks, so they are happy about Good Food's crowd control problem and now Georges Brasiere even happier we came to them for dinner and an excellent meal. (By the way..read review from 5/9/14...had a problem with the seating host as well.)

Every time my husband and I come here, I swear it gets better and better. It's well worth the 45min-hour wait, trust me! We've eaten here no less than 10 times (it's Tuesday, let's celebrate! I had a good day, let's go to Good Food! Lol any reason is a good reason), and EVERY experience has been incredible. Recently, I had some beef carpaccio that was so good I literally had dreams about it. I made my husband go back with me several days later and ordered two just for myself....seriously, it was that good. Even the drinks are usually very good! It's a perfect date night spot and a good place to hang out with friends. Just be warned: if you think you're gonna show up here at 7pm on a Saturday night, then be prepared to eat your arm off while you wait about 2hrs for a table. Be smart, go early, or go on a weeknight.

I really enjoyed the tapas here. We asked the chef to bring out his favorites as to not miss anything. What a great choice. It didn't disappoint. We also tried ALL of the desserts. We literally tasted the menu.
Charcuterie, Foie Gras & Chicken liver mousse. Pork bun!

Get the mussels. Get the mussels. Get the mussels.

I love mussels and it's always about the sauce that they are cooked in. I love dipping bread into the garlic sauce. Good Food has done a great job of making their mussels unique with a coconut curry sauce. Not only did I ask for more bread to dip in it,  but if no one was around I would have drank what was left in the bowl. 

Not a fan of  mussels the rest of their food was also great and the service even better. The foie gras & chicken liver mousse was the best I've had in Charlotte. However, I could have done without everything else it came with. 

I'll definately be back in the near future.

Tucked in but worth finding. This tapas style foodery offers a taste for many palates. The beer selection is more than ample and the service was knowledgeable and friendly giving us a sense to linger as long as desired. Pictures show the beautiful presentation of all of the dishes we tried which were as delicious as they look.

I rarely get to stop into here, but inside it feels very quaint, and a place you can enjoy a conversation with 2 or more people.  When it's crowded, it's definitely that way for a reason.  The small plates are all delicious and unique in it's style.  My favorite which I always have on my mind when I think of this place is the Pork Belly Buns.  Probably not the best choice for your arteries, but will find a way in your heart to melt in your mouth.  Okay, that was a little personal, but date night recommended for sure!

You probably don't have to read too many of these reviews and you will clearly see the  PEI mussels are a must! So do yourself a favor and get the mussels. The mussels are in a green curry ,coconut milk , with cilantro . Oh, and they bring out bread with the meat so you can dip the bread in the broth.  So good! 

This is a tapas place with good sizes portions so why not get the steamed bun which is also a must in my opinion. Honestly, I came here for a work outing as well and was able to try a lot of the menu options and wasn't disappointed one bit. Not typically a sweets fan when dining out but even too the servers recommendation and tried s couple desserts.  

My only suggestion is to change the name of the restaurant to Great Food on Montford as it better team good :)

Took some out of town friends here for dinner during the week. Place was very busy and not much room to wait - especially if it's cold outside. 

We ended up waiting quite a while to get a table and was pushed back in line when a "friend" of the manager showed up (aka Nascar driver). We sat at the bar and enjoyed some great wine. The host and the manager were extremely apologetic about the wait and gave us drinks on the house. 

When we were finally seated, we almost ordered the entire menu. There were 4 of us and we wanted to try as much as we could without duplicating plates. Some plates were def. larger than others. The two pasta dishes were great as well as the pork belly sandwich, and broccoli with cheese curds. There wasn't a bad plate to be had. Also, the manager gave us a few appetizers on the house for our wait. 

Overall, great food, cool atmosphere, and a very attentive and graceful wait staff. Will definitely go back. Probably a little tight for a larger dinner party, good for a party of 4 or less.

Was in town for business and found this place on Yelp. It was pretty bustling for a Tuesday night but we still got seated immediately. The atmosphere was very cool and inviting. My colleague and I tried several dishes but the highlights were the gnocchini with pancetta, bruseel sprouts and mushrooms, the demi-glacé sauce was amazing. The best part of the meal were the mussels. So tasty. Another plus...the waitress poured a very generous glass of wine both times we ordered a glass, almost full to the brim! Would DEF recommend this place!

This tapas-bar-style restaurant bar is a pleasant surprise to me. The Executive Chef Kerry is from Stratford Culinary College in Falls Church, VA! My fellow Virginian! How nice!

I tried 1 chilled small plate - The mixed green salad with parsnip purée, and two warm small plates - 1. sauteed mushrooms and 2. PEI Island mussels with green curry, coconut milk & cilantro. They were all very good. The mussels with green curry with cilantro dazzled me. It made me want to have a bite of Jasmine rice with it though. But I had the slices of flat bread with it instead. The wine I had was a California Cabernet $9 a glass and it was really good too. I can sleep well tonight.

I LOVE this place! It's really GREAT food.  The menu changes regularly and I love it when they use locally sourced food. It's a great date place, GNO (girls night out), and one of my go-to restaurants when I want to impress a friend from out of town.

One of our favorites in Charlotte, hands down! We love going with a big group and ordering tons of their small plates to share so we taste a little bit of everything their diverse menu has to offer. Equally fun is going with just your sweetie so you don't have to share anything! All the pommes frites for meeeeeeee! 

Speaking of pommes frites... they're one our standby favorites along with the garganelli (that house made sausage, though), beef carpaccio and PEI mussels. The rest of their menu changes pretty frequently which is fun but also a little sad when a great dish disappears. (Please bring back the shrimp arepas for all that is good and holy!) Good beer selection, even better wine selection, one of the best cocktail menus. 

I was on the fence about their deserts for a while and while we still order a dud every now and then (I don't love the cobblers or cinnamon rolls) overall, I think they've finally found their stride with the sweets! The pumpkin cheesecake is divine. I love the bits of candied ginger hidden on top in the whipped cream. The cannoli cheesecake and banana bread are also tasty. Even just a scoop of their ice cream (might I recommend the goat milk dulce de leche) and an espresso will treat you right at the end of the night. 

Service is phenomenal. We miss Jeffrey who just recently moved away. Now that he's gone, we always ask for Jackie... One of the sweetest, most adorable humans on the planet!

Cool hip modern decor, classy bar area, open table seating, little loud when packed, overall excellent service while enjoying some tasty creations by their clearly talented chefs. Besides the bread loaves, portions were very, very small compared to other tapas establishments I have frequented in the DC area. Realistically 4-6 tapas per person equates to a reasonable dinner, 1 or 3 for a snack assuming you are not filling yourself up with their nutritiously devoid bread / olive oil. Choosing not to implode on bread, we actually stopped for food on the way home. Auto gratuity for groups of 6+ is 20% of the post-tax total which I find questionable, there is no reason why I should be forced to tip on collected taxes. As a matter of principle, I always tip generously above and beyond even for reasonable service, more for great service but, please don't shove it down my throat. Asked the manager Brad about it who dismissed it as a new setting on their latest point of sale system, no interest in changing it.

Would you go back? Yes.

Pleasantly surprised by this nondescript, trendy if somewhat casual, restaurant.

From the minute we walked into the restaurant, we felt at home. After a horrible experience at the Rock Salt, we needed a place with guaranteed guest service! With Brad the manager bussing and seating us at our requested table to our wonderful server, Paige (apologize if that's spelled incorrectly). We ordered in spurts and timing was perfect. The all around experience is one that will continue to bring us back to this gem!

This kind of spot is just my jam.  Small plates, long bar with creative cocktails, unique flavors in a trendy yet casual setting - I'm in.  I've had GFoM on my radar (AKA Yelp Bookmarks) for a while now.  So a stay in the South Park area was the perfect time to check it out.  

They don't take reservations but arriving at 6:30 pm on a busy Friday night, we only waited about 30 minutes for a table for four.  

We tried a variety of dishes although as usual, I don't agree that you need two to three dishes per person.  We ordered seven dishes for four of us and left stuffed.  The food was all delicious and beautifully plated.  Of the dishes, the Garganelli (Italian sausage and pasta) was one of our least favorites.  It was just kind of boring compared to other dishes we ordered.  The steamed bun (another recommended dish) was very good but cut into four pieces, one order was plenty.  Our server was really pushing us to order two of the steamed bun.  Instead, we went with an order of Korean pork belly with rice cake noodles and kimchi that we all agreed was the home run of the night.  The charcuterie (especially the foie gras mousse) and cheese plate were both well portioned and delicious.  I'd way prefer a different cut to the mortadella though.  It's like high priced bologna. 

All in all we were really happy with the food and had a great time.  Four stars is reflective of an overall positive food experience with a few minor misses and a server focused on upselling our order while being MIA for large parts of our meal.  We were actually going to order dessert but it took her so long to swing back around, our companions needed to head out and so we just asked for the check.  I'm also surprised they start off your meal with slices of white bread.  Random.  It was dry and we skipped it completely.  I think a cute amuse bouche would go better with their menu and keep appetites intact for the good stuff.

Loved it. The place was mobbed early on a Friday evening but we were able to grab seats at the bar which serves the full menu. The bartender was tremendous - she was extremely friendly and helpful with suggestions even though the place was packed. All the food was great but the standout was definitely the steamed buns. Get one bun per person and share everything else.

Good Food is the place I take family in from out of town to really impress them, and it's also the place I can sit at the bar, alone & enjoy my favorite company- bourbon. They've got great cocktails, exceptional service, and the best food in town. The green curry mussels are a mainstay on the menu (thank god) and the broth is what dreams are made of. You can also follow them on the 'Gram so up to date on menu changes.

This place is totally worth the hype and the wait!  Excellent food and beer/wine list.  Food done well in reasonable proportions for reasonable price.  Go early for dinner to avoid the wait at peak times.  Their sister restaurant, Stagioni, on Providence is equally good Italian and they accept reservations.

Ok, I guess a place like this works in Charlotte. I am between a 3 and 4 star for this place. I have been waiting for a LOOONG time to give the place a try, and just to show you how long I have been waiting for the occasion, I came on a Sunday, they were closed. I came after 10 one night on Friday they were closed. I live close to the south park area and have drove by the restaurant many other times. Last night though, I finally made it here.

I have several problems with this place. Space wise, it just isn't really enough to accomodate the customers. At first I thought this would be a romantic kind of upscale dining option with delicious food. WRONG. The place was SOO loud I could not even have a conversation with the person I was with who sits only ummm..10 inch from me? 

Problem number 2. Our waiter(pale, heavy white male) was being pretty impatient with us. For an upscale dining experience, this is really not good. And he was pretty monotone and seemed bored trying to explain the fish of the day to us...

Problem number 3. Waiter was being pushy, for ordering more and for getting in and out of there quick. Well I guess maybe they just simply is having a space issue. 

The parking. The parking lot is small, you will have a problem finding a spot. But the worse is, there is NOO way for my friend to back out, he had to reverse ALL the way out in order to drive out...the scariest parking experience ever. And my friend's car is pretty compact....This parking lot sounds like an accident bound to happen. The dumpster takes up half of the spot beside us so the lady could only park her car half way in...I wonder who's responsibility it would be if her car is accidentally damaged?

The food. It's definitely above average. Was it life changing? No. The portions are wayy too small for the price. Literally my friend was even like," ohh, is that it to the dish?" For the price I paid I feel like I could have gotten more food and a less hectic experience at a better place. 

The food did roll out pretty fast. But then again...it's not like we are ordering home made pizza or something that would take a while to cook. 

The guy at the front who works as a hostess was awesome. The other person in my party had arrived before me. When I showed up, the hostess asked me if I was meeting a friend, I said yes and he answered "I know exactly where he is and showed me the way". On our way out, he also bid us farewell and wished us a nice night. 

Decoration is pretty rusty modern. They cover each table with the paper tablecloth with the restaurant's name on it. Two glasses per person, one for water, another empty glass for wine. Every table gets complimentary sour dough bread paired with oil and balsamic vinegar and roasted garlic dip. The menu is just one side, not many options really...Make sure you are ok with that. This is like an upscale tapas place but a tad less fun. Oh, they also have a nice outdoor seating lounge area...but I don't suppose you'll want to have a meal out there, maybe a drink. 

ONLY open for dinners Monday-Saturday. Come early or you'll have to wait.

Oh boy. I was just so excited for this place. Let's start with positives- punch was delicious, pasta (garganelli) was also delicious, however the sausage portion was really small. Beer battered broccoli... It was good, slightly under cooked, but why not just use tempura? The beer flavor was overwhelming in the undercooked pieces.
The food was amazing! Our favorite was definitely the pork belly! Can't wait to go back!
My favorite restaurant, hands down!  The pork belly bun and green curry mussels are a MUST-HAVE!  Cool atmosphere.  Great little bar.

It was an enjoyable evening & I'm glad we went.

It can be difficult to get seated as they don't reserve for any group smaller than 5.  The bar is first come first serve.  We ended up snagging a bar seat after about an hour.  It is extremely loud in this small space.  This is not for a romantic evening or quiet tete a tete.

The staff were welcoming & accommodating.  Every one that we came in contact with were friendly & helpful.  We started with the Montford Gin Sour & they were soooo refreshing!

The food is portioned well & generous for tapas, I think, but it's nicer that there is enough to share without feeling like you're giving up your bite!

We started with the Charcuterie Plate & it was definitely enjoyable.  Especially the Chicken Liver Mousse & the Mortadella.  We moved on to the Sweet Pea Risotto & it was lively & perfectly cooked, with plenty of yummy, fresh, young peas that popped in your mouth!  

Next we moved on to two pastas... The Garganelli with Sausage, Garlic & Tomato - that was filled with sausage, not too garlicky & just enough tartness to the chunky tomatos.  The Pappardelle Moroccan spiced lamb cheeks, lemon creme fraiche, and mint was good, but it was waaaay to spicy for my palate.  I couldn't even taste the mint or creme fraiche and I ended up taking the Garganelli home to finish later, because after I ate the Pappardelle I couldn't taste the other one!

Last but not least we tried the Pork tenderloin. shnitzel style, grilled potato salad, poached egg and mustard.  It had good flavor, but it was a bit overdone, not quite burned, but getting close & that affected the texture & flavor.  The grilled potato salad was different and very enjoyable & I don't usually like potatoes.

The desserts looked good, but we didn't try them.  It is pricey to dine a la carte like this, but for a once in a while splurge, not too bad.  There wasn't anything we tried that we felt we would have a craving for (except may the gin sour), but we are happy this neighborhood gem is around.
Best Tapas in Charlotte, the food is amazing with plenty to choose from, and you can't beat the location!

Spectacular food - perhaps the best in Charlotte. The tapas style means you'll be able to try a little bit of a lot of different dishes, which is a real treat. My favorites include the falafel, the Korean beef, and the gnocchi. We've brought out-of-town foodie friends here before and they were blown away. A must to try when you're in Charlotte if you're into high-quality, high-end food. It's not cheap, though, when you get carried away with wanting to try a myriad of amazing little dishes...if you don't exercise some restraint, it does eventually add up!

Tip: Show up early, or be prepared to wait outside. This place fills up fast, and there's not much space inside to wait.
I can't say anything bad about any of the food. I only gave them 4 stars, instead of 5, cuz I wish the portions were larger. But yummmmmmmm!

We had an awesome dinner here after the game at Panthers stadium. There are many, great reviews about Good Food, and it definitely lived up to the hype. While it is expensive for tapas ($100 for 5 plates, 2 drinks, and 2 desserts for a couple), the food and service was exceptional. They don't take reservations FYI, and we had to wait 1 hour for a table Saturday night. 

To start, I had a ginger Moscow mule, and it was very gingery and was really good, but definitely pricey. We started with the pomme frites, and wow they were amazing! For French fries just covered in truffle oil and Parmesan, they were fried and seasoned to perfection, definitely a must order. We also ordered a couple of stemmed buns with pork belly, and they were huge. The steamed bun was soft, fluffy, and not starchy tasting at all. The pork belly was tender, very flavorful, and not greasy at all. We also shared the Korean beef, which was cooked to a very nice medium rare and had a great spice flavor from the Korean spices and kimchi. It was served over crispy rice, which was very tasty and crunchy. Our final tapas was the gnocchi which had a lamb and pork thinly sliced throughout. The sauce was excellent, not too creamy, but smooth and flavorful with the pistachios. All of the tapas were good and I would definitely order them again. 

To finish off dinner, we had the cannoli cheese cake and peach cobbler with blueberry ice cream. Both were excellent deserts I would definitely recommend. Overall, we had a great dinner here and I would highly recommend trying this unique tapas restaurant when in Charlotte.

Small, intimate dining with small plates. Reasonably priced most plates under $14. Everything I had was superb. The steamed pork belly bun and the fried chicken comes highly recommended. Enjoyed my evening there and plan to return many times over.

The food was decent, I the pork bun was a bit on the savory side and the pork toboki was extremely salty I only took a few bites and gave up. The portions are relatively small and quite pricey as well. Other than that, I like the resturant itself, it's got a nice atmosphere.

Wow!  This place is appropriately named.

We came about a quarter after 6 on a Saturday night, which I soon realized was strategic planning on my friend's part because we managed to get in just before it got super busy.  We had no wait.  Score.

I took a peek at the menu and realized that I was being faced with the challenge of deciding which small plates to order (out of so many that all sounded delicious).  I let my friend, who has been here many times, take the wheel on that one.

Each small plate came out one at a time, so we had plenty of time to savor and enjoy each one individually.

Here's what we ordered:

The American farmhouse cheeses with truffle chutney and honey.  Served with bread.  I LOVE CHEESE.  AND CHUTNEY.  AND HONEY.  Yum.  I could have ordered another one of these but alas, we had a lot more food on the way.

The steamed bun.  I've had pork bellies one other time at a dim sum place up in the DC area.  I loved them there and I loved them here at Good Food too.  The meat was so sweat and so was the bun... a perfect combo!

Seared scallops.  They were ever so flavorful and cooked just the right amount.  By this point in the evening I was already entering a food coma from all the deliciousness, but there was still a lot more to come.

Some kind of pasta that was A-MAZING.  I'm currently looking at the menu on the website to get my food titles right, but I don't see this item on there.  I hope they didn't get rid of it because it might have been my favorite thing we ordered!

The fish.  We only added this to our order after hearing a nearby table rave about it.  Yes, it was good.  Everything at this point was good.  I was stuffed, but somehow managed to make room in my belly for dessert.

For dessert we ordered the apple cobbler.  It was warm and cinnamon-y and delicious.  Despite how full we were, we managed to scarf this down in what seemed like under 5 minutes.

I've eaten at a lot of good restaurants in North Carolina, and this one ranks among the best in my opinion.  I don't have a single complaint about the evening.  I had heard coming in that the service gets to be somewhat lacking when they get really busy, but the service was great the night I was there.  Overall, I had a perfect dining experience.

Loved it.  I only refrain from 5 stars because I'm spoiled when it comes to food and 5 means perfection to me.  Had the shortribs and was totally in love, the cauliflower gratin that it was on top of was such a wonderful flavor combo with the shortribs! Squash soup was awesome.  The fried chicken was just ok.  Loved the feel of the restaurant, warm, understated and focused on good food.  Service was fabulous and will totally be back!

The decore is nice and quaint. It is perfect for a date or just for a casual night out woth friends. 

The tapas style dining had me not wanting to be rude! I waited for his food to come put before I indulged. The food has great pricing. The food portions are surprisingly and refreshingly small for an American Restaurant. I had the Salmon ramen. The ramen was more like linguine, so I was disappointed. The Gnocci was awesome. The price of the food is great. No complaints from me. The only one that I do have is that the drinks are overpriced.

Really good tapas, a really nice mix of classic southern and modern fare. The dishes are cooked and served immediately so everything is piping hot and each has a secret sauce that the dishes are smothered in. Green peppers are one that I'm still craving today. Same with falafel. Fish was incredible and peach cobbler with blueberry ice cream is something everyone should try. 

Only negative is that it's so popular! There was a 45 minute table wait on a Tuesday at 6 pm so we sat at the bar and it gets noisy there because that's also where all food is prepared. They may need more staff too, but they are on point with dishes.
Excellent tasting small plate food. Waitstaff is friendly and the prices a reasonable. They have a seasonal menu of farm to table items to choose from.

My wife and I went in on a busy Saturday evening, the host at the front was friendly and greeted us, then let us know they had an hour and a half wait at the moment. My wife is pregnant, so she of course had to use the rest room and we said we would decide whether we were going to wait or not when she got back. Without discussion, when she came back I declined their invitation to grab a drink and wait, stating that I had to feed my lady and little lady to be. The manager was standing near and let us know that there was a party leaving from the dessert bar and if we waited a few minutes, he would have us seated! Sure enough, he did. 

Be mindful, we're not snooty, entitled people with a hidden agenda. It was no big deal to us that they were busy and we were amicable about going somewhere else and returning to try their food in the future. But they warmly accommodated us without having to do so. 

Sitting at the dessert bar was a treat we didn't know we needed. The food was amazing. The wait staff was great. Chris, the dessert bar chef, was stellar. He gave recommendations on food, desserts, and tips on having our first baby! We were absolutely spoiled tonight and we could stop raving about this place on the drive home. 10/10. Thank you again!

Having never gone to a tapas restaurant, I didn't know what to do with the microscopic slices of food, but I have to tell you that it's wonderful food. Don't let the price per square foot fool you--it's definitely worth the price.

AMAZING! 

I came with a group of 3 people & shared 5 small plate entree and 2 desserts. 

- Must-try main course: sausage pasta
- Must-try dessert: brownie dessert with a biscotti paste  You will not regret it.

Our server was very attentive and came with a variety of requests which was very helpful.

Thanks to yelp, we went to this place since it was close to south park mall. What a good find! From the outside it is like a hidden gem. 

Inside we were promptly greeted and seated. Our waitress was helpful and told us what to expect with small plates and large plates. We ordered the green mussels, scallops, morracan chicken and the chilled noodles for small plates. Everything was delicious, the mussels and the scallops were the best in my option but I'm biased since I love seafood. The mussels were cooked perfectly, although they did have sand in them. Scallops also were perfectly cooked. The chilled noodles came out next and it reminded me of Asian style noodles served cold. There was just enough pork to give it some flavor. The moracan chicken was lightly fried and served with chickpeas under it. A bit sweet but still delicious. We chose the  Grouper for the large plate. It is served with new England chowder. The grouper itself was cooked just right and tasted great. The chowder however was extremely salty. We finished it regardless. 

For dessert, we chose the upside down peach With vanilla ice cream, it was a great mixture of flavors in my mouth. The sweetness was just right and the cake was so soft moist with a slice of peach on top. we savored every bite. Delicious in every culinary sense.

We will be back!

I love Good Food!  This place is great all around and usually pretty busy which is always a good sign.  It's a great place to go and order several tapas entree's to share.  

The Price Edward Island mussels in green curry, coconut milk & cilantro are one of my absolute favorites.  Dipping some of the dinner bread in the curry sauce is the way to go.  I could eat this everyday I think!

The braised lamb tagine with Moroccan spices & dried fruit is quite the treat as well.  It really doesn't sound that great but it's very tender and encompasses just the right amount of fruit and spices.  

Can't wait to go back!
Everything was amazing- food, atmosphere, service. Especially loved the poached egg app and gnocchi!

My husband and I stopped here for a bite when we flew to Charlotte for vacation- we were drawn to this place due to the awesome reviews and were not disappointed! The cocktails are really well crafted. I ordered the 1701 Sangria and it was so good that I ordered another. We had about 4-5 dishes to share between two people and that was definitely enough. Everything we had was wonderful but one dish stands out to me- the beer battered broccoli! So yummy. We ordered coffee and the chocolate brownie for dessert- the brownie came with biscotti ice cream that they make in house and of course chocolate sauce. That dessert was seriously so good that I thought about it for days afterward. The service was very good and the place seemed clean, but the only reason this review is not 5 stars is because after I finished my meal I got up to use the restroom and walking over I noticed a large cockroach crawling up the wall (not near any of the food). I brought it to the employees' attention and it was detained immediately, but still a little disconcerting.

While in Charlotte for some wedding planning, we dined at Good Food on Montford for the first time. Montford Drive is a street with a long culinary history for me, with such favorites as The Ole Smokehouse, the Roasting Company and Luisa's Pizza. In contrast to those places, Good Food on Montford is more upscale, serving mostly small plates at fairly high prices. Several of the plates we tried were outstanding, including the ceviche, the mushrooms, the lamb tangine and the fried oysters. We also really enjoyed dessert, especially the cherry cobbler with ice cream.

My complaints about this place include the noise - so loud we could not hear each other despite being at a table for six closest to the front window - and the prices. Even my dad's "large plate" of fish was quite small and at $17, not exactly inexpensive. I am glad that Charlotte's restaurant selection is growing so rapidly, and certainly the food here shows a sophistication never before seen on Montford Drive. Although it's not a restaurant for everyday dining, I'd definitely return here for another tasty meal.

The best food I've had in Charlotte so far... End review.

Wait, no. I'll talk about a few of the things that stood out:

1. Charcuterie Plate - The Chicken Liver pate was excellent. Light with a bit of fruity sourness to it. Really could have eaten an absurd amount.

2. Smoked Lamb Belly Confit - the belly is rolled in to a wheel so every bite gets a perfect amount of fat along with the smoky beef and it's all very well accompanied by the lentils.

3. Arctic Char on Fennel  and Potatoes  - Textural contrast was excellent.

4. Gnocchi - Great softness to the pasta held together with cream and contrasted by crispy bacon.

5. Mussels in Green Curry - I'm a curry snob but the curry they used here, was nontraditional and extraordinary. There was a real citruesy sweetness to it. 

We had at least 4-5 other things but these are the ones that really stood out to me.

We came here last night for my fiancé's birthday.  We did wait a bit for a table (which we expected), but really enjoyed the cocktails while we waited!  The mushrooms and truffle fries were fantastic.  I would pass on the falafel; that dish was meh.  The service was nice, but not always attentive.  Overall, we did enjoy our meal and drinks so we will be back!

So cute, love the atmosphere, the food is delicious and there is great outside seating perfect for groups. We went on a Thursday night around 6 and it was busy but we were seated immediately. If you're on a date or just catching a drink with a friend there are plenty of 2 seater tables in the middle of the restaurant or you can pull up to the bar. But if you have a bigger group, 4+, there are plenty of bigger tables too. The prices are ideal but be warned ... the portions are small. If you are super hungry be prepared to buy 2 or 3 dishes at least. Our waitress was super sweet and extremely knowlegable about all the dishes and drinks. The dishes are perfect for people who can't make up their minds and want to try it all. We tried 8 different dishes and 2 desserts. We got the Southern Farmhouse Cheeses, the Arugala, and the Beef Carpaccio for starters. We split the sauteed mushrooms, Gnocchi, Korean Beef, Pork Carnitas, and the catch of the day. No complaints on any of the dishes and they were great for sharing. For dessert we got the coconut cake and the cheesecake. AMAZING. We will definitely be going back. We also bought a bottle of Malbec and sipped on the BEST sambuca I have ever had.

I officially found my favorite restaurant in Charlotte..

and it's not because the services is good...although it is.

and it's not because the atmosphere is cozy and relaxing...although it is.

But it's really because the food is just incredible - mmmm factor every time- better yet, with every dish! 


Someone mentioned that the mussels in curry sauce was drinkable ...yes it is! Ask for more bread to really soak it all up - that makes it!

The other dish I loved was the duck fettuccine - holy deliciousness. Flavors melded to perfection. 

The pork bun ....aaaaamazing. I am not a huge pork person but the hoisin sauce mixed with the pickled veggies - deeelish. 

and just in case I wasn't completely in bliss my dessert sent me over the top, pear cake with avocado ice cream and salted caramel - I know it sounds odd but just get it!


Wish drinks were more reasonably priced and the checks splittable ( yes I had to write out each cost for 7 people- not just what they had....really ?) ....

 but the food is so delicious it would be a shame not to give this place 5 stars! This place is a party in my mouth!
Ding ding ding! We have a winner. The pork bun is the king here, with the salmon dish coming in a very close second. Very creative menu and great options to choose from

Great spot for fantastic tapas and well worth the wait. The steamed bun was recommended and we weren't disappointed. Very flavorful and delicious dish that I'll order every time I'm there. The quail lettuce wraps were also delicious and something I'll be having more of. The gnocchi was the last item we tried, and although not as good as the other stuff it was still an excellent dish. This is a place that I plan to head to much more often in the future!

Wow. Food was fantastic. Our favorites were the mussels and steamed bun - both great, came our hot and fresh and perfectly cooked. Drinks were exceptional as well. I would definitely return if we are back in te area again.

This place was such a gem. Great service from the time we walked through the door. We started at the bar & then moved to a high-top. Our server, Paige, was absolutely fantastic. She gave us the most amazing recommendations! We had the Arugula salad, the Korean Beef, Pork Carnitas (our favorite), the gnocchi, Garganelli & PEI Mussels...everything was WONDERFUL! We are definitely coming back to try new things (can't wait to try the Grouper!). The wine was great! The Elderflower Pear Fizz was delicious! We were happy on all fronts. As restaurant people it is so nice to take a moment to go out and enjoy what makes this industry so special. Creating experiences is what it is all about...& you guys nailed it!

Let me start by saying this restaurant lives up to its hype!!!!!!  We went for my husbands bday in February.  The only down side is that they don't take reservations :(.  We got there promptly at 5 to ensure we got a table.  Within 30 minutes of opening there wasn't an empty seat in the house.  I ordered the honeysuckle Moscow mule and it was perfection.  It wasn't too sweet which is how I like my mules.  We ordered the cheese plate and it was some of the best pairings I've had.  The gnocchi was to die for!  The garganelli was way too salty but other wise had a good flavor (I think it was a one off).  My husband wanted the octopus and it was played perfectly and tasted even better than it looked.  I'm saving the best for last.... THAT BROWNIE THO..... so amazing I didn't know a brownie could taste like that.  The atmosphere was pleasant, romantic, and had the perfect mix of music playing quietly in the background.  One warning...do not expect this to be a cheap meal.  In my opinion it was worth it!

At this point, Good Food on Montford is just that, good not great.

We got there at 8pm and the wait was just over 2 hours for a 4 top.  I can certainly appreciate the level of popularity this restaurant has sparked, but the inability to make reservations surprises me.  We were meeting another couple so were in no rush, but when I go back, I will have to be strategic on when we go so as not to have to wait so long.  

The bartender was excellent and attentive and we were able to enjoy a bottle of wine before being seated.  As a side note, I was disappointed that there was no available Chianti on the menu.  That's typically all I drink and not a rare type so thought it odd.

Our waitress was good but appeared overwhelmed by other service.  It took 10 minutes for her to first come over after we were seated.  My first order was the Pork Bun (because it seemed quite popular via Yelp) but they had apparently sold their last one minutes before.  Big disappointment.  I ordered the Charcuterie (foie gras & chicken liver mousse, speck & chefs selection [Excellent], Korean beef crispy rice & scalloin kimchi [Very Good], Arctic char chilled israeli couscous & dried fruit salad & apricot beurre blanc [Very Good], and a forgettable pasta of some sort.  We were two bottles of wine in by this point and had spent well over 3 hours there with slow service so we left in disappointment and ended up going across the street and munching on barfood over a few beers.

The food overall was very good and above the average Charlotte fare.  The overall experience was lacking and service was subpar.  It's quite expensive for what you get but I'm okay with this for high quality.  I'm a firm believe in 2nd and 3rd chances prior to writing off a place so I'm hopeful our next visit will warrant an updated more positive review.  The Yelp crowd seems to love it so I'm hopeful I caught them on a bad night.

Okay I was a little skeptical this place would be overrated, but it was not at all!! We were seated right away on a Saturday night, but it was later in the evening. Our server Gina was absolutely amazing! Friendly, attentive and knowledgeable about the menu.

We started with a couple of cocktails, and I was a little disappointed in the pear fizz. When I order a $12 cocktail I want to taste a little alcohol. It had good flavor though. Decided to order a glass of wine for round 2. 

The only thing I wouldn't order again is the cheese plate. With so many other delicious options on the menu, it just isn't worth the money for 3 small pieces of cheese. We impulse ordered it when they were out of our first choice. The pomme frites were delicious. 

The Korean beef was just as good as everyone raves about. Perfectly cooked and the crispy rice cake added nice texture. The sauces on top were delicious. The gnocchi was another favorite. You can tell its homemade. Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. The sauce and crispy onions were delicious and different.

All in all it was a great experience and I can't wait to go back and try more from the menu!

30 something - small plates - upscale gastro pub with rich food.  So... I strolled in at 7:15 on a Thursday.  Tables and bar were open but the parking lot was full.  Famous plates: Parmesan Gnocchi with Chicken, Steamed 5 - Spice Pork Bun, and the Green Curry Mussels with Coconut Milk.
$$The Mussels were a ten.  There's a good amount of green curry that's perfectly tempered with the sweet, rich, creamy, coconut milk.  [The best part of the night.]
$$The Steamed Bun was sweet, possibly too sweet for some but great for me.  The pork was tender enough to smear with a fork.  This food this great.
$$The Gnocci has a reputation but didn't blow my mind.  There was a lemon citrus flavor with the arugula AND the cream that I didn't expect but I liked.  Maybe it has such a rep because it is the richest item on the menu?
Good for couples.  Not for single young adults.  There were some guys yelling "shots" at the bar around 8:15, but they died down very quickly.  Not too stuffy, but def a dress shirt and jeans kind of place.  Nobody younger than 24 y/o.  75% female.

Okay, so Good Food is generally good. But it's one of those places that you have to really be in the mood to get into. If you don't, then it really won't hit the mark, and if you aren't in the mood, then it's going to be way off.

The good thing is that you probably aren't going to overeat here. The plates are small, which is cool. The whole small plate approach is fun. You can share - if you are into that - though with smaller plates, it can be a challenge. Of course, it also means you can really rack up a hefty bill. And you can also have trouble fitting them all on your table if they come at the same time. Go watch that YouTube video if you want an idea of what it's like. It's at times spot on.

If you hit them at the right time, they are great - very friendly and happy to see you. You also may not get a seat if you hit them at the wrong time, because everyone is waiting on their plates to come out, because they can be totally haphazard. You'll get one, then five, then none for what seems like an hour and you'll get another three. A nice pace could do wonders here. 

Ultimately, the food is good, but it's probably best if you're just picking here and there while you're hanging out and not going for a meal - in that case, it can be downright annoying. But the place is definitely worth at least one visit just to check it out and see if it's the vibe that you're after.

I was happy to come here at 630 to get sat right away!! I always heard there was a long wait. Decor and restaurant is really nice. They were busy and I was pleased that the service was good! They have a parking lot but you can also park on the street. 

I got the korean beef with crispy rice. It does take a while for it to come out but it is worth it. I'm usually not a fan of crispy rice but since the beef was so smooth, it was a good mix. Beef was melt in your mouth. I would definitely get this again. Two sauces with it were amazing! It was actually pretty filling!

I also go the udon noodles. You can tell the noodles were homemade which were awesome. Pork was really good. It's more on the fatty side which I like. Kimchi was spot on. The sauce really reminds me of kimchi soup. Perfect amount of sesame seeds. 

I'm half korean and I would have to say the food was pretty spot on. I would definitely get those two items again next time!
Very enjoyable, a bit more casual than I expected but that was not disappointing just a comment. Food is good, nice place to go for a casual meal.

After reading the reviews below, I decided to take a chance on Good Food. I agree with reviewers who says it is good food not great food. I'm usually skeptical when I see posts about a place being expensive because I cook at home and I know what real food costs. The plates are small. Like you have to be really-kind-to-share small. Give your fellow diner a lick off your plate and then no more. The restaurant has its own parking which was a plus and we got there right at 5:45p so no wait for us. I like that they've got seating outside with tables so if you have to wait someone's thought about your comfort while you do. The restaurant is cozy inside and I can see if it's packed you feel like you can't wait to finish and go. 

Onto the food, we ordered the gnocchi, the Korean beef and the fries. I considered the cheese plate but then I saw it walk with tiny squares o' cheese. The gnocchi were good and the most generous of the three items. I would order them again. The Korean beef had about 4 slices of meat on a 3x3 square of rice with scallions on top. Spicy and cooked medium to medium rare. The fries were good, too but we are spoiled and we were looking for something to dip them in. Somehow fries always need aioli to dip. 

The bill came to $53 with a $5 NODA on tap and a $13 sangria. I could've skipped the sangria because 1) it was more money than a plate of food and 2) it was more of a mixed drink than a sangria. I will say after two years of living in Charleston, I am biased but I know I'm not alone. So if you've only lived in Charlotte, you might love this place but I can't say we did.

I mistakenly assumed Good Food on Montford would have "good" food as in "great"! But in actuality, "good" meant just "okay."

For dinner I shared:
-Sauteed Mushrooms: 3.75/5 Fried sliced garlic gave it a lot of flavor but was too oily. Presentation for this would be 0 stars.

-Poached Farm Egg: 2/5 What the eff is this dish supposed to be? It was a hot mess. Putting poached egg in a dish does NOT make it fancy. It looked like they just mashed up a bunch of leftover ingredients on a plate. No bueno.

-Garganelli: 3/5 Meh pasta. We barely even touched this. Nothing particularly special.

-Grilled Shrimp: 4/5 Probably one of the better dishes of the night because it wasn't trying too hard. The tator tots and shrimp were an odd combo though.

-Fitto Misto: 4/5 Small oysters, but at least they were crispy fried and not soggy. Cauliflower oily AF.

-Brownie: 3/5 Will give you cavities it's so sweet. This was also left primarily untouched.

Service was good, but in terms of food, this place is over hyped. The food combinations and presentation were odd, and veered on the side of trying too hard. Stick to your name and just make plain, old good food.

 I probably wouldn't come back again.

Went here for a nice date night with the boy. Didn't know it was small plates (not my favorite concept unless I'm going looking for it). We had the truffle fries, falafel, a pasta dish and shrimp and andouille. It was good. Nothing exceptional. I'd recommend it for something different but it wouldn't be my "go-to" restaurant. Our waiter was nice but wasn't super attentive (they were fairly busy though). 

Overall, good food. Good experience. Ok service.

Tapas style meal that we love.  We were waiting along with 15 other people when it opened for the night.  There are options for vegetarians less so for vegans but there are yummy things for us too.  My husband of course was in heaven... We shared between 6 or 7 small dishes (except for the meat dishes).

Food: 4.5 Stars 
Service: 1.5 Stars
After wanting to try Good Food on Montford for months, I was finally able to yesterday evening with my girlfriend. The food definitely lived up to the name, but the service was absolutely horrible. We arrived around 5:45 and got a table immediately (no reservations are taken), but the place was full by around 6:15-6:30.
Since it's tapas style, we started with the beer battered broccoli. The beer batter was heavy and added a good crunch to the outside of the broccoli, but the inside was still soft and tender which was great. There wasn't much cheddar taste other than in the bechamel style sauce underneath. The pickled jalapenos added no spice either, but it was very good overall. 
Once, the broccoli arrived, we put in an order for the pork belly steamed bun with our waiter. We finished off the broccoli, waited, and waited. Our waiter checked on us after about 20-25 minutes and I went ahead and ordered the parmesan gnocchi while we were waiting since the pork bun seemed to be taking awhile. From the time we ordered it, the steamed bun took 35 minutes to get to the table, and our waiter never came back before it arrived to check on us or give us an update/take more orders. The pork belly was very tender, had a decent bit of 5 spice flavor, and a strong soy sauce flavor as well. The steamed bun was soft and a perfect pillow for the pork. Very good overall! The parmesan gnocchi came out after a bit more waiting, and it was excellent as well! The gnocchi were so soft, and the cream sauce had a strong but not overpowering parmesan flavor. It lacked many pieces of chicken or mushrooms as promised but was still awesome. 
Overall, the broccoli was good, the steamed bun was delicious, and the gnocchi were out of this world, but it took over 30 minutes for both the steamed bun and gnocchi to come to our table after ordering, and our waiter really did not visit the table often enough. We spent nearly 2 hours at Good Food just to eat 3 plates, and we were going to order one more but decided we didn't have time since we were seeing a concert later in the evening and everything had been especially slow.

Went here a couple of weeks ago with some friends who were in town on vacation.  I had been wanting to try it for awhile, and I am sorry it took me so long!  The food was delicious...especially the mussels in green curry sauce.  As someone who usually stays far away from curries, I was shocked to find myself wanting to drink the sauce from the bowl!  I can't wait to go back!!

From a food standpoint, my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. Tapas style restaurant with a big variety of cuisines including Mediterranean and Asian. Flavors really pop here. 

My favorites on the asian side include deconstructed Korean short ribs on crispy rice, and the pork belly buns. Italian pastas are all excellent, distinct flavors, with beautiful home made noodles. Have never had a bad dish here. 

However because they don't take reservations, and it's ridiculously packed all the time, I don't get there too often. Usually I go when I plan to eat dinner early (near 5) right when they open. Then I don't have to deal with crowd or line.

If you do have dinner early here, the place is child friendly. 

Bottom line is the food is great, if a bit pricey. One of the restaurants that I feel comfortable taking out of town friends from New York or other big metropolitan areas to, and raising their expectations that they'll "really like it".

Third time's a charm for Good Food! Yes, we've tried to eat here twice before and both times the wait was astronomical (2 hours, 1 hr 45 min). So, that's the first tip for everyone - the folks at Good Food do not take reservations, um, ever, I think?

But onto the evening, inside GFOM is simple, understated yet elegant. There's a pretty and low key bar, a fair number of tables and wonderful staff. Hubs and I were seated within minutes and tried a sampling of dishes. Before I get to the eats, I will concur with others - I think the plates (small and large) are a bit on the pricey side. So, perhaps it's not the most fiscally responsible move to head here when you're super hungry as the portions are small. Food time...

Mixed green salad: 4/5: A lovely salad, delicious and light with baby parsnips, cranberries and hazelnuts. Super light and a perfect way to start the feeding.

Smoked Salmon: 5/5: I don't even really like (or order) smoked salmon and I loved this dish. The fresh, smoked salmon with egg, potato & capers with dill creme fraiche was a perfect blend of flavors. The little chippers were great! 

Seared Scallop w/risotto: 3/5: My lease favorite of the dishes as I was expecting more complex flavor. While the items reads beautifully, butternut squash risotto, shaved fennel & bacon, my scallop (there were 2 on the plate) was quite undercooked and lacked depth. 

Steamed Bun: 4/5: Nom worthy. It's been a long time since I've had a steamed pork bun of this caliber. The five spice rubbed pork belly was perfectly tender yet crispy on the edges and I loved the hoisin & pickled vegetables.

Baked Cavatappi: 3/5: A good baked pasta dish w/fresh, gooey mozzarella. Coming from a family of very talented Italian cooks, I wasn't wowed by the sauce but I did really love the Italian sausage mixed in. 

Pork tenderloin (the only large plate we ordered): 3/5: The pork tenderloin was perfectly cooked and intense with smokey flavor yet the fried mac 'n cheese triangles were underwhelming. I didn't taste much cheese! 

Pumpkin Bread Pudding: 5/5: Drool. Sometimes I'm hesitant to order bread pudding because I get so disappointed when it turns out all French toast like. But this bread pudding was moist, bursting with delectable pumpkin flavor and topped with a gorgeous sliver of pumpkin seed brittle and some of the most delicious cheesecake ice cream I've had. Get it. 

Since the menu is eclectic and certainly inspired, I'm looking forward to coming back and trying more good food from GFOM!

Went on a recommendation from a friend and glad we did. Just the two of us so instead of waiting for a table, we sat at the chef's table. Nice guy and enjoyed watching him prepare the different dishes. Started with the beer batter broccoli. Not a fan as it really didn't have a lot of taste. Should have had the frites... Next came the Korean beef which was full of flavor. Also tried the shrimp and the gnocchi. Both did not disappoint. Since we'd already given up on counting calories decided to finish off the evening with a brownie dessert. Oh my! Warm brownie with a smear of peanut butter & topped off with homemade ice cream. Perfect way to end the caloric insanity.

Two words. Overpriced. Overrated. I understand the concept of tapas but they take it to the extreme - these portions are out of a comedy skit. The paltry morsels you do get are mediocre. The pork on sweet potato arepa was the best bite I had.

Came here Saturday at 6 pm and the place was already packed. It's a small venue with limited seating and they don't accept reservations. But it's well worth the wait. Started off with the Elderflower Pear Fizz - delicious! This place serves food tapas style which are small plates, similar to Dim Sum. If you're not into sharing, don't come here. Fortunately I came with my sister and cousin - double dipping is not a problem for us. We ordered several plates to share and loved them all except the gnocchi. The best gnocchi I've ever had was at Aria uptown and that just can't be beat. The pork belly bao bun was sweet and savory, topped with pickled carrots and daikon to offset the sweetness. I usually see the bao bun served with julienned cucumbers but the pickles were a delightful change. The pomme frites stayed crispy, even after sitting at the table for several minutes. We dipped them into the green curry sauce served with mussels. So yummy!!! We also had pasta with sausage and marinara sauce and Korean beef on crispy rice. The pasta was cooked perfectly and the Korean beef was so tender and moist. The sauce on both dishes were seasoned perfectly. We ended the meal with the cobbler which was more tart than I expected but the ice cream made up for it. Overall a great dining experience. The food was great, wait staff was even better. Even though we waited a while for a table, the food came out super fast. Can't wait to go back for more.

This is a great place to go for a special occasion! I highly recommend using the NoWait app to check in ahead of time - there's almost always a line waiting to get in.

The food was closer to five stars, but the service brought it down to four stars. Our food came out before our bottle of wine (really?) and we had to wait awhile to order as well.

For the food, the gnocchi was easily our favorite dish...at least until we got to dessert (more on that in a bit). I was also impressed by their cheese plate, one of our favorite orders on any menu. Each cheese came paired with some sort of spread and bread. Really outstanding pairings that I wouldn't have put together on my own! The Goose also really enjoyed his steamed bun, which is his standard for a good restaurant.

Normally I'm too full for dessert, but it is worth saving room at Good Food. Honestly, all of the desserts sounded delicious, but we were both in love with the brownie with biscoff ice cream that we ordered. They make the biscoff ice cream in-house, and the pairing with the warm, soft brownie was amazing. I'm really glad we tried it out!
Really good food. Tapas and expensive but they get away with it because it is so good. Come early or be ready to wait. Good service.

After hearing that GFOM had been named a semi-finalist for the James Beard award for Best New Restaurant, I knew I had to act on an acquaintance's recommendation and try it out.  It was not "perfect," but it was very, very good. 

There were two of us and we arrived at about 8:15 on a Thursday; by serendipity alone were we able to get a parking space - and a table for two without waiting.  The waitress commented on the fact that the servers would bring out everything "as soon as it was prepared."  I think this is partly a pretty convenient way to keep bratty, moneyed folks from trying to arrange their experience -just so-., but also keeps anything from coming out unintentionally tepid.

Coming out first for us was a plate of (two?) cold, grilled artichokes with morels, parmesano reggiano and mache.  This was a spectacular dish, with the morels and artichokes on such a level that their flavor they matched the intensity of the parmesan.  It made the next dish, a tasty one in itself, seem muted in comparison.

Second was an arugula salad with goat cheese, pine nuts, fresh & dried strawberries and a balsamic that reminded you of subtly very good wine.  Everyone is bound to have a salad plate somewhere,  but this made the most of it.  Everything tasted very fresh and nothing was overpowering, with the arugula well- but not overdressed with balsamic.

Third was a cheese plate, which I have to omit from how I viewed the place.
