There was a very soft cheese, a semi-firm and a blue, garnished with a port-soaked fig, truffle chutney and fresh honeycomb.  If you're a cheese person, I'm sure you'll love it.  I discovered through the plate that I wasn't.  The honey and fig were predictably delicious, the truffle chutney less so.

The pork bun was next.  I'm a bit spoiled by the buns by the Momofuku empire in NYC, but this bun was -not- worth the $10 that GFOM charges for it.  The hoisin was watery, the pork was good but maybe slightly overcooked, and the five-spice used in such a way that left the meat tasting slightly of cough syrup.  My suggestion to this place would be to make smaller buns, put two on a plate, drop the five-spice and pull the pork belly a tiny bit sooner.

Fennel soup came after.  We could barely taste the fennel, but we didn't care.  This soup had cream and probably pureed potato, was perfectly seasoned and was a welcome end to the savory courses, right down to the bread-and-tomato garnish on top.

We got a chocolate pot de creme and a warm cherry cobbler for dessert, and those two desserts combined could've likely satisfied four people in all.  As great of a way to bookend the meal as the artichokes were to open it.

Service was satisfactory if not particularly noteworthy, and since we didn't buy drinks I'm not terribly surprised.  If you have a date who loves good food and doesn't mind a noisy venue (or risking a bit of a wait), GFOM lives up to its name.

Stopped here on the way through Charlotte.  I am always a sucker for a good tapas place, but it is unusual to have tapas without the Latin feel of the restaurant... but in a good way.  The service was amazing, food was out of this world, and the ambience was perfect.  I have nothing negative to say about my experience, except maybe the bill.  If only Good Food would do a buy one, get one free deal or a Groupon.  I'm not going to hold my breath though since they certainly aren't hurting for business.

One of my favorite spots in Charlotte. Unique, small plate dishes. Pro tip: opens at 5:30 but if you want a seat for more than two, arrive around 5:20. If you show up later, expect to wait an hour plus.

Food is 5 star and the best I've had so far in Charlotte. The service is 3 star and can use a ton of improvement. No reservations accepted. You can show up and put your name and number on paper. Our wait was long and we were told that it's pretty consistent to have a 45 minute wait. Enjoy.

Finally got in here the other day and oh boy, good food isn't just the name, it's what they serve ya sillies! My gf and I sat at the chef's table and that was a ton of fun. We split 4/5 plates between the two of us and tried some cocktails-it was fun and charming. Looking for less than $20? Probably not your place. But if you like quality and well-put-together dishes then this could be a place you feel comfortable. It's small. It's probably got a wait. Don't be that guy who gets mad showing up at 7 on a Friday night and wondering why they can't seat you immediately. Don't do that. Enjoy the noms

I would recommend this restaurant to a group of girls in a second, if there is a male involved another venue should be considered.  The food, atmosphere and drinks are all great.  But the portions are TINY.  If you order the scallops you receive one scallop.  The shrimp are two shrimp.  The presentation is superb, and everything is very, very tasty.  Luckily a co-worker recommended that I might want to "pre-eat" before going - a great decision that probably saved me from dropping way to much money or leaving hungry.  Braswell's next door is a great stop for post-dinner drinks, it has a nice outside that is always packed on weekends.

We sat at the bar since we were told there would be an hour long wait for a table. Everything we ordered was delicious. The mussels in green curry were the stand out of the evening. We also had the steam bun, the korean beef, the beef carpacio, pork carnitas, and the fries. The drinks were excellent I tried the gin sour, the sage caperina, and the spiced chocolate ganache martini; my hubby had the old fashioned. We finished the meal with the root beer float cupcake, I highly recommend it was very unique and a perfect end to the meal.

I hadn't dined at Good Food in about a year, and it stood up to it's name yet again!  I can't recommend the cheese plate enough.  There are subtle hints of truffle oil throughout the accompaniments of various jams, which is right up my alley.  The mussels have changed my life for the better. Even my non-coconutty mother raved over the green curry and coconut milk broth.  

The highlight of my meal still has to be the duck fettuccine.  So creamy and delicious.  I could eat it every night!  

Good Food is worth the price for a special night out when you really want to experience inspired and delicious cuisine!
Everything we ate here was delicious. The food came out quickly and the waiter was helpful in navigating the tapas menu.
Great food and service this was our second visit.  The pasta and the gnocchi are delicious and the friend chicken is very flavorful.

Delicious but a tad pricey but hey.. it's Tapas. 

Love the gnocchi. My favorite dish. Must have!

They use to have fois gras but they discontinued it. That was delicious. It just melts in your mouth. I could indulge in that all day. 

Desserts are delicious and scrumptious.

Small and cozy place. Very intimate setting. More for couples or small groups.

Staff is nice and welcoming.

Highly recommend if you do have the extra money to splurge because it is well worth it.

Ok, WOW the name of this restaurant is an understatement. I came into this place with high expectations after reading the crazy high yelp reviews. I've had this place bookmarked for the longest time and finally made it here 2 years later. Well, the first time I came here on a Sat night they told us a 2 hour wait. My family and I were pretty hungry and decided it wasn't worth the wait. So a few weeks later we came back on a thursday, intrigued by how popular it was, and got to choose our table.

I'm not sure if I would recommend coming here hungry or just peckish. The food is so good and the portions are so small that I could easily eat everything on the menu. Unfortunately, each dish is around $10-14 and our server recommended 2-3 dishes per person. If the food was less expensive I would definitely come here more often, but for now, i'll stick to special occasions. 

It is a tapas-style restaurant, so each person gets their own small plate and the dishes are shared amongst everyone. I'm sort of vegetarian (more like pescatarian) but I tried a little of the pork belly and the korean beef (2 of the most popular dishes) and they were both really really delicious. Super flavorful sauces and textures. The falafel, and the other vegetable dishes are probably the best value and also are not lacking in flavor at all. The scallops were perfectly cooked. I would definitely recommend ordering a few pasta dishes because they are the most substantial/filling. 

Not only does this place have good food, but fantastic service as well. Our server was genuinely friendly and offered lots of tips on what to order since it was our first time. Didn't get to try dessert, which is my only regret.

I came here a while back with a friend after work, really nice environment, pretty good location with plenty of parking in walking distance.  I don't recall what we got but remembered it was good and they only served tapas, would be interested in returning about a year from now.

I give this place 5 stars based on the quality of the food, service, ambience, and price point. 

My husband and I were driving thru Charlotte and decided to stop by for dinner based on all the yelp reviews. We ordered curry mussels, garganelli (can't remember the spelling-tomatoe sausage pasta), and the Brownie dessert.  Bill came out to be $32 + tip. It was the perfect amount of food for us. We felt satisfied, but not overly stuffed. The server was super friendly even though we came in with our "comfy clothes" and all the other guests looked like they were on date night. 

I highly recommend this place. Just an easy place to run to for some good food.

We went with a group of 7. We had an hour and a half wait. We went next door and had a couple of drinks to kill time and that was a great idea!

Seating was very comfortable. The food here is amazing in tapas style. We shared the gnocci, scallops, cheese platter, kimchi udon, and it all was amazing! My favorite was the gnocchi.  For dessert, have the brownie with ice cream! You will not be disappointed!  Check out the menu for more specific ingredients. The chef should be commended! Everything was delicious!

While the food is really good, there are 2 things keeping this place from getting a 5 star. First of all, they have a hard time splitting checks they are not well equipped to do so. We had a party of 8 and while I itemized what was suppose to be charged to each card there was still some complaint by the server that I didn't put which dollar amount to which card. Second, we brought a birthday cake in and it would have been nice if they told us there was a cake fee, while not super expensive, it was a surprise on when we got the bill.

This is a fun culinary experience!!! Oh heck come early & sit in the kitchen.  Small cozy & buzzing with good energy.  They don't take reservations, first come first served.  Well worth the wait.  Menu changes seasonally so come often & don't be disappointed you'll find new faves!   My fave is the mushroom soup it's only place I'll have 2 Bowls in one night lol it's that good!!! Also a favorite go too is the gnocchi (flavors do switch up) they have great size bowls & encourage sharing.  So make an experience out of your time there! You'll get to know your server on a first name basis & you'll walk out full satisfied & feeling like you just had dinner at a good friends house only they're an amazing Chef ? 

Go often & don't be afraid of the wait time!!

My husband and I came here on a Friday night over July 4th weekend.. We walked in and were greeted with a 45 min wait. No biggie, they took our phone number down and told us they'd text us when our table was ready. We just walked across the street and had a drink at the bar. We started off with the meat plate and the cheese plate. They were pretty good, but honestly, I'll skip them next time. Next we got the green curry mussels, those were VERY good! Our final course was fried chicken over grits. Ours somehow came out under sweet potatoes, not a big disappointment, but it wasn't my favorite dish. The sweet potatoes were very bland and so was the chicken. Last was the pasta with homemade sausage..that, along with the mussels were my favorite. Overall..it was a great experience. Our server was great and the atmosphere was as well. We'll definitely be back, we'll just order new stuff to try.

I went to Good Food with the belief that I would find it overrated.  I thought it would be overpriced and pretentious.  I was so pleasantly surprised.  The food and service was outstanding.  Three of us ordered a cheese plate; potato gnocchetti; mussels in curry sauce; garganali Italian sausage; potato gratin; and steamed bun.  The truffle chutney was outstanding with the cheese.  Gnocchetti was sumptuous with excellent sauce.  We were surprised at how good the Italian sausage was -- it was the favorite for two of us, while the gnocchetti was the favorite for the third of our party, followed closely by the rich and bacon filled potato gratin.  The steamed bun was a pleasant surprise. The server was engaging and knowledgeable.  The wine list was exciting and eclectic.  Try as I might, I cannot say that Good Food on Montford is anything but outstanding.

Good Food has ammazzzzing food! I can not gush about how awesome everything we ordered! From the scallops to the mussels there was nothing more a girls night out could ask for.
The only problem we came across was the staff. We had a party of 5 in which two of the girls were running late, as it is on a busy Saturday night there was a wait in which the gentleman at the door told us 45 minutes. When the large party before us decided to leave our table came up sooner then that, in which the remaining two had not arrived yet. The 3 of us were standing there obviously anxious for them to get here, and the gentleman at the door kept making comments. "I hope they get here soon." "Don't want you to lose your table." "OH, finally their here you can sit." In which he just pointed at the table we were standing next to. ONCE AGAIN, let me say it was a busy Saturday night, it was nice of them to hold the table an extra 10 minutes for the other two to arrive, but the comments were very unnecessary. Then once we sat down our waitress took our order, brought our drinks, and didn't return until she dropped the check off on our table. We did not see her throughout the meal and once the check was delivered and having a group of 5 women who were all ordering separately we wanted our check split. I know this is obnoxious for anyone in the service industry but it is something that you run into... at every restaurant! When she didn't return for an extended amount of time we wrote down what everyone ordered and split it ourselves! When she picked up the check we informed her what we had down she said "thank you" took then check and walked away. About 5 minutes later the gentleman from the door returned to our table with our checks and said that they do not split checks and that there was no way to do it in the computer.. and that we had to figure out how much to charge each card separately... 
So to finish this review definitely go to Good Food for the food not so much for the service!

Tapas-style review for Tapas-style restaurant.  

Nervously waiting for Lolli to show up, hostess' spider-sense alerts her.  Glass of clear, pristine water arrives.  All should be well.

Order the Korean BBQ dish at some point.  The music returns - Dvorak's Op. 81(a).

Mussels are magical.  Just enough ocean to whisk you away sea-side.  

Steamed buns are space-bound.  That's just fun to say.  I'm listening to Eminem.

Desserts as sweet as Lolli.  I liked everything about the cheesecake and the apple spice ... pie, I think it was.  

Drink orders - perfect.  Timing on second drink - impeccable.  

Great dining experience due to good food or good company?  In this case, the chicken or the egg?

All is well.

dmo out.

Here's a little secret. Go to Good Food with plenty of friends so that you can steal a little bit of everything off everyone's plate. Feign that you are not really that hungry while you weasel your fork into another dish just to "sample" something else until you are stuffed. Like royalty in the Middle Ages, tax the "peasants" around your table. The ends shall justify the means. For this is Tapas on a whole new level with wonderful presentation and unusual takes on classic and not-so-classic dishes.

I have yet to find a dish here I would not "tax" again. Battle for a parking space, wait the waits, jockey for a table. It's all worth it. For those who don't understand I have only four words: Pork Belly Steam Bun.

Can we change the name of this restaurant to "Just Okay Food On Montford?"

I'm really not impressed! Everything I tried needed more of "something." 

The Beer Battered Cauliflower was bland...
The Korean Beef had to be sent back due to it being wayyyyy over cooked.
The undon noodles were okay. They were cold, & needed more spice.

The best thing we had was the MEAT RAGU & RICE STUFFED Cabbage 

That stuff was tasty. My Moscow Mule was also very good.

The service was great. I wouldn't be a regular though.

I've been wanting to try good food for years now and just haven't gotten a chance to have the time to wait in line to get in. After all this wait, my thoughts were the dishes were well done and flavorful but not necessarily the best food I've had in Charlotte. The P.E.I mussels is a must try, we slurped up the green curry sauce like a soup. Gnocchi has great flavor, and the falafels were well done. The carnitas weren't as well done, was hoping for more flavor on a Latino cuisine type of dish. Overall ambiance was fun and the food was on point!

Get here early! You will not have to wait if you come when they first open. We sat at the bar, even though tables were available. The bartenders were great.  The service and knowledge of the food was top notch. The gnocchi was out of this world. It was cooked with bacon and peas, with a lemon whipped cream. Wow! I will get 2 steamed buns in my next visit,the pork belly was cooked perfectly. Believe the hype and make the trip here.
One of my favorite places in Charlotte! I wish they'd bring back the broccoli tempura they had over winter. The gnocchi are always a good bet.

Many of my area foodie-cronies oft-hail Good Food as "the best restaurant in Charlotte". Though it's located but a stone's throw from my office, I had never taken the opportunity to dine there. Perhaps because of the heavy, universal praise it receives I had relegated it to some mythic status worthy only of an extremely special occasion. Through the birthday wishes of my esteemed friend Katherine, however, my hand was forced, and on a breezy Tuesday evening in October I finally cracked Good Food's threshold. 

We had on this night a crew of seven, which pushes the limits of Good Food's per-table capacity - but though they take no reservations, they easily and quickly accommodated our party (just by glancing through the restaurant's open front glass as I walked up past the posh little stuffed-sofa lounging area on the patio out front, I had taken note of the bustling little bar and seemingly cramped dining space and pessimistically doomed-and-gloomed us to not getting a table any time soon - way to prove me wrong, Good Food!). We were seated in the back near rear the rear exit and greeted promptly by our server...

If I may break from my review narrative for a moment and go on a not-colorful tangent: Our waitress was extraordinarily pregnant. I'm not sure why I found this so troubling, but it vexed me greatly. While I completely understand an expectant mother's need and desire to continue working and earning money while gestating a child, that somehow doesn't gel well with a dining experience. In my mind, very-pregnant women should not be on their feet serving me food and drinks. It's odd. It makes me feel like a jerk. I wanted so badly to offer her my chair and maybe even go so far as to extend to her the courtesy of foot massage. Yet, circumstantially, most would argue that that would have been an odd thing to do. I felt like I was in a weird social trap with no chivalrous outlet. So, ultimately, I just sat up really straight and tried not to curse too much. 

Back to the review: Good Food's dining area is nothing short of "adorable" - the quotes are for implying a sort of quaint/artsy/charming/small aspect to that adorability. It is dim and loud, with various eras of exposed brick lending their geometry to the perimeter, browns and yellows and old bronze colors filling the whole of the palette, and ornate crossworks of fused forks and spoons and knives creating the lightshades and wall-art. There's nothing exceptional about the decorations of the space itself, but it all coalesces into being very successful at establishing what it means to. 

Drinks here trend toward wine and fancy cocktails, not surprisingly, but there are a handful of well-selected local beers available as well. I tried the elderflower martini - it burned soft and was cleverly earthy, but somehow felt unbalanced. On subsequent rounds I just ordered NoDa brewing's Hop Drop n Roll. The beer felt uncouth for the situation, but it's what I wanted.  

Katherine, being the expert on Good Food's multi-round-small-plates ordering methodology, got us started with some pomme frites, a couple hot little dishes of steamed broccoli and battered cheddar, and a rather fancy cheese plate. All served quickly, all tasty, and all presented cleanly without pretense - I appreciate a subtle plating. Yet, I was not quite impressed.

For a "main course", my ladyfriend and I went splitsies on the seared scallops and a daily special of grouper served atop mixed veggies. Others at our table opted for the gnocchi or the garganelli pasta - which we all bandied about and sampled from incautiously, which seems to be the way of Good Food. Again, each dish was perfectly cooked, nicely seasoned, and promptly served... but I was still not quite impressed. 

Katherine, now five martinis in and guffawing heartily at AJ's even silliest quips, was ready for more and so we commenced desserts. We all shared spoonsful of a decadent chocolate-and-peanut butter brownie cake type thing as well as a so-sweet-it-hurt strawberry cheesecake. With these I was nearly impressed - but I'm hardpressed to qualify desserts as a reason to elevate a restaurant's food-status. 

After paying our three-hundred-dollar tab, we left feeling happy, not too full, and a little bit buzzed. Which I supposed is a very grown-up alternative to the stuffed-and-wasted condition through which my friends and I usually stumble our way out of a restaurant. 

In the end my assessment is that while good, Good Food is not great. There are a dozen restaurants in Charlotte that, in my mind, are just as tasty for half the price and twice the fun. But I also accept that perhaps, gluttonous and ravenous that I am, I might not be Good Food's ideal patron. If you're sophisticated, overpaid, and perpetually on a diet... this is probably the best restaurant in Charlotte.

If you haven't been to Good Food, you have to try them at least once.  

We went very hungry, and shared six dishes between the two of us.  Here's what we had, in order of our favorites -

5/5 - Pappardelle with lamb cheeks - This is one of the best dishes I have EVER eaten.  The mint was a perfect complement to the absolutely melt-in-your-mouth lamb.  And the pappardelle was perfectly cooked and went well with the lamb. I almost ordered a second one of this dish, but held myself back so I could try some other things. 

5/5 - Korean beef - If you like spicy food, this is one you need to try.  The beef was tender and very flavorful, and the rice cake was crispy on the outside, yet soft on the inside.  I savored every bite.

5/5 - Beets - I'm not a beet fan, but my hubby is.  This was made with what appeared to be puréed beets, sliced beets, and goat cheese.  He said it was one of the best beet dishes he'd ever had.

4/5 - Gnocchi with chicken sausage - The gnocchi were small, soft little pillows. The chicken sausage was thinly sliced and nicely spiced.  The mushrooms were small, thin, and very flavorful.  The Parmesan sauce was a little too heavy for me, though, and I'm not a fan of peas.

3/5 - Scallops with couscous - The scallops were perfectly cooked, but I wasn't fond if the couscous.  It was flavored with red peppers, overpowering the dish.  I would have preferred polenta or grits to couscous.

3/5 - Pork bun - I heard this one was one of their best dishes, but it was my LEAST favorite.  We sliced it in half, and my side of the pork was quite fatty and inedible.  It was also too sweet for my taste.

Service is efficient, and multiple servers watch over your table.  The dishes are delivered quickly, too, so eat up!

I'm glad I read other reviews, because we got there right at 5:30, and the restaurant was completely filled up by 6:15.  There are more two-tops than four-tops, so if you are going with a group, you absolutely have to get there early if you don't want to wait an hour or more.  And the only place to really wait is outside (other than the bar, which is usually mostly seated with other diners).

In terms of the price, I thought they were very reasonable.  All of these dishes--and two beers--totaled only $76.  Not bad for the quality of food!

If you like a variety of flavors, Good Food is one to try!

Our evening started out with some low notes, but the folks at Good Food made it right. We went on a Saturday evening, and we were told an hour wait (as expected), so we popped over to Duckworth's for some drinks to pass the time. After killing some time, we went back to Good Food, only to find out that my name had been crossed off the list. Wait, what?! 

I had given the host my cell number before we left, and no one had called. It turns out the host wrote my phone number down incorrectly. We were seated very quickly after that with a round of free drinks. Nice touch! 

Our waiter was excellent, and had a great sense of humor. Some of the items we sampled included the mussels, sweet pea soup, steamed bun, quail lettuce wrap, poppy seed cake, and brownie. All were phenomenal, but I think describing some of the dishes as tapas or small plates is a misnomer. The portions were all ample to serve as individual entrees. Our waiter did note though that some past patrons have shared the soup. Nope. We had also debated about getting the brownie versus the twinkie for dessert, and our waiter definitely steered us in the right direction because the Biscoff ice cream was divine.

Here is a good scenario where I wished I could give 1/2 stars.  I've been to Good Food once before and this was my second time and it was for dessert only.  The first experience was great and the food was REALLY awesome.  The dessert this go round was also excellent as well and we all enjoyed it.

Here's what I don't like:

We had a party of 4 and they don't do seperate checks.  When our waiter told us this I remembered that from LAST time.  Even in small parties..they won't seperate the check.  A little notice before ordering is a good way to let folks know that.

It's awkwardly small inside and tables are closer together than they should be.  It's weird sitting close to a 2 top table that is ovbiously on a date.

Other than that...it's great and I'll always go back...the food is on fleek! (haha learned that word last week)

I have to say I wasn't impressed and not sure why such high ratings. The service was great but food was average and super expensive. We got 6 items and the only two things that I would consider ordering again were the steam buns and the gnocchi.

I went to this place with my husband and they advise three plates per person. We ordered five and we were so full that we couldn't order any dessert! The gnocchi is just delicious, the pasta plate, the pork-belly steam bun are really good too. A little disappointed with the ponme frites. But overall it's a good place to try something different

Cool, different, amazingly delicious small plates and fabulous cocktails and wine selection. Very unique for Charlotte and great spot. No reservations accepted which sucks for us, small spot so weekends can be a pain, but well worth the wait or hassle.
Great place for date night or small groups. The food was amazing! Great flavor combinations and unique plates. Staff is very friendly and extremely knowledgeable. Will definitely go back.

My family and I love coming here. This is our celebration place because it has such great food and a cool atmosphere. They have good drinks- we like the mules. The steamed buns and pasta are amazing, but we have never had anything on the menu we did not like. The meal is small plates so I recommend going with a group and sharing! We always go right when they open so we avoid a wait. Will definitely be coming back here!

Is this place good for food ( pun intended)? YES! The food is seriously out of this world good. The mussels, the garganeli pasta, their deserts... wow this place has some of the best small plates and flavors I have ever had!  I would imagine this is a great location for a group just as much as it was for food as there are so many different flavors to try and this is the best way!  I think the mixed cocktail list is lacking a tad bit, but everything else is on point to me!

One of the first placed I fell in love with when I moved to Charlotte. I absolutely adore it.  I have always have great service and even better food.  I think I have tried the whole menu at some point, although it has changed since I've been there.  Looking forward to going back soon.

Good food. Service was okay. However prices were a bit high for the portions and the quality. 
Good for tapas style and sharing.

Easily my favorite restaurant in Charlotte - and apparently everyone else's too! The wait can be brutal, but it's worth it I promise!  The preparation of each dish is creative and thoughtful. I love that the menu changes but the favorites stay. The mussels might be the best I've ever had. Having a lot of foodie friends in NY, picking something up to their standards when they visit can be stressful, but Good Food never lets me down!  The decor is simple but cozy, a kind of 70s chic chalet feel. My go to menu items are the mussels, the bun, any of the pastas and biscoff ice cream.

Great place for a first date!  The Moscow mules were excellent.  The food is more like tapas that you can order and share...don't go there starving.  The fried cauliflower was delish, and so was the rainbow trout.  Lastly, you must get dessert.  We tried the cobbler and the brownie with biscoff cookie crumbs, they both come with ice cream and both were amazing!  It's a good place for either couples or a small group of friends.

Ok, I loved most of it.  Me and Baldie were trying to decide on where to go for my birthday dinner and originally it was Café Monte but because he's difficult and a stubborn Guinea and doesn't like shit outside of meat and potatoes for the most part,  I picked four other places to try and all four were booked except this place. I'm so glad they were all booked. This place was small and unassuming and had a kind of hipster feel. Small bar great bartender and my drink was Delish. We ordered carpaccio and arugula salad to start. Mind you it was delicious. However,  the other ingredients used, overpowered and totally obliterated the taste of the thinly sliced beef. A southern twist on this dish didn't work. It's to delicate for pimento cheese and fried pickles. Arugula salad was pretty basic, but good.  Pomme frites with truffle and Parmesan never disappoints. I was surprised to see just one pork bellysteamed bun come out, so we split it. Pork belly on it had good flavor, but a little chewy, but the slaw was awesome and had a nice crunch. The pasta dish had a decent portion and it's made with homemade sausage which was delicious, nicely seasoned and garlicky like I'm used to. It had sliced garlic that was really aromatic and Parmesan topped it off. BUT, it was SO SALTY. Wow, I love salt, but this was too much. It's a shame, tho. Because it was THAT good.  Dessert was cannoli cheesecake. It was good, that's all. We were really looking forward to the cinnamon roll apple dessert with ice cream on top. The cinnamon roll was so hard we couldn't get through it with our spoon and no one was to be found in order to get a fork and a knife  which was required to get through this hard piece of pastry.  I found the apples to be a little chewy and I was disappointed in that. Overall, I will say the food was good and I will definitely be back for drinks and apps another time.

This place was so much fun!

Everything was fantastic - a pleasant surprise given menu has such variety. 

We had a small wait for our table, but fortunately, we were able to grab a cocktail and wait outside on the patio, which was lovely.

The cocktails are excellent; I loved the mint julep.  We ended up ordering the Bahn Mi, Falafel, Truffled Fries, Southern Farmhouse Cheese plate, Charcuterie, and Garganelli.  We sampled a wide range of food and it was all delicious.

The waitstaff was incredibly friendly and helpful; their menu suggestions were excellent.

We finally went here for dinner last night. We tried a few times before but, didn't want to tough out the usually long wait. It was only about 20 minutes this time around which is very reasonable for a Friday night during prime dinner hours.

The food was excellent, every thing was cooked perfectly and very well balanced from a flavor standpoint. Between the 4 of us we had the pomme frittes (X2), cheese plate, pork tenderloin, salmon, steamed bun, Arugula, falafel and the shrimp. We also did one dessert per couple. Service was good as well.

Advice for people with more robust appetites: Go get a smoothie or something an hour or two before dinner or you might still be hungry after wards. That's what I plan to do if we go back. We weren't seated until about 8PM and I hadn't eaten since about 1PM. I was pretty hungry by that time and even after the amount of plates we ordered myself and the other guy wanted to go grab a burger or something afterward.

I've always heard people talk about this restaurant and finally made it up there last night. It was packed for a Tuesday night and food was really yummy. When we first sat down they brought roasted garlic and balsamic/olive oil. The waitress suggested a great glass of wine and we picked our plates. We shared the frites, quail lettuce wraps, the gnocchi, Korean beef and the chocolate cupcake for dessert. The frites needed something, perhaps it was just missing ketchup? The quail wraps were spicy and gingery, the gnocchi was wonderful full of mushrooms and delicious chicken. The Korean beef was really nice on a fried white rice, like actually deep fried. The cupcake was really yummy. It seemed to have two kinds of chocolate in it and the meringue was light as melted marshmallows.

This is one of the best restaurants in the city and always consistent. The staple items that have been on the menu for years are the stars (steamed bun, mussels, garganelli, Korean beef, etc.). We have had several mediocre experiences with some of the seasonal specials, where the chef sometimes tries a little too hard to be creative (e.g., the lobster foam ravioli was disappointing). Stick with the aforementioned staples, and you won't be let down.

This is a nice restaurant.  Good environment and decor.  The service was great.  It was nice to be able to add my name to the waiting list through Yelp.  We ordered the Korean Beef (superb), the steam bun (superb), gnocchi (delicious) and Falafel (okay).  The dessert was incredible, a pastry with some sort of bourbon ice cream.  Nice place to go out and try something new.

2 Words: Steamed Bun

Although the bill was a little high for the amount of food you get, this place is definitely worth a trip. Great service and ambiance. The chicken sausage gnocchi is also  MUST. Also really like the Korean Beef, wasn't a huge fan of the lamb belly

My girlfriends and I came here for girls night and got there right when it opened to beat the crowd. We each ordered a few items to try - I had the pasta (okay but not the best I've had), fries (overrated, in my opinion) and the steam bun (delicious!). 

The service was terrible. Our waitress was the manager and she was super short when we asked questions. When the bill came, she didn't split it and said she wanted us to calculate how much to charge each card if we wanted it split up. Huh? So I wrote down what items to charge on each card and when I handed it to her, she was clearly irritated. When she brought it back to the table, she said "Normally we don't do this so if you ask next time and we are busy, we will say no". 

While the food had some high notes, the service overall left a bad impression (although I will say, the other employees who brought our food or refilled our drinks were nice). I don't see myself coming back.

Good Food...more like Great Food..This place has to be one of the best restuarants in Charlotte. It's small plates and they have a variety of different options to meet what you're hankerin for.  Steam Buns are a most.  Their gnocchi is awesome.  Carnitas is amazing.  They have a great wine selection and the service is top notch.  They don't take reservations so plan on coming close to open or hanging out for a bit to get your table.  The wait is totally worth it.  Parking is tight here as well.

Words cannot describe how much I love the green curry muscles and the pomme frites. I love Good Foods rotating menu - every single dish is amazing and well done. This is my favorite spot in Charlotte and we will continue to come back. I highly recommend stoping by if you haven't. Enjoy sharing many wonderful plates!

definitely one of the better restaurants in charlotte!

our server was SUPER nice and laidback! loved her!

had the..
steamed pork bun: pretty standard compared to ones i have tried at other restaurants, good!
scallops: good! the butternut squash sauce was super delicious! cooked perfectly
korean crispy beef: was semi-skeptical but it was actually good! the two sauces were flavorful and the beef was cooked perfectly
sausage pasta: i am not a huge fan of pasta, but our server raved about is so we had to get it .. the sausage was flavorful but i wouldn't say it was the most amazing pasta ever

overall, all the dishes were good! loved the service and the atmosphere!
Just about ordered everything on the menu. The food came out at different times but it was brilliant because it was like we were constantly getting more and more food. Waves on waves.

Have been wanting to try this place for a couple of years and it was worth the wait. Small plate style service which is fun with small groups of 4-6. They don't take reservations so plan to get there early when they open for dinner or be prepared to wait for a good bit. They also don't do split checks but will split payment between a couple of people.

The pork buns are one of 3 dishes that have been on the menu since opening and we can see why. The menu changes so it's hard to suggest dishes but if the pork carnitas are on the menu GET THEM. They will give the pork buns a run for their money.

Suggestion of what not to get - cheese plate or charcuterie. Both are a little underwhelming compared to offerings at other restaurants for a similar price point. The charcuterie was passable especially with the fois gras and chicken liver pate.

We had a very good meal at Good Food! Server was great and made great recommendations! She guided our complete experience and we shared 6 plates. All delicious. Biscotti desert was amazing and the Old Fashion was good too.

On a visit to Charlotte from Chicago,  we came across this place based on Yelp! reviews. Wowza, this place is phenomenal! What we ordered: Korean bbq steak, seafood fetuccini,   grouper (catch of the day),  mussels,  chicken lettuce wrap and squid. Of these I highly recommend the mussels, but the Korean steak and the squid are amazing as well.

It's tapas style, so be prepared to pay up (each plate ranges from $6 to $15), about 2 to 3 plates per person is more than enough food.  Although,  it can get pricey, the flavor profile is so developed and the freshness is so  evident that each bite is worth the price of such, "good food."

I don't know why I waited this long before I ate at the best tapas restaurant in all of Charlotte? 

The wait is the reason why... Not only did I know this place was going to be a wait but just the simple fact of the sheer number of people who continually told me how good "Good Food" was as a restaurant . 

The place is really cozy and really feels like one big dining room in a really expensive house with a bar. The reason I say that is because you feel right at home with the colors and decor that welcomes a sense of intimacy unmatched in most place in Charlotte.

Our services was very prompt and provided great  knowledge of the foods while along with great recommendations!  

We order the cauliflower soup, assorted cheeses, gnocchi, lettuce wraps, beef with fried pickles and cheese. 

I like the texture of everything I tasted as it was fresh and appeasing to my palate. My favorite besides the cheese ,because I am addicted to cheese, was the gnocchi. 

The gnocchi had duck inside of it as it was cooked perfectly to give it a balance of just the right taste without being too overwhelming. The sauce was amazing and tasted homemade instead of out of a can. 

Honestly I don't have anything bad to say beside be ready to wait. It seems sometimes good things are worth the wait . In this case Good Food is definitely worth the wait! Happy eating!

Good Food on Montford is located outside of the downtown Charlotte area. It is one of the better rated restaurants on Yelp and Trip Advisor. I had reviews that seemed to indicate that the staff and patrons could be a little "stuck up", so I kept that in mind before going there.

It was raining fairly hard on the day we went, so I didn't expect there to be a long wait as the restaurant does not take reservations.

The restaurant has a small plates concept, which seems to be the norm at a lot of places now.

After being seated and having had a chance to look over the menu, we decided to try a few dishes and depending on portion size to add more as we went.

The Arugula Salad ($7) came with arugula piled high topped with bacon and onions, with red and yellow watermelon adding a sweetness to counteract the mint vinaigrette. The salad was a good way to start the meal, but had a little too much dressing for my taste.

The Beer Battered Broccoli ($8) came with a cheddar foam and pickled jalapenos. The broccoli was crisp and not greasy. Just wish there would have been more as this was a hit.

The Steamed Bun ($10) came with loads of pork belly, hoisin and pickled vegetables. The vegetables counteracted the sweetness of the hoisin. This is a mash up of a banh mi and Peking duck and worked well.

The Korean Beef ($12) was set atop crispy rice garnished with scallion kimchi. The meat was tender, and although fire red gochujang could be seen the dish was lacking in the bold flavors and spice that Korean food is known for.

The Salmon ($13) was a southern take on gumbo. The salmon was crisp on the outside, and tender and moist on the inside. The sausage added some "meatiness" to the dish. Perhaps the best thing about the dish was the fried okra. It was light, crunchy and not slimy at all. They were so good, we ordered a side of fried okra.

The Parmesan Gnocchi ($13) were light and fluffy. The chicken was cooked well. The cream sauce added a level of comfort perfect for a cold night.

The Crispy Quail Lettuce Wraps ($11) were a take on chicken lettuce wraps seen on many menus. Slices of quail breast were intermingled with cucumber and Asian pear for textural contrast. This was probably the least favorite dish of the night.

The Chocolate Brownie ($7) is paired with Biscoff ice cream (who can resist that?). The portion is rather large. The brownie was nice and fudgy, and had a slightly crunchy crust.

The Pot De Crème ($7) combined chocolate and espresso. Unlike most chocolate pot de crème's that I have had, this one was a little lighter in texture which I enjoyed. A layer of whipped cream also helped to lighten the dish. This was the much better dessert in my opinion.

Service was friendly throughout the meal. I did not experience "attitude" problems that have some people have noted. I would not hesitate to eat here again.

I have never eaten a thing there that I wouldn't eat again and again and again.  The quail wrapped in lettuce was succulent... The mussels sweet...the braised duck with pasta and pancetta was unbelievable.... Go hungry...2 people can share 4-5 small plates...   I am a "tastings" junkie and Good Food is my crack!!!

Frites, purple sweet potato gratin, green curry mussels, pork belly steamed bun. Yes, I had a feast and it was soooo worth it. :-) The gratin in particular was incredible. 
I had excellent service alone at the bar and some fellow foodies to talk to. Excellent local beers are offered and there is a decent wine by the glass selection.

I came to Good Food on Montford a couple months ago with one of my friends...  She got there earlier than I did and nabbed a table for us... Good thing because they don't take reservations and apparently, they fill up pretty quickly...  

I cannot think of one bad dish that we shared that night... I had the Korean Beef which was totally spectacular and served on top of crispy rice with a scallion kimchi... She ordered the truffle fries because she said she'd been craving them... One bite and I figured out why... They were light, crisp and but still managed to be filling... You could taste the truffle, but it wasn't overwhelming at all... A perfect complement... She also ordered the oysters... I don't eat those, but she said they were fantastic and I'm willing to take her word for it... 

The server took quite a while to come back around... As I said, my friend came first and got the table, but it took about 20 minutes for her to come back to the table to get our drink orders after I arrived... That seems like a long time to me, especially when you already have a person at the table, so you know there's an active guest situation there...  The service picked up after the initial lull, at least... I'll definitely be back, though...

The parking can fill quickly if you don't come early and if you do come late, prepare for a wait... (I did not intend for that to rhyme... I promise. lol)

I love Good Food and go at least once a week.  I tend to get the same dishes over and over, my favorites being the steamed bun, the fried chicken and from the last menu the rammen noodles. Though small, they have probably the best beer selection pound for pound for a restaurant in town, but i always get the DFH 60.   The staff are friendly and prompt.   I love the decor with its modern yet warm feel.    My favorite restaurant in town.  I regularly see some celeb, local or otherwise.  Where those in the know go.

This place was downright impressive from the look, food and to the service. It is the perfect blend of fine and casual dining. It started out with some complimentary bread with a nice balsamic oil dip that was great. Then I decided to follow the lead of all the people who raving about the Pork Belly steamed bun. They were right, That bad boy was packed with flavor...so savory. I loved the green curry mussels but not as much as pork belly. The waitress gave me a couple more suggestions next time around so i can't wait to hit up this place again and try some more. Great stuff.
Good food and nice staff. Every bite was better than the next yummy! Such a cool inviting atmosphere too. Cant wait to come back with my family

We had heard rave reviews about Good Food and were looking forward to our first visit on Friday.  Needless to say, they did not disappoint.   Items are server tapas or small plates style for sharing which is great as we wanted to try just about everything on the menu.

Our favorites were the steamed bun stuffed with a hoisin glazed pork belly, and the house made sausage and pasta (We ended up ordering a second round of each for the table).   The mussels, gazapacho, charcuterie and quail lettuce wraps were excellent as well.

This place is really unique inside, looking a bit like Herman Miller got his hands on an old 50's family style restaurant.   Cozy bar with seating for about 15, the dining area seats around 60 or 70 at most. 

We enjoyed food and drinks for over two hours and never felt rushed by the very knowledgeable and friendly staff.

Parking is limited in their lot, but if you get their early enough there is plenty of parking across the street or on the street itself.

We are already making plans for our next visit!
Yumm The mushrooms and the chicken gnocchi are delicious. the pommel frittes and asparagus farm egg are pretty good too. Pair with a glass of barbera and you have a great meal.

Good Food serves good food. I will give them credit for that. I just wasn't Wowed by the creativity or the taste of their dishes. 

Our group of three ordered:
Pommes Frites - I'm a fries junkie, so had to get this. It was a nice snack before our main dishes came out
Parmesan Gnocchi - my friends love this. I'm not into cheesy foods so I passed on this dish
Steamed Bun - probably my favorite out of everything. This is a must.
Pork Carnitas - Surprisingly good. Kind of have an Asian twist to it with the pickled veggies 
Tega Hills Green - nice light salad
Beer Battered Broccoli - again, not a fan of cheesy dishes so I skipped on this dish as well, but friends enjoyed it.

Definitely had better tapas in my hood of Atlanta and other bigger cities. I think the culinary scene is still growing in Charlotte, so until then GF will have to do.

Our group came around 6pm on a Friday night and waited about 20 min for a table. The dining space is small so come early if you prefer little to no wait as it gets filled very quickly.

Small, delicious plates. It is so fun to order them as you go with friends so you can try more without the cost killing ya. A great date night spot. Also, their cocktails are delicious! I had the fig smash that was perfect for winter. My favorite plates were the purple potato gratin with goat cheese and their gnocchi. We will continue to return!

Tapas Style, Good Food = Great Food.  Visited on a Tuesday for dinner and was packed.  Tried 12 out of about 20 items.  PEI Mussels in Green Curry were awesome, as well as charred Octopus.  Cheese plate had 3 very different and original cheeses and sauces/jam with charred toast, wish it was a slightly larger portion for sharing. 

1-5 scale. 
Ambience = 4
Food = 4
Drinks = 4
Service = 5
Good Food on Montford is great food. Expect to wait for a table and pay well for their variety of 'good food' but the overall experience and quality of food is worth it

"Wow!" That pretty much sums up my experience at Good Food! The wait was long on a Friday evening, but it didn't matter because they have a great little patio where you can enjoy a glass of wine and some delicious appetizers. After spending an hour on the patio we were seated at our table where we enjoyed some of the most wonderful food. Because the menu is tapas style, we got to try many items off the menu (which means we got to spend a lot of money.. servings are small, prices not so small!) and I can't pick a favorite because every one of the dishes was fantastic! From the quail to the pork belly, the tilapia to the kimchi beef, even the duck pasta and the scallops, were all amazing. Okay, I know that doesn't help you, so if I had to make a recommendation of the three bestest items, I would pick the quail wraps, pork belly and the kimchi beef! 
I'm a pretty conservative meat eater, and usually stick to white meats, but I went in with an open mind, and gave everything a try, and I'm glad that I did. 
This restaurant should really be called Great food on Montford, it is undoubtedly one of my favorite places in the city now :)

Seeing as this is the only sit-down restaurant meal I've eaten in Charlotte, my review may be a bit skewed, but I didn't think this was the most OMG-amazing-I-can-die-happy-now meal of my life. My dining companion, who is much better versed in the local eats than I, assured me that this was the best meal he's ever consumed in the city. Despite this praise and his expertise, I found myself smiling and nodding so I didn't insult his home town by saying that it was good, but *just* good. Had the restaurant been named "Good food and not very good cocktails on Montford" I may have given it five stars for perfectly fulfilling its name, but instead I read the name as "The Best Food in Charlotte, Let Alone on Montford." Oops.

Since I've already stopped being polite, I'll go ahead and begin with those very cocktails. At this point in the evening, having spent nearly three hours waiting in line to see the McAdenville Christmas lights, I was damn near delirious from lack of food and being imprisoned in a car. I was a little wary of how sour the Montford Gin Sour (meyer lemon house sour, Plymouth Gin, St. Germain, egg white) would be, wanting something more akin to "comfort drinks," so I went with the Mayflower (Plymouth Gin, agave nectar, basil, lime juice) which seemed like a safe bet. Though it was quite strong, it really lacked flavor from any of the elements other than the gin. How can you mess up "safe"? The Sour ended up not being terribly sour but did lack the body that the egg white should have developed in the drink. I can't speak to the quality of Justin's Good Old Fashioned, but he assured me it followed the trend of strong drinks and was well pieced together. The chocolate-chili dessert cocktail, the Hot Chocolate Martini, was the best composed of the four for the evening and I was a bit bummed I couldn't have more since I pulled the short straw and was driving back. Good Food's cocktail program may not be as sophisticated as I prefer, but it did one thing right: it easily got my boyfriend drunk. That's saying a lot for an Irishman who can hold his liquor, so ladies, take note...and take advantage.

We ordered the cheese plate to whet our palates while we browsed the rest of the menu, picking out more than enough to satisfy our hunger. The three cheeses were well paired with with honey/fennel, jam and truffle chutney, and overall was my second favorite part of the meal. My number one dish was the parmesan gnocchi with roasted chicken, mushrooms and arugula with porcini broth (which is a huge compliment as I generally do not like mushrooms), and I really enjoyed the green curry mussels. Justin liked the crispy Korean beef, the steamed bun was good, and the let down of the night was the scallops with grits.

As the reality of the amount of not-so-small plates we ordered was setting in...into our waistlines, we were offered the dessert menu. Never one to turn it down, we gave it a glance and I ordered the malt flavored cheesecake and Justin got the aforementioned dessert cocktail. At this point in the evening, we were the only diners remaining yet the girls helping us were still very helpful. The cheesecake had the consistency and taste of a slightly-malted flavored flan -- not your typical cheesecake but quite beautiful. It was garnished with crushed malt candies, i.e., Whoppers, which made it that much better since they remind me of my childhood.

Great service and even better food! Loved our whole dining experience here. Only small downside is that it gets very loud inside so I wouldn't go there if you're looking for a quiet relaxing date night.

Lovely restaurant! Great drinks and food. We ordered the spinach salad, truffle fries, trout, falafel, mushrooms, shrimp, and the mussels in green curry. By far the best dishes were the salad, trout and mussels. the green curry sauce is very tasty. Highly recommended.

Pro tip: Sit in the back bar!! *Person in back of crowd screams* "There's seating in the back? I thought it was just cramped tables??"

Yes. There is seating in the back. And it's spacious, intimate, and wonderful, and on a weekday, it means you can probably skip the wait 100%. And now you know.

The Lady and I went out for a nicer dinner, put our name on the list, and was told about 25-30 minutes, if that. And guys, that was fine with us. We tried to find a place at the bar where we could squeeze in and order a drink, and lo and behold there were 2 seats for us in the back. Score. Plus, that station is the dessert station, so you get to see the dessert prep throughout your meal. You know, if you're into that sort of thing.

Drinks: Wine for the Lady and Dark n' Stormy for myself.
Food: 
Parmesan Gnocchi. Fantastic flavor, super rich, good consistency for the gnocchi. Loved the mushrooms in it.
Battered Broccoli: Wish that there was more salt, I suppose the vinegar in the jalepenos was supposed to provide that, but I didn't get that in a majority of bites. Solid flavors though, just lacked a bit of seasoning. 
Steamed Bun: This is what I came for. Awesome. Much satisfaction. Go get one now. 
Shrimp: These were surprisingly stellar!! I actually asked the chef about the cooking method for these and got a mini recipe, so I'm very thankful that they were willing to share that. The combination of the apple, sweet potato, and shrimp together made a fantastic dish that I want to try to replicate. 

Great night. Great restaurant. And I feel it's a bit underwhelming to say that it's just *Good* Food. Yelp, it's GREAT food.

Damn.  Went at like 6 on Thursday so had no wait for a party of three.  Had six things on the menu.  No need to explain all that I had because I am sure everything on there is just as amazing as the food that I ordered which is why I'll be going back and ordering 6 completely different things.  Oh yes I will be back it was that good.

After seeing the constant wait to get into Good Food on Montford we decided to go when they first opened one night to avoid the line. We were seated right away, and the waiter was attentive and informative about the menu selections since it was our first time. Though we have had tapas before he explained the process and how many we should order per person since everything on the menu is in small plates. Everything we had was great, the korean beef was amazing, as well as the pork bun. The truffled fries were out of this world, some of the best I have ever had.I do not eat seafood, yet my fiancé does and he had the seafood plate of the night that he enjoyed very much. The drinks were creative and fun, I especially enjoyed my beat cocktail- Yes actually the root veggie infused vodka cocktail! The food, service and space is great! Just get there early! We will be back to try other things on the menu

Traveling from Charleston to hang out in Charlotte for the weekend! We decided to make a quick, last minute dinner trip to a restaurant nearby...Good Food. The food was phenomenal. I ordered A few items but let me just say this... the spring rolls were absolutely invigorating. I've never tasted anything quite like it. We ended the night with satisfied hunger for sure. Oh and by the way, the staff is on point. After I got back to my hotel, I realized I couldn't find my phone. I hear a knock on the door and look what's found...my phone. Jonathan (I believe was the name) brought my phone to me ... at the Hyatt hotel... which is a 15 minute drive from the restaurant. Thank you!

Really interesting and tasty small plates made for sharing with great presentation.  The location has a cozy atmosphere, good wine & beer selection and very attentive servers.  This is one of the best restaurants in Charlotte and 5-6 items shared between 2 people works really well.
Some of the best food in Charlotte. Never had a bad dish. Had several that blew our minds. Nice atmosphere.  Get there early to get a seat as it fills up fast and they don't take reservations.

Tonight was our first visit, and it was a great one.  We had essentially no wait due to the time we arrived.  The food is tappas style and our group of 4 tried nearly half of the menu.

The food was very fresh and unique.  The best part was the desserts, so save some room!
Small plates.  Rocked.  Great food at reasonable prices.  Excellent service.  Can't say enough good things.

If you're debating on where to go to dinner, look no further!! Also, ask to sit at the chef's counter, it will make the entire dinner experience that much better!! But no matter where you sit every single food item is incredible! Just to name a few: gnocchi, steamed bun, mushrooms, gargenelli, and steak frites. And when you don't think you have room for dessert, you do!!
Great food! Service is exceptional and an all time Charlotte top5 restaurant. I love that there menu changes and sitting at the bar is my favorite option

Good Food?  Should be called GREAT food!!  I am SO excited I finally made it to this household-named restaurant!  I have been desperate to check them out but my husband isn't one for tapas so we never made it a priority.  This past Friday I was able to enjoy my tapas in peace because I dined with three other ladies that were more than willing to try everything!  It was perfect!!  We arrived on Friday around 7:30 and were seated within about 30 minutes, which isn't bad considering they don't take reservations.

The waitress was super helpful in guiding us through the menu and gave us some suggestions.  Some of the plates are really best for 2 people and others were enough for the 4 of us to share.  We tried so many different things I don't even know where to start.  I will just break it down dish by dish:

Broccoli Raab--Very good, refreshing, flavored well, served chilled, not too bitter
Arugala--Strawberries, pine nuts, and goat cheese...can you even go wrong?
Cheese plate--Meh.  I mean blue cheese made an appearance, really?  Come on.
Falafel--Scrumptious...4 little falafel nuggets.  Left me panting for more..so good.
Risotto--Not sure what flavors were combined to make this yummy goodness but it was on point

Gnocchi--With RABBIT.  Yup, I ate rabbit.  First time ever folks.  The gnocchi was excellent.  The rabbit was tender and flavorful.  It was not doubt gamey but blended well with the other flavors.  It was a table favorite.

Steamed Bun--This one has the most hype around it but it wasn't necessarily our favorite.  The pork was so tough and the flavors were ok but it wasn't THAT great.

Mussels--My first time trying Mussels!  I don't have anything to compare these to but the others were loving these mussels.  They were in a green curry sauce and they were served with soft, warm, naan.  We all started dipping the bread in the sauce afterwards...and we even ordered more naan.  It was very good!!

Pork tenderloin--Another group favorite..so tender, full of flavor, served with a soft piece of cornbread.  Very good!!

We wrapped up our pigfest by grubbing down a brownie served with biscoff icecream.  The brownie was warm with chocolate chips...it was thin, not very moist, just okay in my opinion.  The icecream was very creamy.  We licked the plate, don't let me fool you.

Overall--great experience.  Atmosphere is loud and crowded but energizing.  I love the hustle in this place.  People are eating well and are satisfied!  Prices are a little high but the quality of food makes it worth it.  I'll be back no doubt!

finally made it to good food, and oh my goodness, so amazing. 

our group of five made a decent dent in the menu. nothing was bad, but some was definitely better than others. of course everything is plated beautifully and you almost hesitate to take your first bite, almost. 

favourites: charcuterie plate (mostly due to the liver mousse), cheese plate, mussels, steamed bun, ramen, large salmon plate

good, but not as good: smoked salmon (the dill creme fraiche was lacking in the dill department, and other departments), bruschetta (just kind of fell flat)

plates that were cleaned but never got to try myself: falafel, scallops

chiming in with the other reviewers, yes, the PEI mussels are uh-may-zing. although you almost think its going to be a really thick broth with the curry and coconut milk decription, it really is the same consistency as when you order mussels in their cooking broth elsewhere, which is great. light, flavourful, another round please?

for dessert we tried the cupcake and the cobbler. the cupcake sounded fairly uninteresting on paper (i wanted to try the pear dessert with the avocado ice cream, but that's for another trip) but was fairly good. moist cake, nice s'more meringue topping, you can't really go wrong. the cobbler was... divine. 

all of the staff was very nice, our party's arrival time was a bit staggered but everyone was accommodating. the service was great, love the lighting and the coziness.. if given the opportunity I feel like I could spend a whole evening here with friends (or family), although loud and lively at times still very comfortable and enjoyable.
can't wait to return!

We went here for a date night last summer and it was a nice spot. The food was good and so was the service. Just a little too small and close for my comfort on a date night but I would recommend this place for a night out with friends.

It's so good that it's impossible to get in on the weekends. Once you plan for it, it's totally worth it. The Korean beef is my favorite, but everything on the menu is really good. There's a bigger guy, I think his name is Steve, really knowledgeable server. This is another of charlottes must-visit places

Another excellent and satisfying meal. This place continues to have the best tasting food in Charlotte! If I pick the restaurant for date night, it's always Good Food on Montford! 

We arrived around 7:30 pm on a Saturday and had about a 45 minute wait.  The wait seems to decrease after 9 pm. They don't take reservations so grab a drink and hang out on the comfy outdoor couches. 

For drinks we tried Straight Outta Montford, the Mule, and the Montford punch. All drinks were flavorful and strong!

Tonight we had the gnocci and pasta dishes and both were excellent. We tried the pork carnitas for the first time and are fans. The fried chicken and grits was interesting and the chicken was perfectly cooked. I'm not sure tomato grits are my favorite, but the other flavors in the dish were yummy. My hubs had the steamed bun and said it was good, as always. 

For dessert we split the new cinnamon roll dish. The brown butter ice cream was ridiculously good, but it was difficult to eat the cinnamon roll and get to the apple pie filling stuff underneath. The cinnamon roll was kind of hard and we asked for a knife to cut it up. Our waiter said it was the first night on the menu and that they were still tweaking the cinnamon roll recipe to try and make it easier to eat.

Ate here a few weeks back. Recommended to us by Uber driver. Didn't disappoint. The Green curry mussels were excellent. Great craft beer selection. Service A1. The place was packed to the brim on a weekday but luckily we got the last table. The food came out quickly and very well presented, fairly quickly considering the amount of patrons dining. Would definitely return here. A bit pricey compared to the portions (think NY tapas spot) but definitely high quality.

Good Food is by far one of my top 10 restaurants in Charlotte!
Why not 5 stars you ask, unfortunately service can be hit or miss and depending on the time of night it is definitely loud, making it difficult to enjoy conversations at your table.

But, let's get back to the good things.  Good Food is located on Montford Ave with a great location and beautiful restaurant.  It is intimate and is a great spot for date nights or a girls night out.  
The menu includes several tapas items and can change seasonly.  However, there are a few items that have been on the menu since opening because they are so good.  
A few standout items for me are the Garganelli Pasta with Sausage, the Carpaccio and the Korean Beef with Crispy Rice...love the Rice.
And, definitely save room for dessert. They have some great treats that definitely deserve a taste.
They have a great wine list and offer several speciality cocktails.
If you haven't been to Good Food, I suggest you bookmark it for a special night.  But, keep in mind they do not take reservations, so enjoy a cocktail or two while you wait.
Good food, not great food. good enough to get four stars. Their portion sizes are smaller than your average tapas so make sure to order plenty!

I still very much enjoy good food! We tried the brownie dessert with cookie ice cream, and it was delicious. I also tried the octopus for the first time tonight and was pretty disappointed. The mussels are still my highlight at dinner!

heard excellent things about this place. I real Had high expectations.......omg ordered 4 small plates 2 drinks spent over 70 dollars left hungry but wasn't as amazing as I thought it would be.we came to eat a busy time so it took quite awhile to get our food plus there was a table of business men, VIPs I guess, because they had food brought constantly and the wine flowing and we sat and sat before we were acknowledged. I understand it happens but it still makes me feel crappy. Any who, maybe I need to give it a second go around since obviously it has great ratings.....maybe I just have bad luck.

Definitely see what the fuss is about.  Tapas style menu where you can try a bunch of new creative dishes you're not going to get anywhere else in town.  I kinda like the fact that this place has been able to maintain their individuality as well as some inkling of a culture too.  It's tough to find places like this that can hang on to any of those precious gems, but you can see why when you've experienced it here.

Super crowded, expect a wait even if you show up early.  The restaurant's interior does an admirable job accommodating the queue of people, but it sure feels crowded when you're inside.  It also makes the place feel stuffy, loud, and quasi-forced and awkwardly intimate.  

It's good, but the details for me were off a bit.  The waiter was fine, but seemed distracted.  Took forever to get our first drinks - which is a cardinal sin in my book.  The food was good, but didn't knock my socks off and left me feeling a bit underwhelmed by the execution, rather than its potential.

I'd come back, but sure would love to see some competitors pop up to distract me from doing so.

This restaurant have been on my list for a while. My wife and I finally went last night. We were not disappointed the service and food was great. This restaurant has a neighborhood feel we definitely would go back.

Small plates and Big flavors! Great service and surprisingly reasonable prices. Get there early because it fills up even on week nights. The menu is varied with hot and cold, beef, chicken, seafood, salad options, and lots of good wine selections. We had 5 plates and 2 glasses of wine for just over 50 bucks, which is reasonable for most small plate restaurants. If i lived in Charlotte, this is a place I would come to quite often!

Great food, not just good!  Small inside which is always busy it seems so a spot at the bar isn't a bad idea if it's open.  Friendly staff and cool menu options that were very tasty!  Would definitely recommend trying for date night.

2.5 years later and this place is hitting the marks.
This time the dinner party sat at the bar which was empty (we didn't RSVP).
This is when I realize that there is no TV at the bar. You won't hear me complain about that. 
Service was good enough. She kept our drinks filled and checked in occasionally.
Food was still excellent. The charcutier plate offered 3 meat (3 slices each) along with a small thing of foie gras & chicken liver mousse and grilled bread. I never had foie gras before, it was very tasteful. The other person said it was solid and he had eaten foie gras everywhere. Next up was Korean Beef. It was a little small in portion, but another taste explosion. Beef were cooked medium rare and sliced and sat on top of a square crispy rice cake with the whole thing topped with grilled scallions and covered in spicy kimchi sauce. It hit the spot just right. We also mixed in the old standby PEI Mussels in green curry & coconut broth. This is always my favorite. I wish there were more than 2 pieces of pita. I swear I would pick up that bowl and lick it if I could. And lastly we had the steamed bun. It is one steamed bun for the record. It makes sharing a little difficult. But it was very good, the pork belly was meaty not fatty, and the flavor was perfect.
I'm really glad to see that a place can consistently put out quality food. The price is not that bad for what you got. Believe me, I've paid more for worse which is nothing I like to brag about.
GFOM, well done, and keep up the good work.

Good food on Montford, was literally one of the best meals I've ever had.  Each dish seemed to get better!  From my first beer to desert I didn't want this meal to end!!!  We started with the Beef Carpachio.  SO GOOD!  For those who only eat beef well done, you are really missing what beef taste like.  The Fried Pickles & Pimento Cheese made this so perfect.    

From there we had the Sauteed Mushrooms, Steamed Bun, Korean Beef, and the PEI Mussels.  Though I've seen the steamed bun on TV, this was my first time having one.  It was great!  I'm very picky about my pork belly.  Some places don't cook it enough and I just feel like I'm eating a mouth full of pork fat, but Good Food knocked it out of the park!  The Korean Beef was like a tapas portion of Bi Bim Bop, which is my favorite Korean dish.  I could have eaten 10 of these.  Not because the portion was small, but because it was so good.  The mushrooms accompanied both of these perfectly.  One of my favorite things in this world are PEI mussels of any kind.  My favorite curry at a Thai place is green curry, so this was a match made in heaven.  Best green curry I've ever had.  I literally finished the curry with a spoon when I ran out of mussels/bread.  Yes that may have been crass, but if you tasted it I'm sure you'd do the same!!!  Don't be weary of the fact that it is Tapas place.  The portions are good size.  I definitely left full.  

We finished with with the Peach Cobbler.  OMG.  I generally go for a Whiskey for desert (truth be told I did), but I had to try the cobbler.  It was amazing.  My wife got mad since my desert was suppose to be the Bulliet Rye on the rocks, and I ate half her desert.  The shortbread crust was what put it over the top, but every component was perfect.

This was hands down one of the best meals I've EVER had.  I can't wait to come back to Charlotte just to eat here again.  Worth the money, wait, etc.  Service was impeccable, but even if the service was terrible, the food would have generated 5 stars!  Kudos Good Food on Montford!
Hidden gem in Charlotte! The food was fresh and tasty. They have unique choices. If you like sampling and small plates, this is a great choice.

OK this rating is based on customer service only- The host was very pretentious..After we presented through the door, he asked 'Can I help you' but in a tone that suggested we were a bother (instead of how can I help you , etc). He said it would be 45 min wait. Fine. but be pleasant about that fact. He acted like this we should be priveledged to have stepped into this establishment....I would have thought by his attitude that we were suppose to make reservations, but nope, they don't take any..Furthermore, he left such an unprofessional voice message when our table was finally ready on the cell phone that I would not consider this a place worthy of my business. Snooty tooty yet classless.
Great food, great service.  Do yourself a favor and get the pomme frites and the garganelli.  Also, get there at 5:30 when it opens to avoid a wait.
Best restaurant in Charlotte. Get the curry mussels then add the pomme frites in the sauce. Oh my.

I love good food and I love Good Food.  I have been there about half a dozen times and always love the offerings and the food has always been delicious.  Good wine and cocktail lists as well.  
I am giving three stars this time because it seems that their portions have shrunk!  I know it is small plates - I get that....but geez guys...if you need to order 8 plates to fill up - it kind of defeats the point, right?  
I do love it and I will be back of course because the flavors are wonderful and I adore the way the menu varies...just wish there were a few more of those delicious truffle fries on the plate.

The service was amazing. Our table was taking longer than they expected and they comped our appetizers we ordered while waiting at the bar. A super nice gesture for something that was beyond their control. Our meal was incredible as well!

Another place that should take reservations. We tried several things and all of it was great! We had to sit at the bar, but got good service. We tried the steamed bun, gnocchi, mussels, dessert...  It was all super yummy!

- PORKBUN-PORKBUN-PORKBUN- 

Good Food is exactly what they say they are!

Sat at the Captains Table (where the chef prepares food) with my boyfriend. Because the plates are small you get to try a lot of different things. 

I started off with a blackberry mojito infused with jalapeno. It was delicious, it had hints of sweet and spicy that I've never had in a drink.

We started out by sharing everything - 

First the PORKBUN - sorry I get excited, but it's delicious, I'm sad that I had to share it, oh sweet regret!! 

We followed the bun with seared scallops, Korean beef, and pork tenderloin. All juicy, savory and delicious.

Since we still had room we each ordered a dessert - my boyfriend got the apple cake - warm with vanilla ice cream and caramel syrup. I got the pecan pie with banana ice cream and caramel sauce.

Good Food had a great atmosphere, and a friendly attentive wait staff. It was a pleasure talking to the chef at the captains table, very informative, and helpful with all our selections. We will be going back!
Just incredible and I love how often the menu changes! Get there early and don't be in a rush.

This place is definitely a great find in Charlotte. We came here for the first time on a Monday night, 3/2/15. We had heard the raving reviews from friends and reviews, so we gave it a try. We had a couple drinks and ordered the Scallops, Pork Bun, Shrimp & Andouille Risotto, Roasted Duck Gnocchi, and Quail. I give the gnocchi, scallops, and pork bun 5 stars! The gnocchi was our fave... the duck was awesome, the gnocchi was cooked perfectly, and the sauce is fantastic! And the portion was very generous for a small plate. Scallops with the grits were also fantastic. Pork bun was nice and big and the Asian flavors with the slaw were great! However, the quail was a bit underwhelming because it was kind of like a quail "chicken" fried tender. I would definitely skip next time. The shrimp & andouille risotto was also underwhelming... I think the risotto may have been overcooked and was bland IMO. 

The service was a bit slow, but the waiter explained that they were unusually busy for a Monday night. I will definitely be back! 4 stars b/c the food that was good was REALLY REALLY good.

Summary: One of the better meals I have had in a while.

Ponied up to the bar at about 6pm on a Thursday. Place opens at 5:30 and I recommend you don't arrive much later than that as it gets PACKED, and its a pretty quaint dining area. Grabbed a beer on tap: small, but very good selection of local and popular non-local beers. The Korean beef was fantastic, but the star of the show here is the Steamed Bun. Think of a melt-in-your-mouth Bahn Mi, crafted by the hands of angels. It is THAT good. The pork belly is so tender and flavorful and that steam bun is criminally good. Hoisin adds a bit of sweetness and slight tang, and the pickled vegetables off-set the soft texture with a nice little crunch. Great idea, brilliantly executed. Next time, I might just order 5 and plow through them. Better prepare for the "Oh are you expecting someone else?" question...

But I digress; this place is really really good. Do yourself a solid and check it out.

We have been a handful of times. Always had a yummy tapas dish. Never had to wait very long for a table either. The servers are good about asking if you've been in before or not as they like to explain how their setup works; Not everyone has been to a tapas style restaurant before and they want you to be comfortable and know what to expect. 
I always recommend this place to visitors and friends!

Quite good, but nothing really blew me away.  Nice vibe and friendly staff.
Definitely worth trying.

I've lived in Washington DC for the past 8 years and, honestly, Charlotte is not one of those cities I immediately think of as a "foodie" town.
