This is my third visit to Charlotte, and every meal I have eaten there has been nothing short of amazing. On a recent weekend trip, a good friend recommended we try out her favorite restaurant, Good Food. When we arrived, we were told the wait for a party of four was 2 hours. Ouch. But, we were had planned on hanging at the bar for a while, and it really gave us the chance to get nice and hungry for the meal.

Our group was all about trying lots of different things on the menu, and honestly, at some point, I think I lost track of what we ate. The cheese platter was an awesome way to start the meal -- all three (four?) cheeses were a big hit. As everyone has said, the mussels are to die for. There was more than a little bread dipping happening in the broth. The smell of truffle oil throughout the restaurant was overwhelming, so we had to indulge. Every calorie was well worth it. I personally had requested we order the braised duck fettuccine. I only wish I had some idea as to how that was made, because I could easily make that my last meal. But, the real show stopper... the mushrooms. Oh god. I want to drive the seven hours to get them just writing this. Nothing will ever replace the sentimental value of my grandmother's mushrooms, but these were out of this world. A beautiful smoky flavor with a complex stock and butter flavoring dancing with fresh herbs -- oregano, we believe? Yum, yum and yum.

Good Food is definitely on my I'll be back list. A full 5 stars would have happened if they would take reservations. My one and only negative comment about this fantastic place.

Having been to Barrington's and throughly enjoyed it, my wife and I decided to visit its sister restaurant. 

We got there at 6ish on a Monday. There were plenty of open tables at this time, so we were seated right away. Our server was friendly. She explained that we could order anything we wanted in any order. She also said that if we knew everything we wanted to try, but didn't want to flag her down whenever we were ready for our next course, she could take down our requests at the beginning and spread out the orders for us. This was impressive, because servers at tapas restaraunts like this have to be busy constantly. She was willing to monitor our progress with each course and time when to have the next dish fired off. She was definitely a pro.

We started with the charcuterie dish. Mortadella, speck, soprasetta, and a chicken liver/foie gras mousse topped with sweet, minced, pickled shallots. This came with grilled toast points. Quite tasty. My wife, who isn't a big fan of pate, even liked the mousse. Some of the speck was too fatty, but it was a good dish overall. 

Next, we had the Garganelli. The sausage was house-made (it had better be). The pasta and sauce reminded me of the Gnocchi I had at Barrington's, which is one of their signature plates. This was a solid dish. 

Then, we had the Seafood Tortellini, which was actually ravioli. Not sure what that was about. This was the most disappointing dish for me. The lobster foam, pasta, and chanterelles actually worked really well together. It may have been the best-tasting dish for me, but I couldn't find any lobster or crab to save my life. If I'm paying $16 for a small dish with 4 ravioli that are "filled" with lobster and crab, I have to be able to find some lobster and crab. I wasn't expecting a lot, but there was practically none. Not cool. 

We were pretty much full by the time our Vietnamese-stuffed Quail came. Our server told us that, although it didn't say it on the menu, the quail was actually filled with shrimp and pork. If she hadn't told me that, I wouldn't have noticed. (I did managed to discover a tinge of ham when I reheated my leftovers). The quail was fried, halved, and served on lettuce. It came with marinated cucumbers, which were pretending to be pickles. It sort of looked like a deconstructed chick-fil-a sandwich. My wife thought it tasted like a chicken finger. It was served with a tangy chili-lime dipping sauce rather than honey mustard.

I washed all this down with a pint of NoDa's Hop Drop 'N Roll, which is an excellent local beer. Good call on their part in having this in stock. 

All in all, it was a good experience. We checked this off on our list of places to try and discovered a new love for lobster foam. If we do end up going again, I'll try the pommes frites and steamed bun. Those seem to be home-runs according to everyone else. I'll also be skeptical of any dish they have that claims to be stuffed with seafood.

Good Food on Montford wasn't just good.  It was AMAZING!!!  Like in big, bold letters with lots of underlining and specialized font.

My hubby and I went there for a romantic yet chill dinner, and this place didn't disappoint.  It's got a trendy, dark, cool ambiance with lots of candles.  We were promptly seated at one of the cute high tops and had an awesome waitress.

Started off with the pumpkin mixed drink - and this is my only complaint really.  It was a little thick and hard to suck up the straw.  And the glass was FILLED with ice, which kept plunking in my face.  No so sexy.

But all of the food we ordered was divine!  The concept is small plates, like tapas. We got the butternut squash soup (which they thoughtfully divided up for us into two bowls rather than letting us make asses of ourselves passing the bowl back and forth) which was very sweet, dessert-like is what my hubby said.  The pork belly sandwich was great - not quite as amazing as what others had written, but still fabulous.  The scallops were INCREDIBLE!  I typically don't like scallops, but if they were typically prepared like this, I would ALWAYS order them!  They were fluffy and light, prepared with an incredible risotto like side dish.  Our final dinner plate was the garganelli, which was by far my favorite.  It was a little spicy, just enough for a kick.  The sausage was incredible!

We couldn't pass up on dessert.  I had a chocolate-espresso pot de creme - fabulously rich in a great way.  I had a tough time finishing it though.  It's a little heavy, but not in a fudge way where you can feel it from the first bite.  You think you can finish the whole thing, but then the heaviness slowly sneaks up on you.  Or maybe I just ate too much in general.  Hubby had the pumpkin cake, which was quite delish too.  Can't comment on the cheesecake ice cream as I'm not a fan of cheesecake, but judging on how he ate all of his dessert without barely offering to share, I think he was quite happy.

All in all, yummy, fabulous place for a date night.  Although I saw some groups of friends who seemed to be having a good time too.

Still holding a 5 star rating. Thursday evening I had the smoked almond appetizer, beet salad and North Carolina style Flounder with Risotto. Really good, total culinary experience, wow. A business associate with me was mesmerized by this restaurant. 

Great service as usual, nice crowd., just an awesome place.

Met a friend here for dinner...both being out of towners, we were up for sharing so that we could try more. Just a little shy of 5 stars, but so close. I'll start with the few downsides: the tables are a little cramped, which gives the impression that people nearby could listen in, and the parking lot was very cramped and does not have nearly enough spaces to accommodate everyone inside when all tables are seated. On a cold, rainy night, this was a little frustrating. Oh, and you know how people usually complain that restaurants are too cold? I don't know how the staff was still alive in this place: the heat was cranking!

But then the food and service made up for it. The purple sweet potato and apple gratin was delicious! Almost anything is good with herbed goat cheese, but this sweet/salty combo hit all the right flavors. The truffle fries were...truffle fries. The fries were cooked very well. Truffle is not my thing and the parmesan on these was a little much, but the cook on the fries was perfect! I thought the taco dish we got could have been a little better, but it was solid. And the favorite: udon. Wow. Delicious. We finished every drop and sort of fought (nicely) over the last serving in the bowl. 

The desserts we didn't share, which is fine. I got the pot de crème and it was a little bowl of chocolate heaven. Imagine fancy, fancy pudding. Not too sweet, perfectly chocolate. And the waiter even iced down a coffee for me, which I thought was very nice. Basically, any time you ask for something not on the menu and they come up with a creative way to accommodate you, it's special!

All that and just $60 to split...not bad at all!

This place was amazing! The wait took awhile, but luckily two spots opened up at the bar so we just sat there. It was my boyfriend and my first time there so we took a couple suggestions from our server/bartender. We got a variety of things:  the mussels, which were by far our favorite. It was soaked in green curry and made an amazing sauce for the pita bread. The parmesan gnocchi, Korean beef and the pomme frites. Everything was great, the service, atmosphere, and food.  We will definitely be back.
The food was good but it wasn't worth the price. We've visited restaurants that are very pricey but that we feel it is worth every penny, Montford was good but nothing extraordinary.

Amazing service and atmosphere. It's fun but upscale but not pretentious. I haven't had to wait before, but I try to get there at open because I hear there can be a line. The green mussels and the scallops were my favorite things we ate. I enjoyed but would not order again the short rib and the venison. 

I really liked the pink sweet bubbling wine we had. And my margarita was very strong and it was delicious. I can't wait to go back!! It was about $200 for 2 people (including tip).
My favorite eatery in Charlotte this far. Although, I am trying to find more that add up. I've eaten here 3 times, so about 15 dishes, all but 1 were really flavorful, fresh tasting & balanced.

My dinner at Good Food on Montford was easily the highlight of my recent trip to Charlotte! I arrived early into their dinner service on a Wednesday evening and, while enjoying a Rosemary Collins on the patio, I watched as the entire dining room filled up before my eyes. Thank you, Yelp, for steering me here; I can tell I'm in the right place!

I sat down to dinner at the bar and ordered three dishes:

- The Pork Bun: a MUST! I could have eaten half a dozen of these succulent little wonders. Sweet, salty, spicy, pillowy - perfection!
- The Korean Beef: a tasty marinade and an elegant presentation made this a close second favorite.
- The Carnitas tacos: enjoyable, but my least favorite of the three dishes. The meat was well-prepared but the whole dish reads a bit dry in the mouth; it was missing something to balance the mouthfeel. A mango salsa would have put it over the top! 

The service at the bar was great and I enjoyed my leisurely meal with great relish. You may wish to note: if you are seeking to eat a full meal here, you should plan on about 3 dishes per person. Honestly, I could have gone for four. This puts a meal here squarely in the $$$ category, alcohol notwithstanding. The small plates here would also be great for a drinks-and-appetizers date as opposed to a full dinner. 

I had a great experience here and I wouldn't hesitate to return for another special meal when I am back in Charlotte!

Montford delivers what it sells. Trendy ambiance, modest wait times, well mixed drinks, and delicious food. Waiter was very friendly and helpful, and made this dinner thoroughly enjoyable. Loved the gnocchi, fish special, and pork belly. Will come back here again.

Last night was the second time I've eaten at Good Food and it was just as incredible as the first time. A few menu changes since the last time we were there, which is great. The small plates are perfect portions full of flavor. The Garganelli with house made sausage is my favorite. The sautéed mushrooms are a great start and the brownie with biscoff ice cream is a perfect dessert. Our server/bartender was Mike on both visits and his level of service is impeccable. We will be back again and again.

I was glad to have been introduced to this quaint place. Good Food on Montford is an environment that can be dressed up or dressed down. The food is EXCELLENT! It is the perfect date night location. The only downside to this restaurant is that they don't take reservations and it is common to wait an hour or more on a Friday night. I assure you though, the food is worth every minute waited. 

My go to selections are the Sticky Bun, Korean Beaf and Shrimp. The small plates give you an opportunity to share among the table and try it all. Don't get too full though because the desserts are to die for. The brownie with cookie butter is AMAZING! 

What I love about this place though is I always leave filled, but not too full. It is fine dinning eating experience but reasonably priced.

Walked in and was a little slow getting seated so I was left standing there for a while. Definitely a great date place, with a little bit of a laid back setting. Open brick walls and Waitress told me about 3 items which have been on the menu since the restaurant opened. (Pei mussels, steamed Bun, and Garnelli), then gave me a little time to decide. Wow even the bread amazed me here!!!! Crispy crust, and warm and soft innards.

PEI (Prince Edward Island) mussels $12 - 15 small /mussels with green curry sauce and a pita. The curry sauce is amazing and I've seen people dip all kinds of things in it including the pomme fries, the bread , the rice from the Korean BBQ. Sadly the mussels were a little underwhelming. And definitely on the small side. I do love the idea of mussels and green curry sauce though and this is a must have.

Pomme Frites  $6 MUST HAVE - Holy Moly Guacamole! The fries are heavily seasoned so if you dont like heavily seasoned fries these aren't for you. Each bite of the fries is super salty and when dipped in the above curry, you get an unique taste.

Korean Beef with Rice $12 - This was probably the worst of the three tapas I got. Three different types of sauces, a small portion of fried rice, and a small portion of fried ribs. Ribs were soft and tender, but you can get better short ribs elsewhere.

Chocolate Cookie icecream cookie $7 MUST HAVE - This was by far the best icecream sandwich ever. Two white chocolate macadamia nut cookies with cajeta icecream (Mexican Caramel icecream) sandwiched in between the cookies. Then they dip the entire side of the cookie with white chocolate and macadamia nuts. They gave me a knife and a spoon to cut the icecream, but it was difficult and I suggest just getting one just for yourself. THIS ICE CREAM MADE THIS REVIEW 5 STARS!

Overall a great restaurant, with quaint decorations and country music. I would come again.
Get in early.  Food and cocktails and wine was and is amazing. It's a little noisy but always packed so you know you're going to be in for a treat!

I loved my experience here! Went for dinner with a friend and we were both blown away by the quality and taste of our food. The dessert was also incredible, lavender almost like a sponge cake, delicious. I highly recommend you check out this restaurant! Yum I cannot wait to go back!!

Great food and a great place for us for several years, until recently ruined by a rude, argumentative waitress.  Before ordering, we asked to have the check split between two couples, a request which has never been a problem in the past. We know the bottom of the menu advises that they do not do this...so we have appreciated the accommodation and always ask first.  We were quite surprised by the swiftness, tone and finality of her response, so someone said, politely, " well it's just that we have been coming here for a while and they have always done it, but we understand." The next response was more of a retaliation  - we were told that she has worked there for 3 1/2 half years and they NEVER do this. We did not say anything further. 

We each ordered 3 items. The items come out when ready from the kitchen, in no particular order and we were busy talking. By the time we noticed that one person had only gotten 1 item, everyone else was almost finished eating.  She said the kitchen didn't have the ticket, but it was obvious it was her mistake. The missing items finally came, just as we were ready to say forget it. They comped one item, and we got a half-hearted apology from the waitress, no manager in site. Likely we won't be back....

Tops for tapas. Good Food lives up to its name and then some. From the food to the wait staff, this place knows what they are doing and does with finesse. Not pretentious but they could be because the food is THAT good. Knowledgeable staff, top quality ingredients that change seasonally, lively atmosphere and creative dishes that aren't overthought.  Eating my way through Charlotte, and Good Food on Montfort ranks #1 so far.

This place can be hard to get into but is worth the trouble. It's small plates and can be fun to try many menu items. The drinks are made well from the bar. Very cool modern vibe. Service is friendly and informative.

I have been here several times over the past few years and I'm struggling to leave this not so positive review. Good Food is very popular and the reviews are great for the most part but I just don't see it. The food is okay I guess but the menu is very limited. That's not even it though. I can find something that I like to eat pretty much anywhere. So, we like to sit at the bar as opposed to a private table. The regular bartender has been there a very long time and I have had multiple encounters with him. I am not sure how to accurately describe him but in my experience he is surly and acts like he is irritated and annoyed every time I've been here. I tip well and do not think that I am too high maintenance but he comes across like he is doing me a "favor"to even wait on me. As someone that patrons restaurants all the time, I quite frankly feel uncomfortable here. We received a gift card to Good Food this past Christmas and I was disappointed that it was not for a place that I actually want to go back to. People go out and spend their money to have a nice meal, good drinks and enjoy a welcoming and inviting atmosphere and sadly this is not the place. In fact, we still have money left on our gift card but will not be going back here. This is unfortunate because Montford could benefit from a place that is more upscale from the typical bars. This is not the place.

The food was so delish! The menu changes but each time I went it was good. Even food I wouldn't normally order was good. Small serving so we ordered to share which is also why I was overwhelmed with goodness. The cocktails. Let's talk about the cocktails. I am not a Bourbon drinking but when they call it tea and put a peach in it. It became so tasty. The service kept the food and drinks coming and a good time was had by all! Always recommend this place!
Great food small plates so be sure that's what you are looking for not cheap though. For 3 people with drinks $150.00
